Reviews.Title: “Family get together.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Enjoyed our stay and the service from all the staff was very good. Would have no problem recommending this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money poor friendliness poor”
Reviews.Author: 2012Holidays Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found that the only thing going for this Hotel is its location - the rooms are overpriced, dusty and not up to standard, the concierge was very rude to us and the staff at check in and out were unfriendly. I was very disappointed in the room and the staff and will never set foot at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Stay”
Reviews.Author: apple423 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for a conference stay - we felt very comfortable and the service was not intrusive - the bar refrigerator was a little noisy. We had no real complaints

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: saharabeachregulars
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights before flying upto Cairns. It was well worth the money could not fault anything. The breakfast was AMAZING the best breakfast i have ever had.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a great location”
Reviews.Author: wendycooke Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No real complaints about this hotel. I thought it was very reasonably priced for the great location. It is worth paying a little extra for a room with a view over darling harbour. We had two double beds in our room. The mattress on one was a bit hard. Internet connection was not included in the price. Service was good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: ph-faisal Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good in all aspects. clean, rooms are very good and big. the only issue is it is expensive so if you can have a good deal then it will be the best hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Family stay feedback”
Reviews.Author: fourharveys4 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The children enjoyed the computers and wii facilities and we enjoyed being able to sit and enjoy a coffee. Reception at departure was not the most pleasant. Bar staff on Sunday afternoon was extremely helpful and pleasant. Find that there are not enough family rooms available in hotels sharing beds with children is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: Chalfont55
Reviews.Content: On check in we paid extra for a harbour view room and were not disappointed. Stayed here 3 nights 5,6,7th Feb.Busy hotel used by airline crews and so is of a high standard.The bar has a happy hour for beers and some wines which is good as we found Australia extremely expensive.The hotel is next to a huge shopping mall where you can get reasonably priced breakfast at the food courts.The monorail station is 2 mins walk away and the CBD is easily reached by foot from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Gillian T
Reviews.Content: We will definitely not go there again. The beds were SO uncomfortable, we had to put the mattress on the floor (and it was STILL uncomfortable) The breakfast reminded me of when I took my kids on school camp. Very disorganised and tardy. You had to line up, even if you didn't want the 1 poor lonely chef cooking eggs. If you left your table, they took the food away, even if you hadn't started it - a great waste. Surely this cost, could help pay for more staff. Very understaffed, and breakfast running out and not being replaced. Only redeeming feature is the view, tho no balconies to admire it from

Reviews.Title: “Some Good and Bad News”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, staff super friendly, efficient and appear to enjoy their work. However, we had issues with the bathroom as I was travelling with a friend who is confined to a Wheel Chair. We found the shower recess very small , approximately 1 metre square, not at all suitable as a "wheel chair friendly" room as he couldn't sit in a position without his toe tips touching the wall whilst he was bathed. The so called "Shower Chair" supplied was not the proper type as it had no drain holes in the seat, it appeared to be just an ordinary Plastic Chair, the water pooled in the seat making it just that more unpleasant & difficult when the shower had finished. In addition, the absence of towel rails or hooks made it VERY difficult to store or hang our wet towels after use. In essence, the Bathroom Room in 501 is most unstable as a Wheel Chair accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of Syd, nice price”
Reviews.Author: nikw32
Reviews.Content: I think the Novotel is one of the best choices for a Sydney stay for around $250 a night. Make sure you get the city view room to enjoy a stunning view over Darling Harbour and the city skyline. Much nicer view than CBD hotels, and a lovely, short walk to the CBD anyway. We spent a lovely 3 days walking all over the city, to Circular Quay, Botanical Gardens, QVB, restaurants (loved 360, very special). The Novotel Darling Harbour was a great, reasonably priced break (especially if you're a member of Accor Advantage club, as we are). On previous visits, the food has been lovely, but this time it wasn't the usual standard, unfortunately. We both ordered beef fillet, which was cooked just as we ordered, and a lovely cut of beef, but came with no sauce/jus and just steamed vegetables. And that was that. Extremely bland. We asked the waitress if sauce would be possible and she found some luke warm 'garlic sauce' which was ok, better than nothing. We ordered ginger puddings, which turned out to be microwaved cakes, again no sauce! Completely dry, in fact. Just ice cream on the side. Quite disappointing, didn't eat mine. Breakfast is usually great here, with a gorgeous view too. The second morning, however, was pretty busy and the poor chef was all by himself and seemed really stressed (was no wonder, he was trying to keep everything stocked while cooking short orders too). Needless to say there were many build-ups of people waiting for sausages/eggs/mushrooms/tomatoes that had been depleted. When I got there everything was empty. I really felt sorry for him. Overall though, a great choice for a Sydney getaway, but best when special occasions (eg Easter) don't bring the set menus and crowds. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and scenic”
Reviews.Author: klewi
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at this hotel. Chose it for it's close proximity to Star City casino as we were attending a show at the Lyric Theatre. We were allocated a superior harbour view room on the 8th floor at the IMAX theatre and Convention Centre end of the hotel. Room had spectacular views of Darling Harbour and the city skyline. Definitely recommend spending the extra money ($30 in our case) for the harbour view room. Room was comfortable but not spacious. Bed was fantastic. Staff were consistently friendly and helpful. Had a lovely meal that evening at the hotel's restaurant Dish, A Restaurant which included mains of wallaby fillet and baby snapper. Easy walk to the Harbourside shopping centre and restaurants. Biggest negative - $45 fee for overnight parking.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: dickcarey
Reviews.Content: Quick trip up to Sydney to see the Harry Potter exhibition with husband, daughter and grandson. Stayed in an executive suite which was huge with plenty of room and privacy for all of us. Bonus were the fireworks on Saturday night right outside our window overlooking the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Describe the service you experienced: very good. Staff were well mannered Tell us how you liked the room excellant room, spacous and clean. Great views of the city Talk about the location & amenities Loacation is what this hotel has. Close to city and darling harbour and shops. haymarket as well all easy walking distance Say what you liked best & least the rooms and hotel position Least your breakfast. Not fresh and the food was a bit dry/cool.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CHOICE WHEN I VISIT SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: SURFER_DUDE44
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay here first when I come to Sydney. However, some of my trips are last minute affairs and the hotel is booked solid. Then I go to plan B. Darling Harbour is a wonderful experience and the Novatel fits in perfectly. If this is your first and only time in Sydney, you must get a room with a view otherwise don't waste your time and money. The view opposite Darling is just a generic view of a neighborhood (if you didn't know you were in Sydney, you could be anywhere when you look at the backside of the hotel). Rooms are clean, functional and drop dead quiet. You will get a good nights sleep here. This place is mainly about location and it has no equal at Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views of Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: chrishayward
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for our 25th Wedding Anniversary mid week. We stayed in one of the Loft Studio's which was expensive but I thought well worth it. The loft is spacious split into two levels both have stunning views over looking Darling Harbour. At night the lights were magic. The breakfast was good with a good selection, coffee awful. When we were checking out there was a line the hotel is very busy and we waited. I feel that the staff could be a little more friendly excluding the restaurant staff which were friendly. I am also glad that they waived the $45 parking fee, which I feel could be included in the room charge. However it was a lovely evening and the twinkle of the night lights, magic

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service experienced in any hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Helen W
Reviews.Content: I prepaid a room on-line through hotel.com, it was my mistake in leaving my license in my car in Melbourne (no photo I.D.) so the "ever so charming", NOT, acting manager would not check my friend & me in. My friend offered to pay for another room as he had I.D. We were told they had no other room. When he offered to pay again for the room I had already paid for, we were told that is already booked & prepaid for my me!! Told me to sort it out with hotel.com. I rang hotel .com who confirmed my phone number & email address and asked to speak to this "charming" acting manager, who then told hotel.com to speak to reservations, who spoke to front desk again, back to HIM!! I spent half an hour on an 1800 number on my mobile at the suggestion of this a........, when he had no intention of doing anything! Then he looked out the window & said we could walk to the Hilton & try there! Hope this a........ never gets to be a fully fledged manager! As it happened a very nice taxi driver took us to the Park Royal, much friendlier! Hotel.com have said Novatel will not refund my money.

Reviews.Title: “Loveless experience”
Reviews.Author: Jack J Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Long queue at check in, but at least my room was ready at 11am. Room was very big, but why oh why don't they use the space to put a chest of drawers in - I had to live out of my suitcase for a week as the 2 tiny drawers in the wardrobe were jammed full of hotel items. Disappointed there was no bathrobe, but otherwise everything was clean. The internet charges are high (you get 300mb download free but that goes nowhere these days) which I think is a ripoff in this day and age. The hotel is obviously well booked due to its location on Darling Harbour, but there is no effort made to go an extra yard to make you feel welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel down in Darling harbour, close to everything. However, considering the rather expensive room rates, I was surprised that unlimited free wifi was not included. But I'm from Europe, and we never have to pay for wifi in a hotel. For a business traveler, this became a significant amount in a week. Good service and nice, quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good location... and healthy!”
Reviews.Author: hermanjvr
Reviews.Content: great location for business... very well maintained with friendly staff... focus on health... nice gym and yoga tv... organic options for breakfast... great location for restaurants in the evening...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice view”
Reviews.Author: sandrine69_13
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Australia and was to glad to see the harbour upon arrival. The front office staff was not that friendly altough I presented my silver A Club but OK, I understand very well that the check-in is at 3.00pm! I had a snack on the day of arrival in the bar and there the staff was very friendly, helpful, attentive to any need. I recommend for tourists that want to visit the center of Sydney, quickly accessible,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferjane58
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times and each time it has been a pleasure. We had no trouble finding our way around, and with both the light rail, monorail at our doorstep it was easy to do so. The close proximity to darling harbour and harbourtown was also a bonus. Our room was lovely, each time we were on the 10th floor with beautiful views of darling harbour. Issues with the beds were sorted immediately by the friendly staff. There were no noise issues at all, restaurant on site had awesome happy hours which could be enjoyed on the verandah overlooking the harbour. Free apple Mac computers on this level too. Pool was slight disappointment, although adequate, (I am from north Queensland where this things are important!). Everything is within easy walking distance from this hotel as well, lots of great cafes and restaurants sp no need to prepare your own food. The only problem we had was that the blackout blinds made it too easy to sleep in and miss some of the day! Leave the blinds open a crack to avoid this! Will be back defi itely!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: favenmarg
Reviews.Content: I had a harbour view room, which did have a great view. The location is very convenient for the convention centre, and provides easy access to the main Sydney sights. The hotel breakfast buffet was very good and convenient, although not cheap. The staff were very helpful, and overall this was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, close to everything and excellent for a young family. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone however leave the car at home. The $80 parking bill for 2 nights was an unpleasant surprise as it was not stated anywhere on my booking information.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found this location to be very convenient to Darling Harbour and the Harbour. Facilities and service were quite good. Could do with another chair in the room for two. Staff were polite and helpful. Food in the restaurant was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney, Novotel”
Reviews.Author: jaydy g
Reviews.Content: Hello. I have had a chance to stay at this Hotel. I is not ideal for everyone. My room smelt all musky, I saw a cockroach run across the floor. One of the door men was not ver happy and snorty. The others were helpful and directed us when we asked. The breakfast was not very nice. I hope this helped you very much.They did not give us very well service, because the cleaners did not even give new loo paper, the shower nosle was horrible. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Novotel on Darling Harbour Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Novotel many imes over the years and I feel the quality and variety in the restuarant has really slipped in the past eighteen months, The reason we stay isnthat itis really central to most things.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best aspect here”
Reviews.Author: liveitup8
Reviews.Content: Sorry Novotel but some time needs to be taken to look at some aspects of your Darling Harbour hotel. The hallways are in a bad way and the furnishings appear the same. The high price you pay to stay here is purely to put you in a good location. If youâ€™re expecting to have a nice room and well kept surroundings included in the price â€“ Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Is this the worst hotel in Sydney?”
Reviews.Author: Shdalton
Reviews.Content: Dirty moldy bathroom, dirty stained and unraveling carpet, seriously scuffed furnishings, with iron burn mark. Tv reception fuzzy. Harbor view was actually circular quay. Grotty and disgusting. When I spoke to staff at front desk about it, they snootily told me it was a superior delux room! Felt like a fool for staying - especially now when I see what else is on offer in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Musty, tired and not quite up to the usual Novotel standard”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: Staying on the 8th floor....there is a musty, damp smell on the floor and in my room too. Nothing too offensive but not right either. I am disappointed at how tired the decor in the room is with scratched and dented woodwork with thin walls. The bathroom has seen better days too. As an A Club member and a fan of Novotel's around the world this is not the standard you usually get. I am travelling on business and my non-fussy colleague is the one that mentioned it also.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded required for beds and linen”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is 4 star establishment which failed to live up to expectations. New beds and crisp white linen is needed. I recently stayed at Novotel Hamilton NZ which was an absolute delight, it's a shame this hotel didn't meet my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: DukeOfCumberland
Reviews.Content: Having visited Sydney a number of times on business, I had spotted this place. This time I was on a holiday trip with the family. The location is just perfect. Just behind darling harbour (linked to the shopping centre by a covered walkway). For it's location it is excellent value, but don't think you are getting a 5* hotel. It is not, but if you want one you will pay twice as much or more. The staff were very hepful, and polite even in the face of the onslaught of a woman at reception who was trying to blag a free night ! I would most definitely use this as a holiday base again. I have given it "excellent" on the basis of what it is and where it is for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Vinylstatistics
Reviews.Content: Generally a well maintained and pleasant hotel. Like many hotels in the mid range it is frequented by aircrew which gives it a transitory feel but the staff are well drilled and effective. Rooms are fine although some rooms cramp up the desk against the beds. Clean bathrooms but no separate shower or bath in standard rooms. Swimming pool is tiny, splash only really but the gym whilst small is well equipped. Tennis court is worth packing your racket for if you have the time. Really impressed with service throughout the hotel and if you can upgrade to a harbour view it really is worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SezzieM
Reviews.Content: As a member of the A Club I stayed here whilst on a business trip, I was happy with an upgrade to a harbour view room which was nice. The hotel has all the amenities one requires, its clean, no frills but not downmarket in feel. The breakfast in the morning is really nice if expensive. The mattresses are in need of replacement but I appreciated the total blackout blind/curtains which made for a much better sleep despite the mattress. I recommend if you get a cheap rate and if they replace the mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Greeted with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival to hotel I was greeted with a smile from the Front desk staff. My check in took no time at all. My room was pristine clean and a view of Darling Harbour was a bonus. The bed was extremely comfortable however I personally like firmer pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: nm199545
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed here last weekend. We had booked a room with 2 double beds for $411, including breakfast for 4 on a saturday night. When we arrived in the room there was also a day bed. I asked housekeeping for extra sheets and a duvet and they offered to make up the day bed for no extra charge. I also changed our pillows for no extra charge. All beds and pillows were very comfortable. We used the small gym in the morning - only 4 exercise machines and swam in the pool. Sadly no time for tennis. We were very happy with the any day any session Harry potter exhibition tickets in the Powerhouse museum which were included in our room ticket. 24 hour parking was only $40. Breakfast was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: CarolWoc
Reviews.Content: Loved it, lovely rooms, great breakfast, wonderful view of Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay to go to the theatre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was good and the service also. Found the menu for dinner a little expensive and a bit limited. A very good location for the theatre at the Casino and handy to the monorail to go to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mike u
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Sydney and Novotel made it a whole lot better. the location was great with many restaurants nearby as well as a shopping mall and a cinema. The hotel is only a 15 minute walk to the city and a 10 minute walk to the casino. Lobby has several computers and a wii for the kids. The rooms are very spacious and bright with great views of the harbor. The staff were very friendly and helpful although it took us about 45 minutes to check-in. The breakfast had a large variety and it was very good. I would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for families”
Reviews.Author: aussieleigh22
Reviews.Content: First of all note one thing - this hotel is in Darling Harbour - it does not overlook Sydney Harbour, the bridge or the Opera House! That said, it has a wonderful outlook over Darling Harbour and across the Sydney CBD. Provided you are not expecting to look out your window and see the Bridge - you won't be disappointed with this hotel. We booked interconnecting rooms overlooking the Harbour for a 2 night stay for our family of 4. The rooms were spacious, clean, well stocked with toiletries and other essentials. Whilst waiting for check-in, our children played Wii in the Lobby (wonderful after the 1hr flight, taxi ride etc.!) whilst housekeeping checked the room and immediately notified that it was ready. The monorail is right outside the hotel door and this gave us access to the city, where we caught the train to Circular Quay and the ferry to Taronga Zoo, and the Powerhouse Museum to see the Harry Potter Exhibition. Darling Harbour Shopping Centre was fairly unappealing, but there is a small supermarket, liquor store and restaurants that you can buy take-away food from. We ate at a restaurant in Darling Harbour one night - NOT a pleasurable experience, we waited over 1 1/2 hrs for our main meal to arrive and NO we did not order an entree!!! Second night decided to eat in the room! We ordered room service for the children from the children's menu with extra vegetables. The steak had been overcooked and the mashed potato, whilst yummy for adults was laden with pepper. We pre-paid extra for breakfast, well worth it when travelling with younger children. The choice was excellent and the food fresh. This hotel is also walking distance to the Star Casino - which is where we went to see Annie - the Musical. We found Tumbalong Park - around from Darling Harbour - a fantastic series of parks, water play areas, carousels etc for children, just before we had to get in the taxi to leave - my kids could have spent half a day playing there and were very disappointed to not have their bathers on! So find it early in your stay!! Checkout hassle-free, taxi waiting to take us to the airport. A great base for a family stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Condition of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There was a mess up with the rooms.wanted us to change after we had used bathroom and tea and coffee but when they found that our they said we could stay put.. the pillows were just awful too soft and the blinds were torn and were very difficult to put up and down. The coffee shop service was very slow John was especially good on arrival and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “It is an excellent and elegant hotel and very very handy location to everything you want to go to”
Reviews.Author: Alec W Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist you should choose this hotel as it offers everything you require and need. It is very classy and stylish. The atmosphere is very friendly and great service when you need it. The unique part is they have 6 internets and very comfortable seat for you to sit on when using the internet and also it is free which I enjoyed using. The views in this hotel is spectacular and I was extremely lucky to see the fireworks in Darling Harbour and it reminded me of our New Year fireworks at Auckland's Sky Tower - absolutely wonderful to watch. I am extremely lucky to have stayed at this hotel at the right time. I recommend this hotel to all Australians plus all the Tourists from the World.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbour side location but rather overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at Novotel Sydney. The hotel has a great adjacent location to the harbour side, Darling Harbour. A great selection of food at your door step. And it is pretty close to Sydney CBD area too, not to mention the Chinatown area. A great location after all. Room is relatively large and a good sized bathroom. It is equipped with a large television and an ipod dock as well. The bed is comfortable too and I love the pillow selections. However the bathroom is rather old and dirty. I can see many dark spots in the bath tub. I can't be bothered to use it since it looks so mouldy and disgusting! They also limit the free wifi usage in the lobby for 30 minutes. So far I traveled throughout the countries in many different hotels, I have never encountered a hotel who limits the free wifi in the lobby but Novotel Sydney. If it is in the room that is limited, I can understand, but in the lobby? All in all, a nice stay but do look for other hotels with more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Average Room and Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location, relatively large rooms and excellent views of Darling Harbour and the city at night. However, the decor of the rooms is 1960's and the hotel is extremely over-priced. Plenty of other hotels in the Harbour / The Rocks area of Sydney with better rooms, and locations / views just as nice for less money.

Reviews.Title: “.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the harbour, awesome view, staff were so helpful,food great, only downside was our bed could have done with a new mattress, other than that great central to everything base your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fantastic location. Have stayed here many times over the years and have never been disappointed. Stayed in a junior suite overlooking Darling Harbour which is a stunning view. The room was huge and very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Plenty to do in the area with shopping and great restaurants on your doorstep and it is only a short walk into city centre or Chinatown. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Austrlia Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great location, reasonably priced but the parking cost is a bit high. I stay here every day Australia day (grat to see the fireworks). The Pool can be a little bigger and a pool attendant at the pool would be would be even better. The gymis awesome, sate of the art and near the pool to cool off after a work out.

Reviews.Title: “good time had by all”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff were very helpful, the hotel was very clean and I would highly recommend to anyone. Great location in Darling Harbour close to everything. Rooms although were quite small were ok if you dont spend a lot of time in them. Perhaps should have more options for families with only one adult and children more single beds needed in rooms not just rollaways!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our night at the Novatel on Darling Harbour was most enjoyable. The room was reasonably spacious and very comfortable. The staff were excellent and very cooperative. Check-in and check-out were simple and quick, and the Bell Boy was of great assistance with our luggage. The buffet breakfast was excellent - offering a very good variety of food. The only negative was that there was not much coffee or tea supplied in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a stunning view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location â€“ the room was great with fabulous views over Darling Harbour and their service was good. Only disappointment was that none of the hot breakfast dishes were better than lukewarm.

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: shorties049
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our daughter, son-in-law and 2 grandchildren. The location is wonderful , rooms were very comfortable and the staff were highly professional, friendly and were the icing on the cake. one stands out-Michael, on reception, who could not have been more helpful. We are returning in March, again with the family, this time for 2 nights. We have stayed at other Accor hotels and find their standards of service extremely high. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and found it quite good. This time we were very disappointed the quality of food at the restaurant for dinner. We ordered fish which was very dry and hard to eat. The waiter asked us what our meals were like and we indicated the fish was very dry. His response was to provide the wine courtesy of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Apart from a glitch in the IT system (which delayed our check in) this was a great stay. The dinner in the restaurant was outstanding. We walked across to Darling Harbour and the city that evening after dinner and walked down to harbour side the next morning for breakfast and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Our Annual Mother/Daughter Holiday at the Novotel, Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is our 8th annual Monther/Daughter Holiday. Only six out of the eight years has been at the Novotel at Darling Harbour as we decided to try some of the other ACCOR hotels in Sydney, but we are always drawn back to the Novotel at D H. We are always treated by friendly and helpful staff who are very respectful and professional and have a great sense of humour. This year my daughter and I used teh business centre to see the UAC university offers. My daughter was offered her irst preferesnce for university and the staff helped to make this even more special with their good wishes and the offer of complimentary drinks at the bar. We always feel as though the Novotel at D H is like our second home.

Reviews.Title: “A Short Stay but a Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location walking distance to the Powerhouse Museum (Harry Potter Exhibition), the Maritime Museum, Darling Harbour, the Sydney Fish Markets and The Star (Andriano Zumbo). I especially appreciated the proximity of the Monorail station next to the hotel which meant getting around was so much easier. Every member of the Hotel staff showed us great customer service and they were always helpful. Staying at this hotel made our short visit to Sydney memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure Time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was quite good, we just didn't get our room until about 3.30pm and the front desk was very apologetic but were unsure about why that had happened. The location is fantastic as it is close to everything. The rooms with the darling harbour view are probably the ones I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Darling Harbour is in a great location that is convenient for both business and leisure travellers. Room was a good size and in OK condition but bathroom was very poor and needed cleaning and maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Novotel Darling Harbour on previous occasions and it has always rated very highly with us. On check in there was a somewhat lengthy delay with our booking as I had only booked on line at lunch time that same day and it had apparently not come through from Accor. The Manager himself ended up dealing with the situation and provided a room upgrade to compensate.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at your hotel. Quality staff throughout the whole hotel from my first step in to my last step out!! My wife was not well on our stay to your hotel but you accomodated perfectly, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the bar service.”
Reviews.Author: Adrian182
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice now, and have no complaints about the hotel. Staff at reception have been very obliging, the rooms are clean, and cannot be faulted. However, when it comes to the hotel's bar service, it leaves a lot to be desired. Every time I have ever been there, it has been understaffed and those staff serving the bar have been less than helpful. On our most recent occasion, we ordered drinks and food. After a long wait to even order my drinks, I was instructed by the only bar tender to wait for him to make the drinks as they did not have enough staff to walk it over where I was sitting. This was not a once-off occurrence. Recommend that you drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our young teenage kids. A little squeezy with only 1 bathroom and two large double beds, but it was the only configuration we could afford. The big drawcard is location. With the tram just below the hotel and Darling Harbour a two minute stroll, everything is handy. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We got lucky with early check in and so could start our exploration of Sydney soon after arrival around 11am (the bell staff would have gladly stored our bags, anyway). Free Nintendo for the kids in the lobby, the all-important hairdryer and kettle were all supplied. Wifi is expensive, but there is free internet in the lobby. Overall, a great base for our trip to Sydney. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ouli P
Reviews.Content: Fantastically located right on darling Harbour...close to all admenities and public transport!! Ideal :)

Reviews.Title: “January visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We used our complementry night as we often do at this loaction. We have observed delcline oin value over the years. Mainly the restarant is poor value and poor service. Using intinerant workers that do not really care. We were not even asked what we would like to drink. The steak I had was quite nice but for steak and chips just as well i was paying half price.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stayover”
Reviews.Author: Richard4801
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a two day stayover at Novotel Darling Harbour provided by AMEX Rewards. We have previously taken a similar reward and were greatly disappointed [see Manly Hotel report] and even though we were looking forward to the short break our expectations of the quality of room to be provided was not great. We were soooooo wrong. From the point of driving into Novotel and coming into contact with a member of staff we were treated royally. We received an offer of assistance with our luggage and given direction to where we could park. Parking is convenient and closeby reception. At reception we were greeted by 'Joanne'. The gorgeous smile and pleasant but professional attitude of this young lady will surely prove to be a wonderful asset in her chosen career. Although we had overlooked the necessary paperwork [left it at home] 'nothing' was a trouble to Joanne and we were quickly processed and provided with our keys. To our surprise we were given an upgrade to a beautiful room overlooking the Harbourside Complex that permitted an uninterupted view of the Saturday night fireworks. During our two night stay we continued to experience great service from all staff. The Novotel is in close proximity to numerous restaurants, the casino, pubs and pub lunches, amusements, boat rides etc etc. If you haven't been there yet, perhaps it should be on your bucket list. We were booked out by the same young lady, she had that same wonderful warm attitude that will ensure that we will stayover at the Novotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A good nighst sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All that we required for a over nights stay in Sydney Good food,quiet room, comfortable bed & easy good breakfast and easy access to the docks so we could depart the next day. Thankyou.( just a shame that your review page is not as user friendly i didn't want to write 200 words now I am writing a lot of dribble).

Reviews.Title: “PLEASURABLE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The gentleman who served us at check in ( reception) was very professional and customer focused. He put us in a good mood from the beginning as he was polite and caring. Fred at the bar was very good as well and made sure we had what we needed to enjoy our lunch eg: condiments etc. and checked on us to make sure all was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Attracting serious clients”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of your loft rooms - excellent facilities. But I am a small business owner and consequently always have work that needs doing while on holidays. The rooms provide a desk - two in fact - but neither of them have a desk lamp and that makes it difficult to work at the desks. Also, the tea ands coffee supply was not replenished and when working I like to have a cup of tea and another cup of tea etc. Great venue - needs attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive room with 2 double beds. Had modern furniture and very roomy. Great view of the harbour also. We loved that you could order what pillow type you like. Beds were comfortable. The staff were very efficient and helpful and it was a great end of our holiday in Sydney. Harbourside shopping centre is a short walk away and the city a good walk also... We got a 3 day saver special at 40% off otherwise we would not be able to afford to stay here but glad we did....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were generally clean- corridors and hallways could have done with a clean/ vaccum. Generally very happy with our stay- except for the last night, when a house keeping staff member knocked on the door and without waiting, let themselves in (around 6pm). It was a bit embarrassing and frightening being in a room by myself with a stranger (luckily I had just finished getting changed). Perhaps they should be instructed to just leave towels with the guest rather than actually proceed into the bathroom to put them away, especially given we did not request them.

Reviews.Title: “great christmas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the room was very spacious, the beds are soo comfy, the location superb,we had fun using the monorail,it was so convienent to be able to walk around darling harbour, and the views are the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: deid58 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated to access everything that the city has to offer. Having a harbour side view room added extra appeal. All staff were very professional and helpful meeting all of our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Families”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, no need to hire a car, everything was in walking distance or water taxi distance for us with two children. Great restaurants nearby and the harbour view rooms are a must. Everybody extremely helpful and the kids loved the tennis court. The pool a bit on the small and uninteresting side and our bed seemed to have a dip in the middle of the mattress but these are minor things, the overall experience was awesome and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for stuffy air con”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location location! What a top holiday. Next time we are in Sydney we would definatley look at staying at the same hotel. Happy hour at the bar was our high light. Having Wii consoles down in the foyer allowed us to enjoy a glass of bubbles whilst supervising our chuffed and occupied Mario Karters at the same time. Staff were obliging and food good too. My only complaint was that at night i found myself waking at night in a hot and stuffy room that i seemed to have little control over.The air conditioner said 18 deg and could not go lower. The room felt like 30. I was desperate for fresh air and found myself having to open the hall way door to get relief. Still, we would do it all again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Such comfortable beds and pillows. We had a room overlooking Pyrmont and found this so quiet. The roll down window blind meant we slept in until 9:30 am. A great place to expolre Darling Harbour and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January for a family trip to see a show at The Star. The location was perfect and the room (with 2 double beds) was a good size. The facilities were great and we (all 4 of us) had an enjoyable stay. The girls loved the breakfast. The only negative comment is breakfast said it was served until 10am but nothing fresh was released after 9:45am so it made it quite expensive when you only had access to half the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little early to the hotel and went for lunch in the bar. Table dirty, and unset... Food arrived, no cutlery and when we asked for cutlery the bar attendant took some from another dirty table... When refused and asked for clean cutlery we were met with smart comments and resistance. Room was an hour late and as it was NYE we had paid upwards of $700 for that nights accommodation. We were offered a drink for our troubles and when we went to order them the bar tender argued with me and refused to serve us until another bar attendant stepped in. House Keeping inconsistent, 3 people in room, 2 towels left, some days no face washers, other days no clean mugs left... My recommendation is for the location ONLY

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our trip was for business / pleasure. Hotel is first class and surpassed our expectations. The service people and location are first class. Food was great. Staff are very helpful and keen to provide any assistance required. This was my first time staying at darling harbour novotel and the Novotel Darling harbour will now be my first choice when staying in sydney. Executive room was first class.

Reviews.Title: “What a excellent weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for making us feel so welcome. We had our room upgraded to a harbour view which was a great surprise. Could not have had a more enjoyable weekend due in part to the excellent service we received.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay and would return”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location close to city, China town, great restaurants etc, friendly and helpful staff, good sized rooms, very clean. Parking available. We would recommend this hotel and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Darling Harbour spot.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As usual Novotel Darling Harbour never fails to please me, stay there all the time when in Sydney, never been dissapointed yet!!! Located on Harbour accross from shops, restaurants and wharf. Walking to Casino and mono rail to City centre. great view on Harbour side rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cleo1910
Reviews.Content: Located within easy walking distance of all that Darling Harbour and the city has to offer, this hotel has everything you would expect. Whilst the cost of our stay was reasonably pricey (over New Year), this was to be expected and easily in line with the rates of other hotels in the area. Staff were courteous and helpful, rooms clean and reasonably spacious. No real WOW factor here unless you pay (more) for a room with a view of the city but a comfortable stay with no issues.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected. Very Happy :)”
Reviews.Author: Carth09
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews about the Novotel, we, my two best friends and I, were worried that we were about to stay at an old, dirty and disorganised hotel. The Novotel was nothing of the sort. IT WAS FANTASTIC! The service was great. We got a call at 12:30pm letting us know that we could check in early and our bags were already in our rooms waiting for us. We had a beautiful view of Darling Harbour which we all couldn't stop staring at. The beds were comfy and two double beds were enough to accommodate 3 of us. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. Harbourside shopping centre and a monorail stop is connected by a walkway to the hotel carpark and the Powerhouse museum, Imax and Aquarium are all just a stones throw away. All in all, we were very impressed. The Novotel wasn't old, dirty or disorganised. It was very professionally run and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “jentz02”
Reviews.Author: James J Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 night but was what was expexted.On road travelling and could not book by phone same deal on line with Accor card which was annoying as night before at Sofital Brisbane it wasn't a problem.Otherwise stay was pleasing.

Reviews.Title: “Check in issues”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had check in issues, i.e. turned up at 11am to park car - knowing full well check in time was 2pm. I was "Guaranteed" 2pm check in. I arrived back with a unsettled 11 month old at 2.30pm to be told a room was not ready and for me to take a seat while they find out how long it will be. Well the lady on the reseravtion desk then left for the day and after my patience hit it's limit at 3pm I went back to the desk to be served - the new staff member resolved the issue in "10 minuites"....I stay at alot of hotels for work and have never had to have a check in processed mroe than 5 mins... Apart from check the room was nice. I do note however the adjoining door to the next room was open.. I would recommend this hotel on "location" only.

Reviews.Title: “We'd come back.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelkids
Reviews.Content: Stayed between Xmas and new year. Even at this super busy time we couldn't fault anything. We were able to check in 3 hours early. Junior suite was as expected - a few repairs needed like a broken bench unit near the window but the two huge windows for the kids to look over the Harbour more than made up for minor irritations. All staff were friendly and smiling. Also very helpful at all times. Housekeeping ladies were lovely and happy to clean our room off their usual schedule while we popped out for an hour or two. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Even our two picky kids were happy. Fantastic location so close to everything. Kids loved the monorail. We have stayed here 3 times now and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shazzam101 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, good facilities, comfortable beds, pillows soft (maybe too soft for people needing support) very nice rooms, but we had to wait 1.5 hours for room to be ready and the bedside table, etc. were still dusty! Nevertheless, we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this Novotel. The first was a week for business (Darling Harbour view) and this time for leisure with family (Pyrmont view), with both rooms on level 3. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but miss having an open window. The gym and pool are pretty good even though a little hard to locate. There are many good restaurants around the area (Novotel dinner is also Ok) and very easy access to many points of interest. Good easy service. The A Club business centre setup works really well.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: connollybb
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say that if you ever get the chance to visit Sydney for New Years Eve, it is worth all the hassle and crowds and craziness you can handle. I was lucky enough to be here for work this year and the experience was amazing. The Australians are ever so easy going and nice and the crowds seemed docile for the most part. I was amazed at how mellow the 20,000 or so people were when leaving a venue down by the harbor after the fireworks displays. And not even cops lining the streets as I'm sure New York City must have. A memorable event I will put down in my books. We stayed at the Novotel and had a fantastic view of the beautiful Darling Harbour. The employees are nothing but helpful and kind all around there. The Lovely bar and Restaurant were situated right on the beautiful viewing areas with nice patios attached. I would definitely come back to this hotel on my own vacationing time. It is centrally walkable to most anywhere in the city. The Maritime Museum is free and almost right across the street. And the Sydney Aquarium is right across the Darling Harbour, very close. Approx. 1.5 miles from the Opera House and Botanical Gardens. Approx. 2 miles to Harry's famous Meat Pies, a world famous take out meat pie stand. The hotel is also connected to a mall so you walk right across the bridge and there are restaurants and shopping areas within close proximity. And don't forget to take the ferry's and explore the many more areas of Sydney. December 31 was a lovely time to travel weatherwize. Last but not least, take plenty of money as things are not cheap down there. Enjoy the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay here and everything was just as our first time - effortless and perfect. Great staff from the Front Desk to the cleaners and it's in a perfect position for a day at Darling Harbour. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because we were going to the powerhouse museum for the Harry Potter exhibit. I am an accor member so I got a good rate and the location of the novotel is great, not only for the museum but because we could just jump on a monorail and go across the city for a spot of shopping without the hassle. The food at the restaurant was beautiful both for dinner and breakfast. Will definately be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a great location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lew88
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Darling Harbour in Sydney is located in the heart of lively Darling Harbour in Sydney. Great location to explore Sydney. The Monorail stops practically at the front door, and it is walking distance to all amenities. Plenty of restaurants in Darling Harbour, and short walk to China Town, for a great variety of Chinese food. We used the Novotel Darling Harbour as our base to explore Sydney by foot including central Sydney shops, Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Botanical Gardens, Star Casino and The Rocks. The Hotel is getting a bit old but still quite comfortable and affordable in the heart of Sydney. The pool is very small ( don't think about doing laps ), and the Gym is very basic. Breakfast is fine with fresh orange juice and fruits available. Overall please with the accomodation, location and pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in prime location with close proximity to eateries, shops and major city attractions. However, I was very disappointed with the service from the moment we arrived at the hotel. We were were made to wait over 20 minutes before check in despite having only 4 people waiting. This was due to the lack of attention from check in staff as they served those that cut the queue first. The second incident which I can over look was again the lack of attention to details from staff. We have asked for a parking and the staff advised us that access to the car park was through the same card as the room card. But this wasn't to be. The third incident was the most disappointing. As member of the accor group, we book an extra night using our complimentary voucher. We were advised through a "slide under the door" letter that we could not claim the complimentary night and was going to be charged the full rate. Lucky we were in the room and saw the letter well before checkout time. We followed up with the check in staff where she did not show any empathy nor an apology. We would have been charged a full rate if we didn't pick up the letter in time. We decided to check out and went to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, pity no free internet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. Easy access to Darling Harbour, shops and Market Street. It is just a pity that there is no free internet especially if you're Advantage Plus or A/C member. Best: Location

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect to visit all the attractions of Sydney, Trams , Monorail at your doorstep & a very short stroll and you can be at the Aquarium, Wildlife World, restaurants or taking a harbour cruise. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Room 362”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hello, i stayed in room 362 for the night of the 28th of Deccember, the hotel and service was fine, front desk was very professional and helpful upon check in. when i arrived home however i relised that i had left behind an item of clothing, i called the motel straight away and was transfered through to house keeping, who could barely understand english as i tried to describe my item of clothing. I was told there was nothing of that description left, but i am sure that the did not even bother to check. I would appreciate if someone would have a decent look for a green nighty, with pictures on it, which was left in my room from the stay on the 28th December and organise it to be returned to me if found.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at Dec and found the hotel to be close to Pitt St and Darling Harbour. The rooms were great and the service was outstanding. My family and friends stayed here and the beds and rooms were spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was great, but we enjoyed the service the most from the staff who were always smiling

Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest hotel room I've ever stayed in room 624.”
Reviews.Author: Nrankin2012
Reviews.Content: On arrival after long flight found hairs in bed, hairs in bathroom and hairs in towels. This happened on each day so must be from cleaners. Bathroom had mould in shower and shelf underneath sink hadn't been cleaned in months. Totally disgusting but more importantly it was so disappointing. Came for new year and couldn't wait to leave room each morning. If you like dirty rooms then you'll love this place. Wish I'd stayed next door at ibis hotel ! Only one more night then I leave. Reception tried to sort out issues with free bottle of champagne but I had to remind them to supply this as they forgot. Memorable stay for all the wrong reasons and not worth the $2000 I paid. Think twice before staying here!! Mr n rankin

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hidee5 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good room size, well kept hotel, friendly staff.......a great place to stay in Sydney. Walking distance to everything in the city, close to all forms of transport. Teenager children enjoyed the pool area whilst the adults enjoyed the bar

Reviews.Title: “Tourist in my own town”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very well located hotel with easy links to the city centre. Our room was not ready when we arrived however check-in staff handled the sitation well. Friendly and efficient staff in all areas of the hotel made this stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great option large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a very convenient place located in the heart of Darling Harbour. Great size rooms for family. We had two teenagers with us and room was plenty big enough for all of us. Excellent Staff who were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The experience i had with this hotel was the worst i have ever come across.The service at my check in was horrible.I was accused of fraud because i had my name on the accor advantage plus member for the day voucher (which was sent to me from accor) and not the card holders name.It took over 2 hours to check me in.Upon check out,my credit card was charged double the amount of the room rate and $50 hold deposit.Still waiting for the hotel to fax my bank a release confirmation letter.It was an appauling service and will never stay there again.I will be notifying the travel adviser website about my experience..

Reviews.Title: “Worst Overpriced Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a total rip-off. We were charged $329 per night for what we thought was a luxury room but was pretty standard and nothing special. Even at this price breakfast was not included and internet was extra. And then on top of that they charged almost $15 for paying by credit card.- am I supposed to carry large amounts of cash around? I have never been charged any extra for paying by credit card by any hotel chain before. The receptionist was not helpful with any explanation. The cleanliness was very basic - we found a lump of metal on the carpet floor that I almost cut my foot on - so the room had not be cleaned properly. I have certainly paid a lot less per night for a far better hotel. Needless to say - I will not be staying at the Novotel Darling Harbour again!!

Reviews.Title: “clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and good service received from staff. It is in a good location, just behind harbourside shopping centre at darling harbour but looks a bit old inside - probably due for an upgrade in furniture?

Reviews.Title: “xmas darling harbour stay at novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: no guidance or information on facilities when we first checked in took us a while to find the pool area, bath had dirt in it had to clean it before we bathed our young child, one towel was dirty. credit card was debited the holding deposit had to wait 4 days for it to be credited back to our account.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star price, 2 1/2 star value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Mavis66
Reviews.Content: Booked this room believing it was a 4star hotel. Location and view were excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel in need of an update as decor outdated and tired looking. Buffet breakfast not value for money as under staffed and food ran out during busy period. Outdoor area untidy and food left for extended period after patrons left. Mentioned to staff member and still not cleaned up. Had to sit indoors.

Reviews.Title: “novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: if you have a family get an executive room, its bigger and makes for a more pleasant stay. the only problem we had was getting the pram down stairs to access the mono-rail but I got some help with that.

Reviews.Title: “Ho, Ho, Ho from Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here so we could attend our work's Christmas party which was a harbour cruise. Location great - walking distance to our cruiser - weather lousy (rainy). Staff as usual were professional and helpful. Upgraded to a harbourview room, fantastic view. Room clean and very comfortable. Loved the bath.

Reviews.Title: “birthday stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel the night prior to my wifes birthday. We do this each year and have found this hotel to be very friendly and most accommodating towards our family., I can fully recommend this hotel with full confidence.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag - great location, great staff, but glitchy and with problems”
Reviews.Author: SubmarineBelle
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure how to sum up my stay at the Novotel Sydney Darling Harbour. Lets start with the pluses: 1) location, location, location! It's practically on the waterfront of Darling Harbour (immediately behind the Harbourtown shopping centre, and looking over it to the water) and thus was a great spot for our visit to various Darling Harbour attractions. 2) The staff bent over backward to be friendly and helpful. Even when circumstances were less than optimum (more on this later), the staff made every effort to be helpful, cooperative and cheerful. 3) The restaurant was nice. The negatives are a bit harder to explain easily. There were a couple of straightforward ones, such as the fact that the bathroom supplies were el-cheapo ones that really weren't up to the standard we'd expect in an over-$300-per-night room, or the rather tired decor. (Plain beige carpets really don't age well, and cheapish veneer furniture tends to scratch easily.) But the main issues are a bit harder to define without a bit of explanation. They were a bunch of on-their-own fairly trivial things that added up to paint a picture of a hotel whose management seem a little unclear how to support staff to make it possible for them to provide the really great service that a top-class hotel can offer. For example, we booked online some months before the trip, and booked the most expensive room option (Executive) in the hope of getting a really nice room with a great harbour view (as the website promised us). When we got there, the room was a bit tired and shabby, and (being on the 3rd floor) the view was a bit disappointing. So we asked if we could swap to another room higher up - only to be told, very apologetically by the receptions staff, that it wasn't possible. Booking in advance didn't, it seem, mean that we could actually be allocated an actual real room that early - the hotel admin systems don't work that way. We just got whatever room was free when we arrived. Um, ookay. Then there was the saga of the broken tv. It wasn't working, probably due to a broken connector or cable between the tv and the cable box. The staff member who attempted to help us with this, George, was a friendly fount of helpfulness who did everything he could short of sprouting wings in order to try to fix the problem, However, he wasn't able to actually fix anything because he didn't have the key to the locked cabinet containing the cable box. The engineers, apparently, keep those keys. And because we were staying at the Novotel over christmas, the engineers were apparently all on holiday. So despite George's best efforts, the tv remained broken. On the bright side, this broken tv did manage to score us the room change that our request to the reception desk the day before had been unable to secure, so that was a plus. To sum up, great location, great staff, small problems seemed hard to fix, overpriced for the standard of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great time while staying at the hotel. It is close to all the amenities that you would like to see in Sydney. The staff are friendly. The only thing that we could ask for improving, is to make more pancakes for breakfast as there seemed to be alot of children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , great service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel is perfect close to everything, & walking distance to anywhere you need to go. Great shopping complex nearby & lots of places to eat. Staff were very friendly especially the waitressess in the morning at breakfast, which had a huge selection & was great value for money. Rooms very clean & comfortable. Bed great. Would throughly recommend this anyone wanting to be able to get around Sydney & see all the sights & be close to all transport service & being able to walk anywhere . ( dont need a car) transport is great. As we were there for business it was perfect & l would like to take my family back there for a stay , actually l would stay6 there everytime l go to Sydney as it is so central & handy to everything. Great staff great service.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Carolyneb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel for a night then moved to Novotel as I am an Advantage plus member. The rates are about the same but Novotel overall wins. I admit I love the beds at Sofitel but the service at the Novotel is 2nd to none. The manager in the restaurant was outstanding. He offered us maps of the city and even got us a free dessert (was our 20th wedding anniversary). Sofitel for beds. Novotel for service.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location excellent - handy to light rail, monorail Darling Harbour. As usaul the service was friendly and efficient. Pity about the $40 a night charge for car parking - too expensive for a guest. very off-putting

Reviews.Title: “HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel before and have always found it convenient to Sydney CBD. Good quality accommodation with friendly and helpful staff. I wouold certainly be happy to reccommend this hotel to collegues in the future.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay in the hotel was very good ,Excellent location , good size room and just good to stay in the room to enjoy the view,in the hurt of the city and close to every thing , The stuff was very good , and I have enjoyed the stay. the restaurant is nice

Reviews.Title: “Xmas Stay Over”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at reception not sure or unable to answer a few questions regarding the accor advantage club, the room was ecellent , clean and comfortable, excellent location, breakfast was hectic ( proobably due to time of year) as you had to line up for about 10- 15mins and wait for cooked eggs with only one chef on, staff in the breakfast room were very good at removing dirty dishes without being obtrusive the overall opinion of the hotel was excellent. I would recommend my friends and family to stay, as we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “stay at novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed almost everything and found the overall service as excellant except for the staff,wo appeared to be manager/owner, at the resturant during a dinner time. The guy was simply unfriendly. The breakfast was good but too manay tables had the reserved signs on them while the famlies were struggling to find a large table. Interestingly we havn't seen any one turned up to those reserved tables till the end of breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay at the hotel the staff were very friendly and looked after us very well. We tried to use our two free nights but no one told us you cannot use them on consecutive nights. This was a little upsetting as we had to foot the bill for the second night and will now probably loose our free night for the year. It would be nice to know these things when we are booking in.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotle pretending to be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: LucyKate
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location for Darling Harbour and Chinatown - out the door and take the walkway over the tram and under the monorail and you're there in 2 minutes. But it's sadly in need of a makeover. The furniture, carpets and especially bathrooms are tired, and there's little protection from noise in adjoining rooms. It looks great from the outside, and the foyer scrubs up well, but if it were not for the location, there's no way it could charhe more than $150 per night. Time for a makeover!

Reviews.Title: “Family accomodation in central location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great experience for all of us. The children loved the wii which meant we could chat to adult friends at the same time, A great meeting place in a central location. The reception staff were so helpful and made the trip an special one for the kids. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Darling Harbour Novotel for both business and pleasure on many occassions throughout the years. Always enjoyed it for service, facilities and location, being on Darling Harbour. The Novotel hotel is my preferred stay when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Family stay at Novotel Darling Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our sons end of year graduation was on in the city, so we decided to book a hotel for the night. As members of Advantage Plus since 2000, we decided to use our complimentary night. As there were 2 adults and 3 children, we needed an additional room. We paid for an upgrade of our complimentary room and received a 50% discount on our second room, which was interconnecting. Had a great stay at a good price. Central to everything the kids could enjoy. Great staff, great rooms, great location. The day that hotels have single rooms that cater to more than 2 adults and 2 kids and cater for the larger family, is the day that more families will actually come and stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Sales Manager Australia & New Zealand”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not appear to give much credit to my Gold Status with Accor, probably should not have a priority check in if it is not going to be serviced. The bed was not the most comfortable, they could invest is better beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My kids and I had an awesome time celebrating my daughters 15th birthday. The room had 2 double beds, a large desk, big tv and had a fantastic view on the 5th floor of Darling Harbour. We played Nintendo Wii in the lobby, used the free Apple computers, played tennis (racquets ,balls from concierge) on the tennis court, swam in the cool blue outdoor pool, walked 15mins on the treadmill in the gym and used the weights, ate buffet breakfast in the morning (worth every cent), free newspaper. We didn't want to leave ! Will definitely choose this hotel to come back for the next birthday !

Reviews.Title: “Was okay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well when I got there the room smelt dirty, the bathroom had hair everywhere. And the bed look Asia it was just made as a stay over, I recommend the hotel maybe the staff should just be a lil more on top of things. Also room 567 your. Bath when you empty it the water goes all over the floor!!!! I cleaned it.....

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, the hotel is in a handy location - easy to walk into town and Chinatown, staff friendly and the room was comfortable and very clean. Our only quibble was with room service, the food was pretty ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. The hotel is at a great location, convenient to the city centre and key attractions. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The facility and services provided value for money. Much improved on my last stay

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quick overnight stay with a young child of 4. The room was clean, and very comfortable. The bath/shower probably needed updating as you could see that there had been a small repair job done. Staff are friendly, courteous and willing to help. Check-in staff were also pro-active when they saw I had a child with me.

Reviews.Title: “How to be more personal to clients”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had an overall great experience at the Hotel. I was in particulary impressed with the fantastic blockout window shades, to the point we were unsure of the time on waking, it was as if it was still night. Our beds also were very comfortable, and the overall cleanliness of the room was great. The resturant location was fantastic. The only suggestion i would have. was to bring back the dispossible items in the bathroom, as normally they would be there for me to use, when i travel and I was unaware of then not being offered untill the next morning when i was leaving i found a sign reguarding the purchasing of the items, eg razor blades,shower cap, so I felt a little dissapointed that i had to ask for and purchase these. These items in the bathroom just make the whole experience of traveling so much easier for people, and to have them in the bathroom, on offer, show the customer that you truly do care. Thanks for the service you provide Linda Fisher

Reviews.Title: “The worst parking I have ever seen in the world for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the service is excellent the staff are polite. However with parking in the hotel it is terrible and not very easy to navigate as the 4th floor is novatel parking the other floors you have to take a separate elevator down too. If the novatel parking is full you are forced to use Wilson Parking at $58 a night you will pay $40 through novatel if you have lots of bags and a baby and 9 year old this can be quite strenous. We were on the second floor. I was given a room key and another voucher to park upstairs the next day which was novatel parking. I was supposed to use the voucher along with the ticket that I obtained when I first parking in the garage. I thought the computer systems were linked. So it told me to pay the $58 outstanding balance after I put my original voucher in. Cars were backing up behind me and I could not get out so I paid twice for parking. I went up two elevators and three ramps to get to my car to unload, load, and stairs to get a refund. I had to go up stairs and the lady behind the counter reversed the $40 charge to my credit card. This hotel is not for families or for someone with a car.

Reviews.Title: “greatn family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed in executive harbour view room with 2 adults 2 children (7,11) great size room, very clean, great view, ate in restaurant for dinner with kids whole family agreed food was excellent at 'dish',. did buffet breakfast and kids ate free, good value and plenty of choice. Monorail and light rail at the door, staff very friendly and obliging, would definitely stay again. Darling Harbour very busy on saturday night and had trouble trying to get a restaurant without a reservation and two hungry kids frustratin, decided to come back and eat at the hotel restaurant and so pleased we did, lovely atmosphere, small play area for kids while waiting for meal, also had wii console and screen set up in foyer in case you had to sit around waiting very family friendly, great location

Reviews.Title: “4 day getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, can walk to shops,restaurants,harbour,ferry,IMAX Theatre,Entertainment Centre,Powerhouse Museum,Aquarium,Monorail,Central Station all nearby, only takes a few minutes to get to any of the above. Only a short ferry ride to Luna Park or Taronga Zoo. Great spot to park the car @ the hotels' undercover carpark, (a little expensive but it's peace of mind & the convenience is worth it, being able to safely park it !) Views of the harbour from our window, especially @ night were stunning. Staff lovely & helpful. The beds were soooo comfortable- slept great.
