This is our 2nd stay @ Novotel Darling Harbour, our whole family had the best time & really enjoyed our stay. Expensive but you're in the heart of Sydney. Would recommend it :)

Reviews.Title: “Bed too soft”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The bed was soft but dipped too much, woke up with a bit of a sore back. Also as this was the first time at this hotel, I found the parking signage poor, also as there were no attendants around to ask where reception was and the sinage for reception was also poor as it's on the 1st floor. Other than that the food was great, location is great & yes I would come back, second visit would be easier as I now know where to park & where reception is. Cost for parking should have been more explained on the booking site & at entry. I thought overnight parking was rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location at Darling Harbour, close to monorail and tram (and then connect to train) to city and of course DH. very quiet rooms. we had harbour view with fireworks! Service in restaurant could be very slow if big groups taking attention but food very good. Had to change wine choices a few times due to no stock. 11yo son disappointed there was no 'games' room only Wii (one disc) in foyer but DH area has games, bowling, skirmish. Accor membership made the costs better.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a superb location if attending Darling Harbour /Pyrmont functions or appointments. Staff is helpful and rooms are quite spacious and very clean. Parking is expensive but there are cheaper parking stations nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Affordable stay (Accor Membership rate) in well located hotel right on Darling Harbour. The Hotel appears to have been renovated in recent years and is comfortable for business travellers, with great access to the city, without staying right in town. Parking is an extra $40 for 24 hours, Monorail and light rail system almost at the door. Easy walk into the city. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We (parents with two teenaged daughters) needed to be at the convention centre early in the morning so decided to stay overnight at the Novotel which is right on the doorstep. We had an enormous room with a great view of Darling Harbour. We had a very comflortable night and relaxed start to the morning, and the staff were friendly. We would love to do the same thing again next year, but unfortunately as one of our daughters will be 16, we would need to stay in two rooms (hotel policy), and the cost of this will be preclusive.

Reviews.Title: “darling harbour friendly”
Reviews.Author: cmartin41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the ACCOR group and one of the first in Darling Harbour. The rooms are comfortable but not luxury and it is worth asking for a harbour view room.Staff are helpful and friendly.I saw the young chap on the door refuse a tip for his services which amazed the guests.The monorail and ferry are at the door and a walkway joins the hotel to the shops and restaurants in Darling Harbour. Car parking is $40 extra but thats what you pay in the city.Good breakfast and they have a happy hour.I like this hotel for its convenience and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “City centre with tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Edster88
Reviews.Content: Rooms are what one would expect from a Novotel property. Nice rooms, good size & importantly a comfortable bed. Location right on Darling Harbour is just 6 minutes walk from China Town or a convenient ride right into Pitt Street Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Station Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We used the parking attached to the hotel. When checking out, we paid $40.00 for our parking fee and a second ticket was issued. We attempted to exit the parking station and followed the instructions issued by the hotel receptionist. We inserted the parking station ticket first and the cost was $56.00. We inserted the second ticket and the cost was $28.00. We pressed the intercom button and the attendant told us that we had to back to the hotel and ask for the second ticket. We were told by the hotel receptionist that it would cost another $40.00. I did not want to pay $80.00 instead of $56.00 so I asked for my money back. When we went back to the paystation the card issued by the parking station did not work. We called the attendant who told us that we needed to go back to the hotel reception as the card they had taken off us now held all the information. The hotel receptionist was unable to issue the card without payment. In effect we had to pay the $80.00 instead of $56.00 otherwise we could not get out of the parking station. The receptionist knew from the very beginning that we had stayed two days but only charged us for one. Apart from the extra money, we were most inconvenience as this took a considerable amount of time and we had a schedule to meet. When we first arrived in our room there was a horrible smell with some sort of machine going. The taps in the shower/bath are difficult to access as there is a glass panel in the way. The shower constantly changes temperature which is dangerous as it has the potential to cause burns.

Reviews.Title: “nice place overall”
Reviews.Author: bighalders
Reviews.Content: I was just a bit underwelmed at the room I had. But don't let that put you off, the rest of the hotel is good and the location is perfect, Darling Harbour is a lovely area in a truly great city. Use this hotel as an excellent base to explore sydney, loads of transport links and you can walk to Sydney Opera House (takes 35 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “if you want a dark peaceful room then this hotel is for you”
Reviews.Author: cortez48
Reviews.Content: It was a tad hard to find if you dont know sydney rather well. On arrival there were extremely helpful & friendly bellboys, we headed up stairs to check-in it was quite quick & very efficient. We paid the extra for a room with a city/darling harbour view, and it was worth it. The minute we walked into the room i was happy, it was large, airy & the view the cherry on top. The room was extremely clean & comfortable, the bathroom was large with great lighting. Aside from the view the darkness of this room when the blinds are closed was "fantastic"........i love really dark rooms. The other bonus was the quietness of this hotel, we heard no noise whatsoever from the rooms on either side or above or beneath......again "fantastic". A hotel this quiet is a rare treat in my traveling adventures..........what a pleasant surprise. I hope to stay here again one day soon.........i loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Paying for the location but hotel lacks a personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel G
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with many others that this hotel is conveniently located. Took the Cityrail from airport to central and transferred to Metro light rail to the hotel doorstep. Staying in an executive harbor room on the 3rd story. There is no complimentary drinking water in the room, no hotel directory (listing the services, room service menu). Bathroom amenities were minimal. I suppose the "executive" title given to the room refers to the bigger size of the room only? However, the view from 3rd story was partly obstructed by the room next to ours as well. So could only see a small part of darling harbor. Expected more from Accor since I am an Advantage Plus member and have always been satisfied with other Accor hotels that I stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First time guests at Novotel Darling Harbour, enjoyed the closeness to everything. Checking in and out was a speedy & professional experience. Staff were pleasant and helpful with all enquiries. Reason for staying was to attend Capital Theatre to see a live show and the light rail made the travel very fast and convenient. Recommend the food in the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. Comfortable nights sleep, quiet room. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “SW 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent and the room was large and had a good view of Darling Harbour precinct. Based on previous experience the more you pay for a room the better value for money (in terms of size and view) Swimming Pool area could be enhanced by having a bar/eatery - was quite basic for a hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable short break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First time to the hotel - catch a cab. Once you have your bearings it is so easy to get about to/from the hotel. So much to see and do in the vicinity and city centre10 minute stroll away Book the breakfast - great food, and a lot of it, and it fuels you up for the coming day Staff are warm and welcoming and answered all questions immediately Rooms well set out and comfortable. Though be warned the shower screen does not always stop all the water

Reviews.Title: “Happy with stay & service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for a few days while attending a conference at the convention centre. The hotel is well located, the staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean & comfortable. We have stayed there before a few years ago. Dinner was very good in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have still not received back the $50.00 bond charged to our credit card. Please can you look into this and advise us as we are regular customers and would like to remain so. We have still not received back the $50.00 bond charged to our credit card. Please can you look into this and advise us as we are regular customers and would like to remain so

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel- Hihgly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Novatel Darling Harbour on numerous occassions both business and pleasure, and have also stayed in others for same but this hotel is my favourite. Its so handy to transport, theatres, conference facilities and many other things; water views, the staff are great nothings any trouble and they are friendly, rooms very clean, beds are like sleeping on a cloud, food great. Good value especially belonging to the Accor group. 100% all round

Reviews.Title: “great view of darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: shirlz99 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to darling harbour and easy access via a bridge! Very handy seeing as it was raining when we checked in. We had a room with the harbour view, which is amazing! Big sized comfortable rooms also.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Smell”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room absolutely reeked of smoke. Normlly I love staying at the Novotel but this trip was awful. As an Accor member extremely disappointed, To pay over $300 and end up with a headache from the bad smell in the room was poor

Reviews.Title: “Great spot excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable time at the Novotel Darling Harbour with a magnificent double bedroom overlooking the water. We were unfortunate enough to encounter heavy rain, but could easily walk under cover to the Harbourside shops and restaurants. The restaurant at the hotel was delicious and one of the best breakfast buffets we have had. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in a prime position in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: LizS81 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if attending a conference at the convention centre, easy 5-7min walk. Also great access to fabulous Darling Harbour. Hotel staff very friendly and anxious to please. highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding trip november 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with magnificent view over Darling Harbour. I particularly liked the wind down blinds which blacked the room completley. Very quiet room with no road noise.Hotel was well situated close to Darling Harbour and the city and with the monorail station handy made it easy to get around Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Competitively priced for Sydney and a sterling location for visitors”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Henry_B
Reviews.Content: This is a great location on Darling Harbour with a lovely view out at night. The service is excellent. The price is high but quite competitive for Sydney (cheaper than my preferred lodgings at The Grace), and for mine is justified by the location. It's right behind Harbourside shopping and restaurant centre so if you don't want to eat in the hotel you can just cross the footbridge behind the hotel to Harbourside and you have the food court for cheap eats (and free Macdonalds Wi-Fi if you don't want to pay for the Novotel one!), and any number of restaurants and cafes for sit-down choices on this side, and more on the other side of Darling Harbour 5 mins across the footbridge. The Pyrmont ferry stop is to the left of Harbourside if you go out the front and keep walking left past the Maritime Museum, or cross over the footbridge and head left for the King St Wharf stop on the other side of Darling Harbour past the Aquarium and wildlife place. Rooms were comfortable with 'nice' decor. I suppose it's good to see a place that is careful of its water use but the shower was not power, more the 'wash one body part at a time' variety. However there was a bath, and a good variety of complimentary toiletries. The block out blinds on the window were excellent - particularly as it faces east to the rising sun! The left luggage service on ground floor is excellent and staff were very helpful when arriving by or departing by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “good spot”
Reviews.Author: Emuchick Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a superior room with harbour views. Spacious and comfy and very clean. We were directed to a ferry stop on the other side of Darling Harbour to get to the city, when there was actually one much closer without the need to cross over the bridge and a fair walk away. Very close to shops, but again we were directed around the block when there is actually a covered walkway from the hotel itself. (There were signs pointing up an escalator in the Harbouside shopping complex) The food (lunch) was good and well priced in the bar area and the parking was fixed price $40/day but we were allowed to leave it until 5pm the day of checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Business”
Reviews.Author: Aidan J
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Novatel on Darling Harbor for 3 nights while i attended some meetings for work. Apart from being very central to the CBD, I found the service was outstanding, and everybody was extremely helpful and pleasent. On one of the days I was offered an umbrella when it was raining, which is just a small touch of service excellence that really stood out for me. Room service was very good, fast and friendly. i would have no concerns staying at this hotel again, and i will be reccomending this to my collegues.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location whether you are travelling for leisure or business. The staff is friendly and helpful. I loved the room which was quite spacious with a nice view on the harbour. Overall very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Awesome service, I checked in and they made it very easy. the person who served me Adam was awesome and made everything very simple as I was a bit flustered being my wedding day. he also upgraded me and offered a free breakfast for me an my new wife, thank you very much for the experience and I will tell all my friends about the great service John

Reviews.Title: “KD Lang show visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location central to city and Darling Harbour. Design reminded my of a ship with the rooms placed around the huge centre atrium void. This tended to make noise carry from the lower levels but otherwise a relatively quiet location and extremely comfortable beds. Friendly, helpful staff. Delicious breakfast. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay Novotel Sydney Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean, well presented rooms, excellent service and attention to detail. An added bonus is the delayed checkout of 12 midday and you are allowed to leave your car in the Hotel's carpark til 5pm on the day of checkout, so if you are sightseeing around Sydney or merely catching up with friends, you can leave your car at the Novotel !

Reviews.Title: “pre school holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i have take this trip to Sydney on three occassions with each of my grandchildren just before they commence school the this has been my favortie hotel so far we dont leave darling habour for two days as there is plenty to do the hotel is within walking distance to everything

Reviews.Title: “High Quality As Usual”
Reviews.Author: bosscanberra Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and very comfortable rooms - especially superior rooms. We were also impressed with the warm and professional approach of reception staff who ensured we were allocated a room with a great harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rooms are value for money $349 a night for each room for a tiny room if you don't mind that the location is very good very clean and have very good service. I would not pay more then $200 a night for the room but my kid wanted to stay close to night life. I would stay there again if the the price was right for $349 I expected a very good room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Even though we expressely asked for a daily newspaper, it was never delivered aven after reminding the hotel staff. We booked and had four people staying in our room but were onlt given 3 bath towels. We rang and were quickly provided with an extra towel, however the next day and the day after that we were only provided with three towels. It's the little things like this that count when making your holiday stress free and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the location and presentation of the hotel was fantastic but with the exception of the reception counter staff the service was unfriendly, generally unhelpful and unwelcoming especially from bar staff. If this could be improved (a lot) then it would have been a great experience unfortunately it was just an average one.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, ROOMS LOOKING A LITTLE TIRED”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a little tired, and bathrooms also need a little refresh. Breakfast was average. Customer service was excellent. Excellent location, this is why we chose this hotel. We would stay again next time, however, i would like to see the rooms refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Novotel Darling Harbour when we go to sydney it is so central to everything and just a walk to everything as well.We just love it as the perfect mini break. We have stayed at the Novotel quite a number of times wether flying to Sydney or Driving and every time we stay we always want to stay another couple of nights our break never seems long enough.The rooms are lovely and quiet and comfortable.Views are great from Harbour view rooms and the service is second to none.Congrats Novotel you have it all!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for Business”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK, but was quite expensive for what you got. They only had 1 person on the check-in/out counter. In fact their didn't seem to have enough staff for the size of the hotel. Another pet hate is that there was no toothpaste in the room and they had a combined shampoo/conditioner which was really cheap. I had to go to a local 7/11 and buy both, which was very expensive. Nearly $20 for these items alone. The hotel was fine for business but wouldn't stay there for a holiday. Hotel Parking was also a bit of a hassle, was always full and we had to get staff to search for a spot.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Novatel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Darling Harbour Novatel with my wife and 2 year old daughter while I was attending a seminar for work. We come back to this Hotel because of the service and the welcome we always receive. In particular Adam on the front desk goes out of his way to make us feel really welcome and our young daughter appreciates the toys and attention she receives. I am so glad a Hotel values families and caters for them. David Cole, Newcastle

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was very much overpriced. Great location - but I guess that's all you're paying for. Room was very large - but a bit shabby. There was a great view of Sydney Harbour. We payed over $300 for 1 night including breakfast... you can stay in 5 star luxury for this price. I only stayed here because I was attending a conference at the convention centre, it's very handy for that.

Reviews.Title: “Boring!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We sat down in the restaurant, read the menu and left. What a boring menu and atmosphere for such a brilliant position. The waiter who showed us to the table looked all out of place in his clothes. The pants were far too long, the shirt and shoes were scruffy and the tie was wonky. Mind you, the young man himself was very pleasant but it would be lovely to have a wonderful dining experience along with the good accommodation that the Novotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Special comments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at Novotel. We have stayed there on 3 occasions within last 2 years. We had a lovely breakfast on our last stay and would recommend that also. We did complimented the chef in the kitchen on that occasion. If we had any complaint at all it was that the bar ran out of a certain beer (Chancer Beer -on tap) which we tried for the first time there this time round. On the Monday later in the afternnoon we had an hour & half to fill in before leaving hotel and thought it would be nice to enjoy a couple of drinks before leaving hotel and thought it a bit disappointing that the on tap beer ran out. But as we had a pretty full schedule whilst staying at Darling Harbour it's just a small complaint. Over very good. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at this hotel. Rooms were large with comfy beds and pillows. Great block out blind on window. Everything went smoothly from check in to check out, Absolutely perfect location on beautiful Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know where to stay?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The entire staff at this hotel has always been most polite and helpful! Although we've been trying different hotels, this one is our favourite for service, facilities and location. The food is great and the harbour view is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great position close to all ammenities, can catch either rail link to most places,eg theatre,restaurants, but I must admit we ate at the restaurant within novatel with the service and meal top class.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from our room”
Reviews.Author: Ibble143
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights before starting a cruise round New Zealand. Having flown from the UK over two nights, we arrived at the hotel very early - before 9 am - so didn't expect our room to be ready until the afternoon. However, the receptionist said she would do what she could while we had a walk around Darling Harbour (to keep ourselves awake). To our delight, we were walking back to the hotel at 11.00 when she phoned to say a room was ready. We had booked a Harbour view, and the room was on the 8th floor. That gave us a marvelous view, particularly after dark. The room was a good size and well equipped. The breakfast buffet had an extensive selection - with some unusual offerings in the way of spiced fruit. Location of the hotel is good - not too far to walk to downtown Sydney, and there si a short cut to Harbourside and the monorail station from the top floor of the car park.

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel in a prime position, minutes to darling hourbour, cockle bay wharf, with plenty to see and do, also walking distance to the main shopping centre in the CBD. The room was very comfortable, spacious and clean, however there was no hair dryer available, luckily I had brough my own. Staff were very nice and the service in the bar/restaurant was great.

Reviews.Title: “No better location”
Reviews.Author: donnie55
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly, comfortable, and conveniently located hotel in Sydney. If you want to go beyong this harbour, just take a water taxi , ferry, cab, monorail or light rail... alll dirt cheap (the only things in Australia that are cheap) all just steps away for the hotel. Same goes for getting from the airport to this hotel easy!. The breakfast bar is quite large and the foof is good. The restaurant and the bar are both very good. What really makes this hotel- besides the great view) is the fantastic staff. Highly recco this place

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing and the service from the front desk was professional and very helpful. However with the price you pay for a room you should recieve parking for free!! We also ate at the inhouse resturant, the food was really good however the service there was very poor. Considering how quiet it was we struggle to get service and get what we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: bnicole00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over a weekend and were less than pleased. There was a drunken disturbance on our hall with a couple screaming at each other at 1 am. It went on for 30 minutes with doors slamming, screaming, loud enough for us to hear all the details. I called to the desk and explained and was told they'd take care of it. 30 minutes later we still can't sleep because of the fight going on, so I call again. We heard the worker come knock on the door and the guest yelled at him he would try to keep it down. 30 minutes later still slamming doors, screaming, and yelling at the top of their lungs. I call yet again frustrated that its almost 3 am and we paid a lot of money to sleep, yet we can't. In the end the hotel couldn't enforce their policies or get the situation resolved. Very frustrating night - stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: morobe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and found the service and location good but parking is expensive and the decor is getting a bit old and tired. Certainly a great location in regards to options for eating out of the hotel and is relatively easy to access the CBD via public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found hotel easily considering the traffic. The room was very clean and had a wonderful view over Darling Harbour. Hotel service was very good and meals were excellent. Car parking was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the second we walked in the door we were waited on hand and foot. All staff were friendly and helpful. Room was very spacious and beds were lush. Wonderful deep bath and the bath gel supplied smelt lovely. Meals were excellent and the location is just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel on Darling Harbour - you are paying for location only. over 400 a night for a standard room looking on the harbour and you only get a queen bed, a dodgy doorstop in front of the toile in the bathroom and can here what's going on in the rooms above and beside you! you are much better off saving money and staying next door at the Ibis!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is a great stay. Wonderful hotel with great views of Darling harbour and only short stroll to the CBD. Good size rooms well appointed. friendly staff and good service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed our stay very much. Location is excellent: a few minutes walk from the Sydney Convention Centre, Harbourside shopping mall with its great eating spots immediately adjacent to Darling Harbour, IMAX theatre and Chinese Gardens. Hop-on, hop-off bus a few minutes walk away. Monorail to the city centre even closer. Great (but pricey) breakfast, excellent service. One downer: free wi-fi access is limited to 30 mins in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Christokran13 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is well located in Darling Harbour being a short walk away from the shops, restaurants and attractions. It's also next to the Monorail station and Pyrmont Bridge so getting to Sydney's CBD district is very easy. Our room was located on the 9th floor and had great views of Cockle Bay and the city - even better at night! The bed was very comfortable and noise was not a factor for us. We were surprised by the spaciousness of the room as there was a lot of room to move around. About the only thing lacking were some small amenities like a shower cap - although I confess I didn't call up the staff to see if I could get one. This was definitely not a big deal for us and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who is contemplating staying in Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time had by all.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My family and i recently stayed with you while visiting from the country, the whole experience was wonderful. The staff were at all times helpful and friendly and the location was amazing for my two you country kids. Thank you very much, we will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jan P
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. Our room's view was overlooking Darling Harbor and it was just beautiful. The staff were extremely helpful and were only to pleased to assist you. Would like to see a little better lighting in the bathroom but overall were extremely pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Car Park”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent and I enjoyed my stay except for one minor issue that got me a bit disappointed. I checked out in the morning and informed the service disk that I will be picking up my car around 5PM. When I went to pick up the car, I discovered that given car park access car was not working, so I had to re-park the car, cause others to reverse behind me when I had to do that and walk all the way back to reception. I was shocked when the lady informed me that I wasnt charged for the car park thus the access card that I was given is not working. I Believe that was a waste of my time and others time, and caused delay to my trip back home, which could be easily avoided if the right thing was done in the first place. Also; I would expect the lady who insisted to charge me for the car parking to at least apologise for the incident, which did not happen and she was only happy to process the transaction. I hope that a bit of cosideration to car the park access cards issue is reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “awards night in Doltone House”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: .Location location location; The view of Sydney and Darling Harbour, especially at night is spectacular. Handy for monorail. light rail, ferries, plenty of shops, cafes, bars, restaurants. The seafood entree in the hotel restaurant was to die for. $40 per night parking a bit rich, but understandably have to regulate with other car parks in the area or it will get filled with strays

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful B'day Experience for my wife”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Visited Sydney to see a show to celebrate my wife's birthday. Excellent experience from the time when we walked into reception, up to when it was time to leave. Service, location, cleanliness was first class. Receptionist offered/suggested a room upgrade (at very modest fee) to a room with full harbour views. She also arranged (unbeknown to us)for a completely none-solicited birthday surprise to be delivered to our room when we returned from the theatre. "Icing on the cake".... I shall be in wife's very good book for at least another 12 months.

Reviews.Title: “trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found very fsuitable for our purpose. The only problem was we checked in early and then the person behind the desk wanted to go through the entire process when we went to collect our key at 4 pm instead of just giving us the room number and key

Reviews.Title: “Novotel, the Darling of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: jchbuz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Sydney on darling Harbour is a first class place to stay. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was comfortable and roomy, very clean and the bed was comfortable. The food and service in the restaurant were excellent. We recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were met at reception by Jerome who was very pleasant and efficient and we were booked in a matter of minutes. We were given room 801. The room was well appointed and very clean. Our only problem was the noise at night. It sounded as though we could hear the air conditioning unit, on the roof, groaning away and this went on all night! This was my Accor A Club complementary night.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel - I'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for business or pleasure. Have stayed here on several other occasions over past years and found rooms to be well equipped, clean and well-serviced. Front desk service style is well-balanced - all support staff most accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jordan-ashleigh
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Darling harbour close proximity to the bars, restaurants and cafes. Rooms are very clean and well equipped. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is rather pricey especially when there is so many quality options in darling harbour for under $10.00. Great location for families!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with lovely amicable staff & at a great location in Sydney. Recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney. Rooms are clean & comfy. Probably one of the best Novotel Hotels around. Car parking was easy & I could keep it there the next day while visiting Darling Harbour

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: SophieT1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Novotel Darking Harbour many times and keep going back. The hotel is located right in the heart of Darling Harbour and is a great base for sightseeing around Sydney. It is very close to Paddys Markets, IMAX, Maritime museum and walking distance to Circular Quay and the centre of Sydney. Rooms are great (try and get one with a view over Darling Harbour), the staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is very nice. It is a great hotel which is close to everything, you wont be dissapointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and easy to get to all the tourist spots as well as the CBD. The signage to find the hotel could be improved when alighting at the tram stop at the Convention Centre... was slightly confusing to go from the platform via the carpark elevator to get to the entry level of the hotel. Hotel staff were super friendly and very helpful with everything from getting a taxi to storing bags for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room had a 'well used' look & feel. Carpets were stained and the room looked ready for a make-over to brighten and modernise it. Housekeeping failed to remove used bottles overnight. The 'view over Darling Harbour' was a sliver of water - not a full view. Not was I would have expected from this hotel - rated 4 stars (Wotif.com)

Reviews.Title: “A short notice booking for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upgrade to Darling Harbour view room as an Advantage Plus member appreciated. Good facilities with a full bathroom - missed not having the shower cap though! The hotel is situated qwithin walking distance of all Sydney venues and with easy access to public transport if required.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure the room location(sea side or opsit(street)side)!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was nice hotel, but If you mentioned that the room is sea side or not, it will be much better when I make the reservation. If there is some guide for the city tour, it will be much better. everything is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Accor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent user of the Accor chain of hotels and i am happy to say the service, cleanliness and friendliness is maintained. On this occassion i had booked 3 rooms for my friends and our kids. You can be assured of our continuous custom. Sincerely Omar & Orane

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my Daughter and Daughter in law and we were all thrilled with the room space and the view. Staff were extremely helpful. The location allowed us to park the car and walk or catch light rail for the period of our stay. Fantastic weekend thank you Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “harbour view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Took my grandson, aged 8, for a long weekend for his b/day. He thoroughly enjoyed his stay, apart from the scrambled eggs at breakfast which he stated did not taste like real eggs. Have been before and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel but Pricy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Was given a smoking room although specifically requested for non-smoking room. Was changed to a spacious non-smoking room with great view after complaining. The hotel was clean, service was ok but concierge wasn't helpful at all. Food and drinks are pricy for the quality. Location was great for visiting Darling Habour but is not a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: Cath1969 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For such an expensive hotel, the bed was terribly uncomfortable, especially the pillows. We had quite a bit of noise on our level as well during one of the nights. We had better service on the p&o cruise that we went on and I refer this more to the restaurant rather than the desk service.

Reviews.Title: “Good views - and that's it!”
Reviews.Author: E H
Reviews.Content: We booked one night in an executive room with Darling Harbour views. The check in was easy but our room was not what we were expecting. We had a squashed bug in the bed and make up was on one of the pillows. Strange hair in the bathroom including on the towels... It looked/was dusty, like no one had booked this room in a while and therefore it wasn't cleaned in a while. The TV and in room entertainment also didn't work. The staff on that day were friendly but seemed overwhelmed with their work / complaints. When we complaint about the bed and the TV there were 2 other people at the reception having trouble with their internet. Our opinion unfortunately is that apart from great views and a great location this hotel doesn't offer much else.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay - but with a sad ending.”
Reviews.Author: calekids
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at this hotel. Was a hiccup with our room at first but sorted out. Requested room with view of the ships as we were embarking on a cruise, but ended up with a room that wasn't high enough and didn't get a great view. was a shame as we requested it some time before arriving. Room was clean and beds comfortable. Great location near transport, restaurants and food court, plus shops. Easy access to all of Sydney from here. Our sons special sleeping buddy was somehow caught up in the bed linen and disappeared. We asked at reception and they said they would look, but we doubt they did. Sadly our son lost his buddy and was quite distressed about it. The toy was black and 45cm long so not a small item. No offer of assistance from the hotel, so that was unfortunate, considering they caused the issue. But with that aside, the reception, concierge and staff were friendly, and nice. Not overly helpful with the loss of Bullseye. We have stayed here many times and continue to return due to its location. We did have room service one night, it was good quality, delivered hot and within a good timeframe. I would recommend this hotel to others due to its location and beautiful views. Get a harbour view room, as its lovely to watch the day turn to night. I have stayed there with our family on several occasions and with a friend on separate trips. Just will be extra careful in future with the kids sleeping buddies. Was a sad end to a lovely few days.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but added expense.”
Reviews.Author: Willow202 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately complimentary biscuits are not in the deal, you have to buy from mini bar or elsewhere, also if you use the pathetic drops of milk and ask for some fresh milk for a coffee, you are required to pay $2. For the cost of this room and the 'luxury' it is supposed to be, there should not be extra expense for these items.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful stay and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have no further advise because it is impossible to improve such excellence in hospitality. We are a retired couple and have been staying at this Hotel for ten years; always enjoying our accomodation. The staff is extremely courteous and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just what we needed.Pleasant staff and very good care.Very close to many attractions .We enjoyed the ferry rides. Room was very quiet and bed was very comfortable. Happy hour was great &. the meals were of a high standard . I particularly enjoyed the sweets

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in fantastic location close to all attractions. Our room overlooked Darling Harbour and the city which looks great by day and by night. We've stayed at the hotel before and came back for our 30th wedding anniversary. Lovely meals at the restaurant and the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour Sydney - Great choice of accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. Everything we needed was right at our door step. Plenty of food choices and public transport was easily accessed. Parking at hotel is available at a rather dear price if not use to city parking prices.

Reviews.Title: “Total Package”
Reviews.Author: steve_bayliss Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of Darling Harbour. The hotel has everything you need except a massage room ( had to go into the shopping area for a massage "Mandarin Massage" are excellent ). We had no need to go into the City Centre, but we did walk to the Opera House several times via the waterfront walkway. The room price is a little higher than I would have liked, but the location made up for it. Will return here everytime I fly across the ditch.

Reviews.Title: “weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is better than most 5 stars hotel that I stay in the city area where it has a large room 2 double bed rooms compared to queen size. the toilet is bigger than the average and it has a quiet nice tv as well. I do find that the parking is a little bit dear but I parked in harbourside which is cheaper than the hotel parking as long as you do not go in and out. overall it is value for money but the price that I pay is special. If anything more than this price is too expensive for me considering that the additional parking cost. Food is average.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed as we always thought of Novotel Darling Harbour as being 5 star but we think it only 3 star now after staying there. It was very noisy due to a function on the ground floor (so we were informed) and we were on the 5th floor! It needs refurbishing, shower curtains make it cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick S
Reviews.Content: I am amazed that anyone would write a positive review of this disaster of a hotel. I am staying here because I am attending a conference and my travel agent went for convenience. I check in Sunday after flying from San Francisco. The room was small and on the 3rd floor so you cannot see the harbor because of the terrace, I was tired so decided to have a shower. The show was a joke. No real shower head, no water pressure and it never got hot enough to produce steam. The towels are old and worn not fluffy and soft as you expect for nearly $400 per night. No robe either and cheap products. The next morning the shower has no pressure and is just cold but I have a business metric so do not have time to del. That night it is confirmed that the shower is broken and the hotel repairs. Honestly it is not much better but does now get hot. The hotel have not offered an apology or anything since. The bathroom is generally poor and there is mould or soap scum in the bad shower which is simply unacceptable. Do not stay in room 343 but I have not seen anything to suggest it is better in the other rooms. The bed is too soft and uncomfortable the bar and restaurant are poor. I could go on and on but instead I am checking out a day early. Please do your resesach this is a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to attractions, great view!”
Reviews.Author: TimandKath
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay when going to Sydney. I've stayed here twice now, each for 3 nights. Both times I was on the 7th floor with a great view over all of Darling Harbour and the city skyline. We were able to check in early both visits and were given a late check out on the last day. Rooms are comfortable, clean and have all necessary immenities, including a fride, tea and coffee making facilities, in-room safe, in-room movies. Room service breakfast is good and offers healthy options as well. Hotel is a couple of minutes walk to the monorail stop and light rail stop which you can use to get around the city. It is also a short trip across a walkway to Harbourside - a shopping centre which has many cafes, restaurants and ten-pin bowling.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel however were disappointed that we were told we would receive a honeymoon package in the room however there was none when we arrived. The bed was too soft which made it difficult to sleep comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “staying for expo”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay at the novatel was convenient with places to eat and the convention centre next door. The happy hour was a great idea to get together after the expo. The food was great and the service was fantastic. You have cheerful and helpful staff both behind the desk and at the entrance. I really didn't know what time check out was, as leaving at 3 on Sunday left us a bit lost. It was a bit of a shame the weather didn't hold out for the whole weekend. Our stay was one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “October visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival.... The only negative was slight confusion when pulling in off street (in car) to short park whilst booking in and find out about parking spaces..we had to park illegally while running in to foyer for more information

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and View”
Reviews.Author: Kerry C
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed on the 8th floor this year We love the location,and view is amazing You could sit and look at world go by for hours out of the large window .Always something to see even the Monorail going past down below and all the city lights at night .Location is perfect to access Darling Harbour via covered walk bridge .You can catch Monorail or light rail to city from Darling Harbour .Plenty of excellent places to eat in walking distance But It is expensive for a weekend Room alone was around $700 .Breakfast is good but adds $50 a day to the cost and parking is $40 a night so it ends up expensive for a weekend including Saturday and Sunday night .The other thing is the bathroom has a shower bath , would prefer seperate shower so this could be improved . The rooms are very quiet and the beds very comfortable ,the blockout blinds allow you to sleep in . We will return

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, great rooms and views. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Only major issue was that the shower temperature fluctuated constantly. The hotel had made an error by charging us twice for breakfast, but this was corrected when we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I liked staying at Novotel. I am disappointed on being a Accor member and not getting the benefits promised in the sales pitch that is told to you on the phone. No problem with the hotel it self. Really enjoyed the visit

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Sydney Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel nicely situated on Darling Harbour. We stayed in a room with harbour view. Fantastic views at night. Lots to do around the hotel - day and dinner harbour trips, nice restaurants, convention center and square all within a few minutes walk. Also can take a water taxi or cab to Circular Quay where the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House are located. Hotel has a decent restaurant, but it can be crowded. Weekend rates are a bit steep, but is to be expected. If you're looking for a nice place to stay on business or vacation this is just the place.

Reviews.Title: “Family Get Together in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms to be very comfortable and well equiped. The view over the harbour was beautiful, especially the city lights at night. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We would recommend the Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour to anyone travelling to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A fabulous location, great service, comfortable room. Best asset was the staff - everyone I dealt with was pleasant and helpful beyond what I might have expected. All in all, a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had read various reports about this hotel and were dubious, but found the staff, location and hotel itself to be very suitable for our needs. This hotel is very close to the city within a 10 min walk over the old pyrmont bridge straight up into George and Pitt Streets. Easy walking to the rocks, having Paddy's markets there was very handy for our teenage children who wanted to explore. The IMAX was fantastic, the shops and restaurants, China Town all great and very convenient. Hotel staff very pleasant and room was comfortable and clean. Will definately stay again this year as we need to travel to Sydney again and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: CanOz11 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Attached via walkway to Harbourside at Darling Harbour, this hotel is in an excellent location. The price you pay is for the convenience of this location. Our room was small by Australian standards but the hotel thankfully allowed us a third person. The price for this ($60) seemed excessive but I haven't had to add a third recently. The beds were very firm - not to my liking but that's personal preference. My friends and I also found the beds to sleep very hot ... maybe due to the underlay? The shower had a significant amount of black mildew on the grout. Plenty of hot water but the water pressure was lacking. The room was otherwise clean. If you need to stay close to Darling Harbour, you can't do much better than this hotel but you pay a premium. Otherwise, I'd say you can find something nicer for the same price point in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at this hotel and felt the standard was very poor. To my surprise I was very impressed with my stay. The standard has improved. A great location being right on Darling Harbour. Great outlook over the city and Darling Harbour in a Harbour view room. Staff very helpful, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time. The motel was excellent, staff friendly and room was very good. We arrived at lunch time and our room was ready which was great as we were able to access our room and drop our luggage before we went to Mary Poppins at 2.00. Breakfast was first class.

Reviews.Title: “HARBORSIDE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour was brilliant, greeting on arrival, service and breakfast were all excellent. Location was the best and so easy for transport. Rooms very clean and the bed was just so comfortable. Did find that each time we had to see baggage concierge, had to wait a few minutes for someone, but that was okay.

Reviews.Title: “25th anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had the loft suite it was lovely very spacious. we wanted something a bit special as it was our 25th anniversary. It is the best motel we have stayed at. We will definately stay again and i have already told freinds about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great location which provides a pleasant and easy walking distance to CBD. Service provided by the concierge was excellent.The room we had was quiet, well serviced and spacious. This resulted in a very pleasant few days break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Soicee Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a prime location & we enjoyed our stay except for 2 irritating matters. The main concern was the bed mattress. It was very soft & lacked support. I spend at least 150 nights a year in hotels & I have never slept on such a soft mattress. If our stay was longer than 2 nights I would have requested a room change. The other matter was the lack of glasses in the bathroom to store toothbrushes, toothpaste etc. This is the first time I have stayed in a 4 star hotel that did not provide bathroom glasses.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LeezS2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great restaurant and great location as so much to do in Darling Harbour

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was a great hotel friendly staff ,excellent location, great buffet breakfast for the price would recommend to a friend for the price of the room we paid wish it was a little bit bigger but other than that had a fantastic time

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: filo_o1
Reviews.Content: Great location by Darling harbour. Easy to get to from the airport by Taxi or by utilising the train/tram link. Clean, good room service, good bar - everything you should expect.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it should be at the prices charged”
Reviews.Author: Balanced_reviews
Reviews.Content: I personally would not pay this much for a hotel as I'd rather spend the cash on other things - but this was paid for by a client directly (thank you!) The location is stunning (9th floor); most comfortable bed I've ever slept in; ipod dock in room; very helpful staff. Downside - for a room at $AUS 319 per night (a discounted rate at that!) I'd expect free internet access / Wifi, but it's chargable here and not cheap :o( Fire alarm went off during the night - staff actions could have been better - no staff waiting outside to marshall, check off or inform guests, so we were left to our own devices stood outside in pjs etc, while other guests were left gawping out of top floor windows while alarm still going off. Restaurant food OK but portions small and expensive; I suggest you eat out - lots of places nearby to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ContributinTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was not a bad hotel. They are charging what I would call a premium business hotel price but it is in quite good condition. The location is superb and it is less than 10 minutes to walk to the city, although there are plenty of interesting bars/pubs and restaurants closer than that. The room was very quiet, the TV worked, it was clean and had a large, reasonably modern bathroom. I was surprised given my experiences previously with Novotel that have not been as favourable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MaffieAustralia
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed three night stay while my husband attended conference at Darling Harbour Convention Centre. Stayed on 3rd floor which was good because we did have a fire alarm go off and it was not far to go to be outside. Had only one breakfast as there are many other options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and right in the heart of darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: melbcollege
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights for a conference. Hotel is located right in the heart of darling harbour. You can walk to town hall train station or darling harbour ferry station within 10 minutes. Staff are very friendly and professional. they try to help me as much as they could. Bar in first floor also provide coffee and cakes for breakfast in a reasonable price. Staff at the bar are so friendly and helpful. I stayed at Executive room, it is big and up to date. Queen size bed is okey with great linens. Huge window and big bath room. Newspapers are available every morning for A-club members. I jogged two mornings from hotel to opera house. It is just so beautiful jog around the beautiful darling harbour through wharf to the harbour bridge and opera house. If you are a morning person, make sure you jog/walk around these area. heaps of restaurants around the hotel, a lot of cafe shops as well. It is a wonderful hotel I will definitely come back if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “great location but basic in everything....”
Reviews.Author: Clarence41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in front of darling harbor. walking distance to the opera, the harbor, china town and only 15 minutes to downtown. Also available was sky train that can get you around Sydney but the ticket is quite expensive.I prefer to walk. The rooms are spacious but nothing great. Very basic also the bathrooms. The walls are quit thin so I can hear the housekeeping cleaning the other room. The internet is slow and with charges. The staff is OK..I have stayed in this hotel a number of times and the staffs attitude varies. Sometimes they are friendly and helpful but other times they can be rude, unfriendly and unhelpful. It really depends on the person who attends to you so it's by luck!!! On my last trip, I was given a room where it was occupied. When I tried to open my room, I couldn't access it because someone was inside. I had to go back down and tell them and the person who assisted was apologetic and tried to make it up by upgrading me to a suite. No difference though except for the room being more spacious than the "normal rooms".

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: nikss
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, right on Darling Harbour, Walkind distance from the hotels you have Malls, restaurants and a few places like amusement park for children etc. The rooms of the Hotel are decent and comfortable, but the best part of the hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the views of the city!”
Reviews.Author: reb_and_steve Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely and clean and we loved the views of the city at night ... but it wasn't the best location for us as we spent most of our time in the city and we were back and forth from the city which got a bit tiresome.... While the monorail and light rail (tram) were right at our door step we got sick of paying and waiting for them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice average rooms and semi great location”
Reviews.Author: IBCali
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very basic and clean, if you are fortunate enough to get a room on the harbor side the views are amazing throughout the day and night! Wifi in the rooms is not up to par and is very expensive. I am a flight attendant and I stay at many great hotels around the world and you should not have to pay for Wifi in the rooms let alone pay for the connection and then be charged per minute once you are over a certain amount of megabytes. Room service was excellent and staff seems to be flooded all the time with customer requests, it took me 30 mins to pay my room service charge upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “a great nite out at darling harbour.”
Reviews.Author: rhondajohn922 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: our o/nite stay with our friends at the novotel darling harbour was a very pleasurable experience. must admit it has to be one of the very best sydney city hotels. the 'darling harbour'' view room was surperb and one couldn't get a better view of the harbour and the city lights. well done also to the staff especially in the dining room - the service was excellent and the food delicious! all in all our very favourite hotel in the city - we'll be back to enjoy yet another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Novotel Darling Harbour 1/9 - 5/9/11”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In the past 10 years (it may be more) I have stayed at this hotel sometimes 2 to 3 times in a year, to say I was disgusted with the public restrooms is an understatement. Saturday 3/9/11 my husband used the facilities on reception floor at around 10pm only to find someone had used the urinal for a toilet. There was a pair underpants still on the floor with faeces up the wall of the urinal. (I could elaborate more but will not) Whilst the hotel is not responsible for people who use the facility they are responsible for the cleanliness. The ladies on Sunday was not much better I used them at 10.45am the bin was overflowing with paper the floor had water on it and the toilets not flushed and several of them had paper all over the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Sandra K
Reviews.Content: This place ticked all the wrong boxes. To sum up, we had a million things go wrong with our booking - fought with reservations to finally get some sort of compensation for the inconvenience. Stayed here for two nights, air conditioning was broken. Did not get fixed the first night, did not get fixed during the day the second time we asked, When we returned to our room the second night at midnight, had to call reception to ask if something could be done, we were told there were no other rooms, and yay, we got a fan that looked like it was picked up from the side of the road. broken, noisy and would not rotate. just wonderful. The next day we checked out, and a cleaning lady was outside our room ready to clean while were leaving. Once I got home, I realised my straighetener was not in my bag.... i left it plugged in, in the bathroom. When I called, TWICE, i never got a response. Finally, two days later, I get told, nothing has been handed in and the cleaning lady doesnt know anything about it... surprise surprise. Lastly, the scrambled eggs for breakfast, tasted like the powdered kind out of a box. i will never stay here ever again....and have told everyone not to stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the novotel darling harbour for our 4 year anniversary. The service was great - we booked only 4 days before and we got a room on the 8th floor. We are also now engaged :) The bed was so comfortable and the room was very clean

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It was the perfect location for us and provided ease of access not only to the hotel but to the venues we needed to visit. Our rooms were clean and suited to our needs. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Dawn620
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely filthy in the common areas and within the hotel rooms. The carpet in our hotel room was littered with cigarette burns. The bathtub porcelain was worn down and black in areas of the tub. There were no drawers for clothing and very few hangers so, consequently, we lived out of our suitcases for a whole week. If a meeting brings us to Darling Harbour Convention Center again, we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: BCME2010
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times - great to see that the room type (Family room with 2 double beds) was upgraded since the last time we stayed. Room was very comfortable and clean. Checkin staff very friendly, offering the kids some toys. Fantastic location with many restaurants/shops at your doorstep if you decide not to eat at the hotel. This certainly won't be our last stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Service”
Reviews.Author: spice001 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is good and accessible to public transport, but the service sucks. At 7pm, I requested for a toothpaste (for which they were charging a fee; the room service guy said, "This is a five star hotel, no complimentary toothbrush & toothpaste." Duh??), and 35 minutes later, still no toothpaste arrived. I called to cancel the toothpaste and they acknowledged. But at around 8:30pm, room service brought the "ordered" toothpaste. Also, the newspaper they offered to be brought in the morning never arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... but needs a renovation in the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Irene A
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get the rooms with a promotion at half price, however I would hate paying the full price for the rooms!! The bathroom is old and the bath tub was cracked! The water pressure was very poor too. The room was ok and clean, well, with the usual uncleaned places... The view was SUPERB as well as the location! Reception is nice too and the staff very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you would expect from this sort of accomodation. It neither exceeded or dissapointed. The rooms were average but the TV did not work. It was clean but dirty in all the usual places that these rooms are. (Caked on dust on the vents and ducts etc). The breakfast affair was exactly the sames as all the other hotels. However the service and the knowalge of the staff was good. In particular they put us onto the best Thai Resturant I have ever been too and it was cheep as chips. Whould I stay here again? If the hotel was near where I needed to be for work then I would stay here but I belive that there are better hotels to stay at in Sydney like the Raddison in O'Connell st.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but thats about all”
Reviews.Author: shortcakeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with husband and 2 children aged 13 and 12. Had a room with 2 double (yes double) beds which was way to small with young adults. Chair, desk, armchair and fridge. Clean and neat but way to small. Pool was discusting with about 2 feet of water missing from the top. This hotel is in a fantastic location but is way overprices for what you get. No breakfast, wifi or parking included but all extras and at $300 per night it is outrageous. Staff were very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but only average value”
Reviews.Author: StargazerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A two minute walk to Darling harbourside and very close to transport make this a great location. the staff were very friendly and helpful. It's disappointing that the hotel is only average and overpriced for what it offers. Bedrooms are adequate without feeling special, limited bathroom products and ridiculous in room internet charges. Don't spend $25 on a buffet breakfast when you can walk over to the harbourside cafes for something much better and cheaper. A good nights sleep and very close to the conference location but wouldn't use my own money to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AntoniaHK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a number of occaisions and found the hotel to be of average standard. Depending on which staff is on reception I would rate the service excellent and personal to poor and inconsistent. The rooms are definitely tired, especially the bathrooms: with bathtubs cracked and mould growing around the fixtures! The beds are comfortable, but they only use one sheet on top and one sheet below the duvet, and have no duvet cover. I found bloodstains on the duvet on my bed when I woke up and realized the sheets had come off during the night. I felt that housekeeping should definitely have removed that duvet for hygiene reasons, but had left it like that and just expected the sheets to cover the stains. Quite disgusting really! Also, Internet was very expensive, something like $25 per 24 hours! I would not recommend this hotel for a special stay. But it is OK. And the location is good as it is right on top of Darling Harbour with a walkway to the harbor front dining and shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the location very good and the service was excellent. However, there are not enough accessible power points in the room for charging equipment - under desk. Also found the dining area and corridors etc in need of maintenance. They needed to be painted and cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “25$ 24h connection maximum 300MB download then you pay 0.10$ per MB...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Most expensive internet connection of any business trip I ever did, ridiculous! Housekeeping is not constant and good luck to find out how much a bottle of water cost as no bar pricing was available in the room (that's what I call non constant housekeeping). Otherwise the hotel was very well located and fairly well maintained. Staff is friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Family with young kids”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel at Darling Harbour is ok. Clean, great location but not 5 star - more your basic hotel. Although I booked for 2 adults and 2kids, there were only 3 towels and one set of toiletries. Every time they get this wrong. One real benefit is that I feel that my kids are welcome (unlike other hoitels like the Sofitel where they only allow up to 1 kid per room) - they allow up to 2 kids in each room, they have rooms with 2 double beds, kids up to 16yo eat free (handy for the buffet breakfast) and there's a little kids play area near their Dish restaurant - which all makes it very kid friendly. The only hotel to ever get this right is Sheraton on the Park - their housekeeping staff are 200%. But if you want a nice, clean, well located but basic place to stay where your kids are welcomed, then the Novotel is quite a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Sydney on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stopped at the above on many occasions over the years the service is excellent and the staff are very friendly and are very well aware of what customer service is and practice it. Thank you to all concerned

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I couldn't sleep that night as the light from the city flooded my room. There should be blinds on the window. Otherwise I was impressed by the room quality. TV was a bit hard to operate. Attended the hotel for a function at the Sydney Convention Center. Met Neil Armstrong (astronaut) and shook his hand. Had a little trouble finding my way back to the hotel from the convention.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: jabbablue
Reviews.Content: Quick check in, staff very friendly and helpful. Upgraded to a larger room with awesome views of the harbor. The room was very clean. Best nights sleep I have had in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Choose wisely”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Next time I'd go for the harbour view rooms. My Pyrmont view room looked into blocks of units with little privacy. Service at reception was slow with only one person there to check in guests. Location not as ideal as I had hoped for - need to use the pedestrian walkway to get over the rail line into the shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: chadsue
Reviews.Content: One night at the Novotel Darling Harbour, was amazing, we had three rooms each rooms were reserved for two adults and two children. The rooms had two queen sized beds pluss a sofa bed, all which were very comfortable. The room was modern with a fantastic view of Darling Harbour and the city. I would reccomend this hotel for a short stay, the price was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “4 in a bed??? are you kidding??”
Reviews.Author: bettyluvstravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after tossing up between this and another, I assured my partner I had stayed before and it was good. How wrong could I be?? We booked a room for 2 adults and 2 kids, but upon check in were told the only room left was a room with just a king bed ! after explaining that we had children, who were accounted for in the booking we asked well what are we to do? The man at reception replied that he was happy to put A rollaway into the room, we were left wondering and asked, what we were supposed to do about a bed for our other child as being 12 and 14 there was no way they would or should have to share a single rollaway bed !! The recepetion guy replied that there wasnt anthing else he could do, after driving 3 hours and arriving at dinner time, this was not the news we wanted to nor expected to hear. Finally after a few phone calls, it was suggested putting in another rollaway, even though its against regulations !! are you kidding me !! professional? I think not... How can what was such a fabulous chain of hotels, get it so wrong twice in a year ?? I wont be renewing my membership, for the 1st time in many years, shame on you accor !!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Complain”
Reviews.Author: ekidna6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a one night stop over. The standard room was clean and big enough for the two of us. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. I was very impressed with the window blind, as it had a good light seal and did not let in any morning sunlight. The staff were very efficient and very helpful. The Novotel is located in a fantastic position, just a short covered walk from Darling Harbour, and the Harbourside shopping complex. All in all, I would not hesitate to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when you're”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Right on the edge of the restaurant area in Darling Harbour. Easy access to city. On the day, it was perfect for what we were looking for, and I had a good night's sleep. I'd definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, if a little boring :)”
Reviews.Author: DoubleAK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, passing through Sydney between overseas trips. We arrived quite early from the airport and attempted to check in early; after an initial snooty response the manager was able to secure us a room that morning, which we were very grateful for after our long flight. The location is great, and we had a brilliant view of the harbour from our room. Overall a very nice, pretty standard Novotel hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip with my Friend Ria From Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay at the Novotel as usual. Love staying at Novotel it's accessible to everything and the service & staff are always wonderful. Rate is also reasonable & being an Accor member it's even better.
