Reviews.Title: “A peaceful night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Darling Harbour is a perfect location for travellers needing to be close to the Sydney Convention Centre. The rooms are pleasant and comfortable. It is a short walk across the a bridge to the CBD. Because the hotel is on Darling Harbour, it is a quiet refuge in an otherwise noisy city. The restaurant is of a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every way”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Used our free night to stay here on our way up north. Looked at various options but ended up choosing this venue based on reputation and location. Was not dissapointed. Upgraded room to view of Darling harbour. Wrapt that we did as the view of Sydney CBD was to die for, just sensational particularly at night with all the lights of the city simply breathtaking. Apart from that great spacious room with flat screen TV. Service excellent. Had a problem with x1 channel, rang reception and almost immediately a friendly technician was knocking at our door. Enjoyed dinner and breakfast at the restaurant within the complex. Quality/service was again excellent albeit forgot to give us bread rolls at dinner. Location perfect for taking in all the sights. Monorail station very close by. Basically could not fault. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “visitors from narrandera nsw”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent service but beds too small. Good location but need to replace hot buffet with something more user friendly. Good location but overnight parking is expensive. Good water pressure but shower over the bath.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel definitley needs some work on it!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times before as is convenient tothe Convention Centre. I start with the good news - a very comfortable bed - but it is down hill from hereon.......Concierge was conspicuous by his/her absecnce on my arrivaal to assit with luggage; Somebody else's dirty knickers were left in the wardrobe in my room; My room service dinner order was not what i had ordered - however, when I didi receive the right meal - the food was good; the shower was cold and took a good 8 minutes for the water to run hot - by which time i had a had a cold shower; checkout was painfully slow - two people on reception in hotel of that size at 0830 - 0930 in the the morning of a hotel predominantly for the corporate sector was woefully inadequate - do you want me to continue?

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i would recomend this hotel to anybody ,after a pleasant and friendly place to stay with top meals & friendly service in the dining room. the location of the hotel overlooking darling harbour could not be better especialy with all the shops & amenities available on site. the wife & myself are in our mid sixties but still found it easy to get around. myself being an invalid pensioner with the help given by all of the staff made it so much more pleasant. who ever is in charge of staff training must be very proud of their achievments .the room overlooking the harbour was very clean &comfortable . a great two nights was had by the wife &myself on our 47th wedding anniversary.it could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “value and location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: recently attend business conference for 3 days in Sydney, after long day at work and flight from Perth it was nice to arrive and get settled in. Location was great, enjoyed local restaurants etc overall service was good, room was clean and comfortable - i would definately stay again and recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well appointed and comfortable rooms, great location, particularly to Star City and Monorail. Breakfast and dinner taken at the hotel were excellent and resonable prices. Nice touch to be able to access free internet for short periods.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Saturday through til Monday. Had a great stay hotel room spotless. Generally don't sleep to well in different bed but found bed & pillow very comfortable. Happy hour drinks from 5 - 6pm go down well. Bar service very good. Only down side was I had rang 3 days before arriving from Melbourne to organise bottle of wine for friends birthday to be left in the room which wasn't there on arrival! Rang to organise another bottle which still didn't arrive. Thought I might be charged for 2 bottle's on check-out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JessicaB123
Reviews.Content: This is the 1st time I stayed in Sydney at Novotel because the hotel I normally stay in was full. I will never be staying at my old hotel again. The staff here are fantastic and so attentive. From reception to the restaurant. The matrie'd of the restaurant Matt was the most helpful and charming man. Helping myself and my husband plan our anniversary trip in Sydney. The rooms were clean and spacious. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only problem was that our room was serviced while we were at breakfast before we signed out. This meant that we felt uncomfortable going back in their and had to open new soap and use hand towell etc. One staff member told us that our car had to be out at 11 am the next day, however another told us that company policy allowed us to stay in the car park until 5 pm. It's a great location and we love staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour as it very convient to to all the places we usually go to when we are in Sydney. It is close to some excellent restaurants at Darling Harbour and in the city. It is easy for travel to most places by car, by public transport or if you enjoy walking as we do you can walk to your favourite destination. The city shops offer plenty of variety as does Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It has been a long time between stays but this hotel is still great value and a wonderful location. Staff were friendly and efficient and the restuarant was excellent. The view over Darling harbour is terrific and access to the waterfront and all the facilities is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel very central to all things Darling Harbour, very easy to find, a beautiful view of the city night sky line, very informative staff who answer all your questions, I would definetly stay here again and recommend the hotel to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again by choice”
Reviews.Author: manasicaje
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the Convention Centre, so fantastic location for that. But otherwise, I would never choose to stay here again. Ridiculously overpriced at AUD$280/night â€¦ and that was the A|Club Members Price! The view was amazing and beautiful â€¦ which goes back to my comment about the great location. But my biggest gripe is the service. Hotels have very little chance to engage with and impress their customers, so check-in, check-out and other rare encounters are an opportunity to delight or disappoint â€¦ and this place disappointed. Check-in and check-out both took ages and, because of the layout with a huge pole right near the front desk, there was no discernable queue â€¦ some guests didnâ€™t notice the queue so just walked straight up to the counter before others waiting for ages, and the staff didnâ€™t notice or say anything â€¦ thatâ€™s their job, not ours! So it led to an awkward exchange between tired travelers. And then the bell-boy refused to help me get my car out of the carpark, and told me I had to wait in line at front desk one floor up for a ticket to exit. The line was about 30min long so I went back down and requested some assistance to exit â€¦ again refused to help until I literally had to ask him for the managers mobile number to get some assistance. To top it off, the â€œManagerâ€� was then flippant and sarcastic when helping. To me, this place seems to suffer from an attitude of â€œwe donâ€™t need your business, weâ€™re doing just fine thank youâ€�. Of course, there were good points. The rooms were nice and big. The bed was comfortable. Well appointed minibar. Expensive wifi but that is standard for Australian hotels. Shame the service lets it down.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Top - we will not stay here anymore”
Reviews.Author: TravellerNormandy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cold, heather is really an option. First stay the heather was blocked, after a few days freezing a technician came to open the flaps, the day after the system was down. Internet is extremely expensive, take care about that. For 4 days we paid 140 AU $. The fact that you have a A-Club card and that on the reservation there is written "internet in the room" just means you have to pay. Over some volume of datas you are over taxed. Not acceptable for a business hotel. The breakfast is extremely poor, lot of fat, fruits no taste and tomato not eatable. The gym room is small and stinks. There are better hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY”
Reviews.Author: johnoT
Reviews.Content: Great location â€¦ close to Light rail â€¦ Monorail and Darling Harbour. Could not fault Hotel staff they were fantastic and very friendly. We did arrive very early in morning and our rooms were not ready so we just dropped our luggage and enjoyed the day while we could. Reception staff did say they would call when our rooms were ready but they didn't - which is no big deal! Restaurant staff were amazing, food and service was awesome on several occasions - could not fault at all. Rooms were both very clean, didnâ€™t have a great view but we only booked Standard Twin Rooms and you get what you pay for! Overall stay was very enjoyable, would recommend this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i paid for the best room i could get it said darling harbour views, i had a corner of darling harbour and views of railways the rooms had a door inside that lead to the room next door, this was my girlfriends birthday 24/7/2011 we went out came back late woke the neighbor up not intentionally, im not just making this up we did not sleep all night, if the people next door even whispered i could hear it there baby cried as soon as we got to sleep and just kept going and going and going... that door really gave me the [--] more then having a crap view... then i paid our bill which was not much 50$ extra it was charged to my bond they gave me the remainder, we only had 2 drinks and the internet for 1 hour but they charged $24 for the day i used it for no more then 15min to check some emails for work... i didnt mind and bother asking even where does 2 fizzy drinks add up to 25$??? then the next day noticed my card was charged an extra $54.50 for god knows what reason i am just to angry to even ring and argue they can take what they want i just wont go there ever again, staff was very friendly downstairs and helpful, outside looks like a very nice place they dont validate parking it costs cheaper to just pay the place next door... parking is quiet the walk for me even though its just next door... rooms are pretty average just them doors are unbelievable F1's have more privacy then this place......

Reviews.Title: “Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay & everything was so close. We caught the monorail everywhere & went to watch Mary Poppins at the Capitol & it was fantastic. We will be back for sure. Maybe next time on my honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: lizzy309
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the fact that this hotel had everything nearby. Darling Harbour restaurants, shopping centre, monorail & light rail stations, ferry to Circular Quay... All within a short walk which came in handy as it was pouring for the 5 days we were in Sydney! Room was a good size and clean, however as I am a bit ocd when it comes to cleaning, could've been a bit cleaner with the dusting... There were 3 of us and we slept fine on the 2 double beds. I love the beds in Novotels, always so comfy! I suggest to get the pillow you want as soon as you arrive as my first night wasn't so good.. then I found the pillow options. Slept much better! Booking was a bit of a pain as was told different information with hotelclub, but a call direct to the hotel was all that was needed. I organised a fruit platter for my mum as we went for her birthday and it was all organised when we arrived. Nice little treat for her. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was friendly and never had an issue. Extra towels promptly brought to the room, room service quick and fresh, reception & porter very helpful. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, not because of the price, but we have a few places we like to have breakfast in Darling Harbour & Circular Quay. We paid around $200 per night which I think is reasonable, it's generally what we pay for hotels when we travel. Had a few drinks at the bar.. not overly expensive, you expect those prices in hotels. Overall, loved it. A bit of noise from the random stupid drivers but apart from that, no complaints. Mum wants to go again in November and stay again so she must have enjoyed it too!

Reviews.Title: “Well priced hotel suitable for young family”
Reviews.Author: 40ish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in mid July 2011. Excellent room overlooking the harbor. We booked directly with Accor and paid less than $200 a night. This is incredible value considering the full breakfast buffet available. The room was perfectly sized for a family of 4 (kids 10 and 12 years) Loved having undercover access to the Monorail. We purchased a 3 day family pass for the light rail and monorail which was well worth the $50 as there was a lot of rain!

Reviews.Title: “Electrical Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. Only disappointment was that due to electrical problems that could not be fixed, had to move rooms during my stay. Liked the views and the location, did not like having to move during stay.

Reviews.Title: “not half as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: loveegypt
Reviews.Content: hi all , i stayed here with two kids and myself, from the time of check in i was ignored by two desk staff who served two people in front of me and left me waiting. After taking over 20 mins to check in , got to our room and the view was great ( darling harbour view), spacious room , but very tired looking and beds were so old and uncomfortable everytime i moved the bed springs would creak and poke into my back. Breakfast staff were extremely rude and told me i could not have children free for breakfast , but would have to pay for one, when i have a accor card, after arguing with her that i have never had to pay, i said to her can i pay for a bowl of weetbix then, as this is all my teenager would eat, and she said no, you will have to pay the $30, so i said fine , as my daughter was getting upset over the argument. So basically her bowl of weetbix cost me a lot of money, i later spoke to reception and they fixed this up, however i was charged the full price and not given an accor discount on my own bill ( just wasnt worth arguing about again), the car parking i thought was extremely overpriced, at $40, and if you stay one level down, for 24 hours parking it is only $25.00 so i suppose one has to decide whether to take that option. I probably wouldnt stay here again, as star city is close by and a much more modern option.

Reviews.Title: “Wet Week - Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We picked a very rainy weekend to visit Sydney, but the Novotel was really close to what we wanted to do and see and we were able to get to most places without getting too wet. The staff were friendly and the room was bigger and more comfortable than expected. Breakfast is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: daveak
Reviews.Content: You definitely want to get a harbour side room. It's great for watching the fireworks on Saturday nights. The rooms were clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Good coffee downstairs in the lobby. Plenty to do around Darling Harbour. Lots of resturants and shopping in the Harbourside Mall and around the other side and we took advantage of all of it. Very convenient to downtown and Circular Quay, with the Opera House and Botanical Gardens just past that. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very wet day and night but still close enough to walk to great shopping and then to star city for a show. room looked out over darling harbour and was a good size. went with 20yr old daughter and we both loved the comfy beds and dine in breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Service in try to get dinner”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service at the front desk was great he was very helpfull and said he would ring the accor to fix up my card but the service in the restaurants was not good it was 6pm no one in the restaurant and the lady said it was fully book out but she said if you can eat in 20mins we could come in two adults and two kids not good for kids to rush so we went in to the mall and spent money there was beause i was on a free night that they didnt want my money or did they think i was cheap i dont no so i dont think i would ever eat in that place and i will tell friends and family never to eat there as well and why is parking so dear there $40 a day were at manly novotel it was $25 a day they all should be the same thanks

Reviews.Title: “my experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great service from all staff, everyone was very friendly and helpful except one person - the assistant manager. He was abrupt to my wife when asking for help to find child change room. He said there wasn't one and he couldn't help us with providing an area to change our child's nappy. Other staff -a lady - showed us the facilities. Otherwise had a great time. David cole

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, great food”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times and always find the location great and the rooms comfy. This time no exception. Booked through Accor so great rate and we arrived really early for a function elsewhere and were able to check in at 11.30am which was a bonus. Our room appeard to have recently been refurbished and was clean and modern. We decided to have dinner at Dish and the choice was good and food great. Supplemented by our dining discount and 2 complimentary glasses of wine, we were really impressed with this visit. As mentioned, only downside is cost of parking but can't complain when everything else is so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: smel_98 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was great - we were able to leave our car in the carpark for the entire day after we checked out at no extra charge. We did paid extra for a harbour view room and were disappointed as we got one with an obstructed view. Breakfast was not even close to being worth $31 a head. Most of the hot food was cold and the selection was quite poor. Would stay here again for the location, but would go for a walk down to the harbour for an endless choice of cheap, tasty breakfast options. Quiet, comfortable rooms and top location.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This venue was the perfect location to the Sydney Convention Centre. Very Clean, Nice rooms. Easy acess to shopping and amazing Dining. Right next to monorail and train station. 20 mins ride from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Disgraceful Breakfast, too expensive and is like a kidfdies breakfast, at $31 I expect a higher standard and better variety with real juice and real coffee etc Location is great and this hotel seriously needs a renovation, this is my second stay and last unless it is bought up to date

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great room, views, service and comfort. The Harbourviews room were fantastic. The room was a great size and very clean. Parking facilities are available. The location is excellent just a short stroll to Darling Harbout and Star City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this room after being offered one of Accor's deals. The price was good, the service attentive without being overbearing, the location was very close to shops, attractions and transport, and the view from our Executive room across Darling Harbour was spectacular. We are a family of 4 who travelled with 3 other families (total of 15 people, 8 adults and 7 children) who would definintely consider staying at the Novotel on Darling Harbour again.

Reviews.Title: “great family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel with a great location. with the monorail just a 2 minute walk from hotel you don't need any other way of transport. We found the hotel to be great for families traveling with kids. The rooms are large, spacious with a great view. I would stay there over and over again, will def consider it for our next trip to lovely Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful View”
Reviews.Author: Amandalin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here early july with family and i paid $249 plus a 1.5% credit card fee booked directly with Novotel. I stayed in a Executive Darling Haebour View room with 2 double beds. The room was clean but bath had some marks on it and so did the day bed. This is not the fault of house keeping as they are fantastic, any time we needed anything they were great. The hotel and rooms are a bit tired and they could replace some things like the bath etc. There was no biscuits with the tea and coffee, i asked housekeeping but they said the hotel used to supply them but no longer do. My brother stayed at a $60 hotel at taree the night before and they had biscuits. This is the first place that i have stayed at that dose not give you bisciuts. Novotel say that they are a family hotel and encourage you to stay with kids.Well they promise a welcome gift for kids but when we checked in my Daughter was not offered anything. She remebered and we went and asked and they had to look around for something and came back with a little bag with a animal on it, my Daughter is 11. We asked what the prices at the restaurant were and they couldnt help us and we wanted some pencils and paper for my Daughter but they coudnt find any. The staff when we arrived offered to help with bags and were friendly. All hotel staff were polite and friendly especially housekeeping. The location is great and the view is beutiful. Go to pancakes at the shopping centre for Breaky its Yummy. There is a pillow menu which is good and if you want complimentry slippers just call housekeeping. The swimming pool is empty and parking is $40 cheaper at the parking lot downstairs$28.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location convenient to all the local attractions, shopping and the CBD. Public transport is very accessible. The service was excellent, the room was spacious and good value. The hotel is also very convenient for business travellers due to its close proximity to the Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Happy customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel, darling Harbour for 4 nights and it was a very pleasant experience. The room was nice and big for my family size and it was clean. The hotel staff were very friendly except for the clerk that helped us check out at reception - he was not rude but could have been more friendly. He just gave me the impression that he needed to go somewhere and had to check us out asap. Other than this, the stay was enjoyable and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Using Advantage Plus Complimentry Night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was extremely embarrassing when we went to check in, to find that we were not booked in under my name. Upon further investigation, it was found that my daughter's name had somehow been substituted for mine, and she held the booking for the room. I do not know how this can happen when our reservation confirmation clearly stated my name and Accor membership number. After extensive checking by the customer service officer, he was able to verify that the reservation should have been made in my name, and he changed the booking accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MossmanBlondie Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, always stay at accor hotels, such as Pullmans Cairns, Sofitel Brisbane, Novotel Brisbane, Pullmans Sydney Olympic Park, Novotel on Collins in Melbourne. This is my second stay at Novotel on Darling Harbour and my only criticism would be the bed wasn't as comfortable as other accor beds I have slept in. But having said that I would still stay at this hotel again when staying in Sydney. Staff are exceptional, location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour many times for location and prestige this hotels has got it all. When i don't get into the hotel because it's booked out no other place comes near it , for me the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we where greeted with a smile. Nothing was a problem in making our stay comfortable and memorable. I would have no hesitations in staying on my next visit to Sydney. Thank you for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Being an Accor Advantage Plus member we usually stay in Darling Harbour. During the week we received a free room upgrade, mainly looking straight at Darling Harbour. The city lights are really lovely. The service is always good. We dined in their Dish Restaurant and had the Angus Steak. It was the best and will have it again next time. It is close to walk to Westfield etc. Just a good place to stay at. Renate, Wollongong.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Sydney getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Took my teenage kids away for a night, paid for an upgrade to a city view room- gorgeous view to city skyline. Stayed at Hilton 2 days later with husband and we were given an upgrade to exec level, no need to pay. Thought the $30 required by Novotel was a bit rich, but as said, view was lovely. Great location at Darling Harbour, had a nice lunch at an Italian restaurant at Cockle Bay. Walk to Town Hall (and even Circular Quay the following day) not too far. Dinner at Novotel was delicious, perfectly cooked steak followed by amazing desserts: apple tart for me and cappuccino brÃ»lÃ©e for daughter. Breakfast following morning was wonderful, MUCH nicer (and less expensive too) than the Hilton's breakfast (which was abysmal really..) Overall, a lovely stay. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but dirty hotel.”
Reviews.Author: csteets
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location but is very dirty. The carpet has stains all over the place. There is also mold in the shower. This hotel is tired and worn out. It appears the hotel manager takes no pride in the hotel as it would only take some elbow grease and hard work to solve the problems. The staff is very nice though. Be aware that this hotel charges a fee to pay by credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed,good location,but ....”
Reviews.Author: Tsa_RyszardMom Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: bell boy very good,forgot his name,we arrive around lunchtime,check inn ok room are ready but funny,my room different amenities from my sister room,we610,611,612 but mine dont have lotion&bodyscrub,funny i pay same price&this happen during entire 2 day of my stay. Breakfast ok though some mix up info,i though all expense are prepaid &im a member of accor plus,but it sort out with lots of confusion. Concierge not great,wont help with online check inn and when i use the computer in hotel the printer jam cant print,so guest service turn off

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour, Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, a walk to Darling Harbour and Star City Casino. Hotel staff very helpful. Room very clean and well stocked, had a great view over Darling Harbour from our room. Easy access to tram and monorail into the city and Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Location”
Reviews.Author: BEMM
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a family of four and found our room to be spacious and clean. We had an "executive darling harbour view" room. Loved the view over Darling Harbour, especially the lights at night. Easy location to monorail and Darling Habour attractions. Enjoyed the bar/lounge and found the staff to be friendly. Ate in the hotel restaurant and was very disappointed in choice, price and service. The following night we went next door to eat at the Mercure which was an enjoyable meal and far more family friendly. Overall though we enjoyed our stay and will stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “quick overnight trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: quick check in, pleasant service,-quick check-out, parking available, clean room, walking distance to main city attractions, all that was required and expected for the stay. only down side was a guests' car parked in the incorrect spot making is difficult for other quest to leave car park, maybe registrations should be left at reception and that person asked to move the vechicle straight away. ,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome everything!!! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: spin462002
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, easy access to mono rail, light rail and Darling Harbour/city via handy walking bridge off the car park at the back of the hotel. Beautiful big hotel. The lovely Eve on Front Reception started us off on the right foot with a warm welcome and a little free gift for my eight year old daughter. I booked a room with two double beds which was perfect for myself, my eight year old and my seventeen year old daughters. The room was spacious and the beds were some of the best I have experienced at a hotel, ever! World class, so comfy and cloud like! There were down doonas and pillows which I asked to be replaced due to an allergy to feathers. This was done promptly and an extra towel was provided fuss free too. Lovely big bath although I think the shower over the bath has had it's day. The bathroom looked newly renovated (more lights would have been a good idea, it was so dark in there you couldn't put makeup on using that mirror, you had to use the mirror on the wardrobe door next to the mini bar. ) and you would never guess the hotel celebrates it's 20th Birthday this year! Lovely big bath sheets and nice complimentary toiletries completed the picture. We had room service dinner as we were just too exhausted to go out. Food was good value for money but for the steak in the child's meal which was done to death. Excellent fresh fruit salad and ice cream and vegetable stack with grilled cheese. Chips were thick cut and yum! Watched a little TV, a few pay tv channels but not enough, too much sport! Extra nice hotel, great location, clean and comfortable rooms, wish we could have stayed longer!! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have been going here for years. They did not have any record of my previous stays which was a bit strange. I also could not get maintenance to come and help with a problem with the room TV. Nothing major but it was very annoying - when I rang for a status update I was told that "they don't answer their hpones down there". I have had a high opinion of this hotel over the years but it looks like standards are slipping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, central to everything. Light rail, monorail, explorer bus right outside the door. Walking distance to CBD. Food good although a little expensive. Room was clean and comfortable. Check-in service was great and during our stay the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with basic service”
Reviews.Author: GuyVanHooveld
Reviews.Content: The hotel as such is nice, rooms are comfortable, the location is excellent to visit Sydney and the local attractions, nice restaurants, shops in the neighbourhood, walking distance from the city, nice view on the harbour. The reason why I only give an average rating is the relatively poor service: people at the reception desk are not efficient, and the service is quite impersonal. I forgot my accor card and I asked them if they could find me in their database. This was impossible. In another Novotel a few days later, they found my number in two minutes and credited my account. The hotel is incredibly overpriced and you have to pay a ridiculous amount to get an internet connection. This is often the case in Australia. There was an internet corner with iMacs and a printer in the lobby but they were out of order when we were there. On the positive side, the people at the entrance taking care of the luggage and ordering taxis and so on were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Wonderful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AdamsJ_Sydney
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the hotel in May and we loved it. The harbour is right at your door step and the room was very comfortable. My only complaint is the hot water or lack of it during the mornings when one wants to take a shower. I think the shower heads need changing too. Breakfast is buffet style but needs to improve in terms of choices available. The pankackes were a little on the stiff and dry side. Dinner menu is quite restrictive. There needs to be more choice again. I think buffet style dinners should be the go at this hotel. I called the hotel and informed them that I will be checking in , in the evening. The call was made 6-8 hours before my arrival and found out to my surprise that my room was still not ready. The attendant at the reception was most kind in assisting me however and apologised profusely. I wil definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “mechanical ventilation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: lovely room,clean,fresh modern.Only complaint the noise from the mechanical ventilation kept us from having a sound sleep.The view from our window was amazing,Sydney [prymont] is a happening place and the Novotel certainly contributes to finishing off your night..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Drbackup Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The harbour view is worth it. It is a great location - there is an easy walk to the waterfront and all the restaurants and shopping centre. I was lucky to have perfect timing to see the free fireworks on the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: wardolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights on a recent visit to Australia. In the main, staff were efficient and friendly. Probably the only exception to this was in the bar where there was often just one member of staff working and the service tended to be slow. The rooms were well decorated and maintained and cleaning was to a high standard. We returned to the hotel for our final evening before flying home to the UK and the rom we were allocated smelt of smoke. With no fuss, the reception staff allocated us a new room and arranged for our luggage to be moved for us. As first time visitors to Sydney, the location was excellent. A short walk over a footbridge took you to a shopping mall and then into Darling Harbour with its numerous restaurants. It was fantastic for eating out as a family in an evening with so much choice both in terms of cuisine type and price.

Reviews.Title: “Opportunities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The dinner menu could be improvedf as there isn't much for both gluten and lactose intolerant. The location is good if you are attending the Convention Centre. I preferred the Grand Mecure apartments to stay in but they are no longer part of the group as I find the Novotel rooms very small and the shower is over the bath. Also for some reason my a club points are never credited to my stays.

Reviews.Title: “As close to the convention centre as you can get”
Reviews.Author: scubal0ver
Reviews.Content: Walk out into the car park, past the monorail station and you're at Darling Harbour, beside the convention centre. It's literally minutes away. Rooms (especially where we were on the 9th floor) are quiet and have a great view over the water into Sydney. The rooms are not huge, but you do have room to swing a cat, or even two. The bathroom, is both modern and well equipped. Breakfast was good and prices are in line with hotel effectively in the middle of a major city. We found local restraunts were good, we especially liked Kamikaze a tepanyakki restaurant in the Harbourside building. A really nice place to use as a base to enjoy Sydney, or to attend a conference at the Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location very convenient particularly for the monorail, rail, ferry and restaurants. Room was good and the bed comfortable - important after the flight from LA. Our brief stay was not long enough to take advantage of all the facilities but we are regulars at Novotels and rate this hotel well with others we have experienced. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the lobby cafe very convenient and tasy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel except for this”
Reviews.Author: BAVICHENNAIINDIA
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. we had a nice room but there was an inter-connecting door(ofcourse closed and locked on both sides) to an adjacent room. There was an orgy of sorts in the adjoining room and we could not sleep. The reception staff took their own time to ask the occupant to stop the racket. The next morning,Manager Kavitha told me that the guest was asked not to disturb other guests but what she added was not acceptable. She said that she cannot guarantee that he will be quiet on subsequent nights nor can she assure me that the next occupant will not disturb us.She said that she could change OUR room if we so desire. I am yet to get a mail from the GM asking for my comments. I requested this. Very unlike a Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and looked after our needs as requested. The room was amazing with plenty of space. Especially the views Darling Harbour is one pretty place. Easy access to shops and food is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was great (1) we were given an early check in (nice after an early morning start with 2 young children) and (2) when the carpark was full on our 2nd night, we had to park next door in the public parking. They reversed charged both our car parking days. That's good service and (3) the complementary house wines were a really nice gesture. Our kids loved the hotel and our son in particular liked the computers in the lobby. Location of the hotel is fantastic. Right next door to the shopping centre, walking distance from all restaurants, aquarium, wild life park, powerhouse museum and imax cinemas. Only down side was the double beds were not comfortable for 2 adults. Overall was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice view”
Reviews.Author: romusha
Reviews.Content: I don't think unless you have a business breakfast meeting then having breakfast at the hotel is just not worth it. If you could choose between room upgrade or breakfast included price; just go for the room upgrade which will give you a room with a beautiful view of Sydney's darling harbour. For breakfast, it is better go to Harbourside mall which is open since early morning. There are several coffee shops open already, including McDonald. As other reviewer mention, I'd like to confirm that this hotel, location wise is very strategic close to ferry quay and monorail station. It is within walking distance to Sydney Exhibition Center. But, if you don't like to walk too far for shopping to the city, then try to find hotel at the other side of the harbour. For the room, for mine, it is spacious and has a magnificent view. Internet connection will cost you about 24AUD for 24h access, bu if you just need for email checking, at the lobby, you get internet access for 30 minutes free, daily.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up for the Novotel in Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night, but your hotel is really great. You have a top location with all Novotel people very friendly and most helpful. We arrived early after completing a cruise and from the concierge to the reception staff all were most helpful in looking after our baggage and checking us in eraly. No complaints at all and keep up the good work. We will come again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and fresh”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel clean and tidy. The location was great for anyone attending a function at the convention centre. Close walking distance. Also close to Darling Harbour for more casual meals. A great outlook. Breakfast staff were friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Tried to check in early to be advised room would only be available if we were to upgrade with fee applicable. When I asked for confirmation of complementary breakfast as booking was made under a special offer "stay 2 nights and receive buffet breakfast for 2 complimentary" I was advised that I would have to provide written confirmation as it was not in the booking. Not off to a good start. The location was good, room as clean. Breakfast buffet needs a lot of improvement, hot food section was almost impossible to use. How do you balance your plate, serve your food and hold the fry pan lid all at the same time. Large jars of jam, vegemite not user friendly or hygienic, breads and pastries bland and boring.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Pyrmont”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay. Good service and comfortable bed. Parking cost is a bit excessive. The location is very central and has good access to both monorail and light rail. Staff ver very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT DARLING HARBOUR”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the size of the room and also the bathroom. The quality and size of the bathtowels was excellent We enjoyed the buffet breakfast it was good value for money The hotel is in an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the service is good. The only problem was that we arrived at 3.45pm and our room was still not ready. We also noticed that other guests were in the same predicament. The staff were courteous and efficient and compensated us with a drink at the bar. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, but ..............”
Reviews.Author: H-and-S-Langwarrin
Reviews.Content: We had a recent long weekend in Sydney and stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour. Rooms were large and clean, well fitted out, mini bar fridge, tea/coffee making facilities, ipod docking station if that floats your boat. Next door is the Harbourside shopping centre with specialty shops and lots of eateries that face the waterfront. Several convenience stores in the back street as well as the 24 hour Pyrmont Pub just down the road. The Maritime museum is 100 metres away which has a bus stop for the 443 bus that takes about 18 minutes to get to Circular Quay bus/rail/ferry terminal. On the other side of the museum is the Pyrmont Bay ferry wharf (200 metres) where the ferry will take you to Circular Quay in about 25 minutes (a great ride that takes you right under the Sydney harbour Bridge). Outside the hotel is the light rail/tram stop that will take you to the Star City Casino (walk there in 5 minutes) or Paddy's Markets. Outside is also the Monorail station that will take you around the CBD. You can walk across the footbridge to more eateries, wildlife display, aquarium, and the Darling Harbour King St Wharf 3 ferry terminal (600 metres) where ferries will take you to Circular Quay and places like Cockatoo Island, Homebush, Parramatta, etc. The Sydney Ferries and Sydney Buses websites are great and you can print off pdf timetables, route maps, etc. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, not good value and the glass lids on hot food serving pans made it difficult to hold your plate, serve food and hold the glass lid at the same time, a really dumb idea! On the last day (Monday) pastries and bread were either soggy or stale, yuk. Go to the Harbourside centre next door to the pancake restaurant, downstairs at the foot bridge end, very popular and cheaper. There are heaps of cafes and restaurants around the waterfront open for breakfast as well. Check in is 2pm check out 11am, for early check in they want to charge $30 for a room upgrade, for late check out $10 or $20 per extra hour (can't remember exactly) Below reception there is a free baggage check in/storage service, so suggest check in your bags, take a tour, have a meal and come back when you need to. They have a business centre, internet cafe and a cocktail bar which is pretty quiet, Ok for a glass of wine and a coffee after your night out on the town. Don't know about the pool as it was a cold weekend and not a priority, as for the gym, wouldn't have a clue. A handy tip, when in Sydney buy the MyMulti 1 day $20, 2 day $40 or weekly $57 tickets that allow you on all ferries, buses and trains. You can buy them at the newsagent in Harourside shopping centre, the 7/11 in the back street or the other convenience store. The light rail/tram and monorail tickets are from vending machines at stops. All in all, a great hotel for its location, but eat and drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: manloudyk Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location Excellent Service Close to transport and entertainment Family friendly and close the shopping Would come back again. It's nice to find a hotel that offers a discount for needing two rooms

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: frudis
Reviews.Content: loved the location of our hotel room at novotel darling harbour. was within walking distance of the monorail which took us to all the major attractions within the city...great, friendly staff that advised us we had probably been cheated on our taxi fare, and this information made us more aware for our next taxi trip. my kids were also quite happy when they received a nice little toy from reception at check-out. down side, free TV channels are not HD and very limited as far as what is available, not good when you have two young children. wouldnt recommend the one room with two double beds for a family with toddlers, but the room as a whole suited our needs for our 2 night stay. buffet breakfast downstairs in the morning is great, standard affair really, but very yummy all the same. would recommend that when you book your room, get this as an inclusion. Room service was quick and reasonably priced, but there are plenty of eateries around for you not to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic accommodation highly recommended for location, service and facilities. We enjoyed drinks with friends at the bar and we also enjoyed the full buffet breakfast. the staff went out of their way to accomodate us.

Reviews.Title: “Val Steven's opinion of the Pyrmont”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was quite small for two people, quite cramped with the chair by the second bed. We were on business and used the room to work through business planning in the evening. Would stay again partly because the location is really great when attention events at the convention centre, handy to the city centre and various attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Improvement Needed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel is in a very handy location they need to work on the cleanliness of their rooms. I have stayed at this property 4 times this year and each time find the bathroom to be in poor condition with mould throughout the shower areas, fixtures loose and general grim. The restaurant is good with excellent steaks but an uninspired menu and I think in a hotel of this supposed star rating it is appaling that you do not get vegetables with your meal, they are only available at an extra cost. A suprising choice given they promot their healthy lifestyle dining options!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: KnoxfieldKrazyK Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location and very clean rooms. Only complaint(?) would be the design of the bathroom. The hairdryer is in the alcove of the toilet so you need to stand near the toilet to dry your hair. Second is the door stop right in front of the toilet. I tripped over it once during the night - not a very good design. Apart from that everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “Pyrmont View”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Darling Harbour. Its convenient location is what attracts us there every time. The staff at the reception desk were friendly and made us all feel comfortable from the moment we walked in. The children were greeted with a little soft toy and the adults with complimentary drinks. The room, as it is expected, was clean and neat, with its two double beds, which are difficult to find in other hotels at Darling Harbour. One complaint only... the pillows are too fluffy! Next time I will order another from the "pillow menu" provided on the bedside table.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was what I would expect from a hotel of that status. The rooms were well presented and the staff was friendly and helpful. For a tourist the location on Darling Harbour is excellent. This is why I normally do not reply the these serveys as I have said everything that I want to say and I still can not continue.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location great but rooms and amenities very basic , if this was improved the hotel would be a good hotel for all business travelers , internet good but just the overall condition of the rooms is outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Stephannie2525 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are repeat stayers at Novotel Darling Harbour - excellent location, good value and awesome breakfast! We stayed up there this time due to proximity to the Capital theatre, as we were seeing Mary Poppins for my birthday, the theatre is a short walk away. The room was clean, staff friendly, and the service good. The kids ordered pillows off the pillow menu and were impressed. I liked the fact they gave us drink vouchers as we were repeat customers! Breakast was $27 for the 4 of us, as we have an accor card, so one adult eats for free and kids eat for free - bargain! The monorail is close by, so very easy to get the city shops! Overall, a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “first trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: grannienette Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A friend from PERTH who was unable to walk to far the NOVOTEL was the ideal hotel close to FERRIES,MONA RAIL and LIGHT RAIL We also were lucky to see free FIRE WORKS on the SATURDAY NIGHT. The only thing wrong the bed was not up to expectation I think they may need to be updated also you could here through the connecting door.

Reviews.Title: “KATY PERRY CONCERT AND ACCOMMODATION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of Novotel Sydney to all amenities is great. We stayed as we were attending the Katy Perry Concert at the Enterainment Centre and it was a nice stroll there and back after the concert. Staff are great too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a great get away, a bit expencive but i knew the price and agreed to pay it. Just wont do an other one in a hurry. Great location, handy parking. close to shops and the city. xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and quality as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Pyrmont provided exactly what I expected - exceptional service and a high standard of accommodation. My business trip meant I was travelling alone, and I felt really comfortable once I stepped through those doors. You made my stay thoroughly enjoyable, and I thank you for maintaining such a high standard of service. It's nice to know that you can at least rely on a few things still in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent clean comfortable room with excellent views. I liked the set up of furniture with the work desk and comfortable chair and foot rest. The bed and linen was so comfortable and the best feature was the courtesy of the staff

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel had exceeded our expectations. From check-in to check-out we found the staff friendly and helpful. As Accor members we found this hotel to be the best due to the location in Sydney,although the other Accor hotels we have stayed at around Australia also we have had no problems with either. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip too Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: indi_pendent
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great service and good food.the bed was a little on the softer side but the rooms were generous and fitments were exceptional.Recommend the harbor view side. Did I mention the location is great?

Reviews.Title: “Family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal location and hotel ambience perfect for kids - smart but not too smart. Breakfast selection so vast that even the fussiest eater will find something; and if under 12, will eat for free. We benefitted from Accor Advantage Plus - executive room, discounted breakfast and parking. Complementary glass of wine as fireworks went off in Darling Harbour was a brilliant way to end a long day. Was surprised that parking was now $40 a day - I did not see this on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Extremley happy with our Hotel Rooms and the wonderful staff in the Novetel Darling Harbour. Everything was so easy to access from here by foot and Monorail and if the Kids are happy and they where absolutley thrilled with our accomadation it makes everything else that much easier. We cant wait to return..

Reviews.Title: “romantic escape”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the excellent welcome from trainee Adam to the stylish room and the friendly smiles from all of the staff, this made our escape a memorable occasion indeed. The only negative i found was the cost of car parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect position, the staff eager to assist and resolve any issues, they even moved us when they were full to a more suitable room, thankyou! The room was lovely, the experience was a good one, the view was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the Novatel and where very impressed with our room. The views over Darling Harbour where fantatstic and the size and the amenities of the room where great. The only point to raise would be that if you parked at the Novatel they would have charged $40 per night, using the same carpark we where charged $28. We later found out that they could have validated our parking ticket and reduced the rate even further but never mentioned this to us.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: JadeDV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel in Darling Harbour for business purposes as another option. From the first day I arrived it was nothing but a nightmare. There were little things that was meant to be a given that I didn't get - ipod dock not working & no menu service booklet in the room. When asked about, the response was as if I was lying about it or that I didn't know how to use the dock! Then the worst was when I came back late from work and ordered room service at 8.30pm, only to receive it very late at 10.00pm after several calls to room service and asking to speak to a manager on the night. That was unacceptable for a 4.5 star hotel to forget my order, only to be told when I made the 1st enquiry on why it took so long that it would come up in 10 minutes! My order was not placed at all! To top that off the food (chips) were cold and not cooked properly. I had lost my appetite by then and the complimentry offer wasn't good enough for me! Then the next day I stayed there, I came back from work to find my room wasn't serviced. I called housekeeping to find out and they told me I'd left the DD on the door. This wasn't true as when I came back to room the tag was lying on the floor in the hall way. In any case, they didn't clean the room but was happy to come in to see what Mini Bar I'd spent! How ridiculous is that?? My room needed new coffee cups and the tray of breakfast wasn't taken away, so left the room quite messy to be in. Although they got housekeeping to come up and clean the room, I wasn't satisfied as this time was eating into my own time. I wanted to rest after a long day, instead I had to wait for management to call me & send up housekeeping. Then the house keeping people had the audacity to tell me I had left the DD sign out again. How rude of them to accuse me of doing this? The guest and customer's are right, don't argue or allude to make them feel like they are lying! The manager tried to assure me that he'd look after me on my next stay and offered free nights etc. but to date I haven't heard back from them and it's been over 2 days since my email feedback on what bad experience I had had during my stay! All in all service and the professionalism was very poor. Telling me that you care about your guest/s experience but not demonstarting it from reception to room service to managment is VERY disappointing! I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, lovely view. Nice bed and ensuite. Lighting is poor (as in most hotel rooms). The reception is welcoming but the lower ground floor is a bit spartan. Weekday rates were good ($194.25) but the friday night cost $329 which is expensive for 1 person. Good breakfast buffet. [Where were prices displayed?] Teeny gripe - no shower cap; no bath mat one day. it would be nice if proper coffee could be provided in the room, rather than instant. And the milk (teeny carton) tasted awful in my cup of tea. These last things could easily be fixed! Overall I had a good stay and a relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Take Copy of Reservation Confirmation to Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My only grip is that my Reservation Confirmation was different to the amount I was charged on check out...Being considerably higher to what I was confirmed. Feel hotel should honour the Reservation Confirmation even if it was an error on their behalf.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean room and woken at 4am by automated TV service”
Reviews.Author: MrYellowDuck
Reviews.Content: On the surface this is a typical example of a five-star Australian hotel. There were issues though that mean I would not stay here again: 1. The room had not been cleaned properly - there were wiskers in the sink and hair in the bath. 2. At 4am the TV in the neighboring room sprang to life and started looping the "Welcome to this Hotel" programme loudly enough to easily wake me. I could hear this programme clearly throughout my room. I doubt anyone was in this room since the 3 min programme carried on looping until I checked out hours later. The pedestrian entrance to this hotel from Darling Harbour is bizarre. If you try to enter at street level you're in for a treat in riding a filthy car park lift and left wondering what level do you get out on. The entrance lobby for foot traffic is very average and the reception area is cramped; in fact I wondered if the queue I was standing in was even for the reception. The in-room Internet costs $27 for 24 hours but comes with only a miserly 100MB of allowance. The two hour option for $9 allows only 10MB of data. The business centre is tiny and offers no privacy from others using it. The are countless good hotels nearby. I suggest you choose one of these alternatives. This hotel simply isn't good enough when compared to the alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Susan Franks”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My only fault was that we could not check into our room till 4pm and had to sit and wait, couldn't go far as we had wet weather and being partly disabled, but overall was not a bad stay, just wish we were a bit higher up than the 3rd floor and not in a room by the lifts as was a bit noisy when other guests were either waiting or getting out of the lifts

Reviews.Title: “trip to sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service we received during our stay at the Novotel on Darling Harbour was excellent. The rooms however were a little disappointing. They were small, as were the "queen size beds" not what we read when we booked online. The Novotel also doesn't provide bath robes. Instead of the buffet breakfast I would recommend one of the restaurants on the harbour. The best part of our stay at the Novotel was the location, walk out of the hotel and you have an extensive selection of excellent restaurants, shopping and entertainment as well as the monorail just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: GisellaMelbourne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before going on a cruise the day of check out. Check in was fuss free, dinner was quite good even though the portions could have been a little more generous, and when we retired to sleep the beds were a dream to sleep on. Where do I get those beds? So comfortable. After the cruise the porter (Sordif) even held our luggage (for 3 families) in storage for the day because our flights were delayed, this is because we are Accor Advantage Plus members. He even suggested lunch at Criniti's for great pizza and even gave us a drink voucher for the place. Very impressed with the restaurant too. The porter also organised transfers back to the airport too. Can't complain just wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: vWe always love staying at the Novotel Darling Harbour with numerous bars and reataurants nearby and the city shops in close proximity. Having the light rail nearby is handy as well. A room with a view is magical and staying with you is always a great break. We were thrilled with the special deal we received this time.

Reviews.Title: “Electric Wheelchair User Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location with Darling Harbour at your finger tips and all the accessible transport the same. Great access to most things but no accessible Hop on Hop off bus to get to see the sights but the ferries, monorail and light rail are are great. A hundred meter wheel for cheaper hotel food at the Ibis but dont stay there. Eat out on the harbour is beautiful. Maps of accessible toilets most all unisex/companion. The accessible room at the hotel is okay if you have assistance but roll in shower/bathroom small. No expensive taxi rides required and a relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience for a young family”
Reviews.Author: Vmum
Reviews.Content: As a relatively new 'family' traveller, we stayed here for a night while some work was being done on our home in Sydney. We have a young baby so travelling as a family of 3 is a new experience for us. Our stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour - while brief - was a great success thanks to the friendly, professional staff who helped us make our stay a great one. I'd recommend this hotel to fellow family travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Love the Novotel, always a pleasure to stay. Beautiful outlook. Easy to get to - we travelled by Light Rail from Lillyfield. Darling Harbour is such an easy stroll, always plenty to do. The rooms are always perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and Friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: locosfc
Reviews.Content: My lovely wife and I had the great pleasure of staying at this establishment over the Easter long weekend. The staff and management made us feel welcomed and attended to all our requests with the outmost professionalism. I would definetely recommend anyone that plans on staying in Sydney to give this great hotel a go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to experience everything that Sydney has to offer. The buffet breakfast is a must and the rooms are suitable for the family. Parking at the hotel was extremely expensive $40 a night which was the only disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the service at the hotel. We arrived at 3pm and the room was not ready and waited for at least an hour for it to be cleaned. It would have been nice to be offered a voucher for the bar to get a coffee while we waited, but no, nothing. I had requested a cot for the room a week prior (and reminded the staff on arrival) , as I have a 2 month old baby. The cot was not in the room when we finally got our key, not great when you have a very tired baby. It took guest services another hour for the cot to arrive. The room was clean and the location was ideal for our visit, but the service could have been a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “2 days stay in sydney, darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have greatly enjoyed our stay. One little defect is the first day ( we stayed 2 days) in particular there is definitely a smell of cigarette smoking by previlus occupant. Are there smoking allowed room? Should we specified non- smoking in next booking?

Reviews.Title: “Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay. The room wasn't ready when we got there, but they did give us a free drink. The parking was a bit expensive. I booked a second room on the second night and that wasn't ready at 2pm either. But overall we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Position & Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Antmiles
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the staff for their warm welcome when we arrived at Novotel Darling Harbour. All staff had smiles on their face which is becoming rare these days. I was visiting for the Fitness Expo at the Convention Centre which was right at our front door. Everything was at our door step, from resturants to bars (which was very convienient with the rain pooring outside). Our room was spacious and had a great view looking at the city - perfect for lying in and looking at on a rainy night. Becuase of the rain the first night we didn't venture far so headed down to the hotel bar. Again the staff were inviting and friendly which created a great atmosphere. Thanks again and we will be back again. Anthony

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Novotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for any business. The rooms were clean, the service was good and most of the staffs were polite and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for any of my friends who need to visit Sydney for short period.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: MPBert
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for the past 4 years from family holidays to business conferences and I can still to this day not fault a single thing on anything! The rooms are spotless, staff are friendly and always willing to help! Great location also! I always recommend this hotel to my friends when they are heading to Sydney on holidays!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I felt the hotel was good value as I used my husband's Accor Advantage Plus Member for a Night. It was the perfect location to attend a concert at the Entertainment Centre. However, I did feel the charge for parking was quite expensive considering it was a Novotel car park and I'm assuming owned by Novotel. Where is the incentive for country people to drive to larger cities for leisure?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of a very active and busy tourist and convention area. Lots of choices in restaurants and activities. Most restaurants on the harbor are grossly overpriced, recommend avoiding restaurants in the mall and those across the way. Attractions like the aquarium are also incredibly overpriced. Try the museums and Botanic Gardens for inexpensive but worthwhile activities.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised that I haven't encountered this Sydney gem before!”
Reviews.Author: RustyTrawler22
Reviews.Content: Generally when I travel to Sydney for work, my firm books me a room at hotels such as the Westin or Sheraton on the Park. For my latest trip, I was disappointed to learn that neither hotel had any rooms available for my proposed trip. When our travel agent suggested that I stay at the Novotel at Darling Harbour, I was a little unsure as I hadn't stayed anywhere that wasn't a five minute walk to my office before. Notwithstanding that, I went with our travel agent's recommendation and booked into the Novotel at Darling Harbour. I have to say that I was delighted with this decision from the moment that I arrived. Every staff member that I met was extremely courteous and genuinely appeared to want me to enjoy my stay at the hotel. I was particularly impressed that one of the managers at the hotel came over to welcome me when they overheard that this was my first stay at the hotel - you just don't receive that level of service at many hotels around the world. Once I reached my room, I was thrilled to see the most spectacular view of the Sydney skyline. You can see the entire length of the city in a view that compares favourably with any of the harbour view hotels in Sydney. The room itself was extremely large with all of the modern facilities that you would expect in a five star hotel. The bathroom was well equipped with everything that I needed for my stay. Given that I arrived quite late in the evening, I decided to order room service. I was very happy with the selection of menu items available at 10pm and I was stunned to see that the hotel wasn't going to charge me an exorbitantly high delivery fee for room service. Having the hotel charge $8 to deliver room service to my room is a pet hate of mine - just tell me where the kitchen is and I'll come and collect it myself! When I am paying $34 for a Sheraton or Westin hamburger, I don't expect the hotel to take an extra cut on top of that! In the morning, I was considering catching a taxi to my office, but given that it was a nice morning I decided to walk. I have to say that the stroll over the Darling Harbour bridge to the centre of the City was one of the nicest starts to a working day that I can remember. Just be careful of the bike riders flying over that bridge!!! In summary, I will definitely be staying at the hotel again, regardless of whether the Sheraton or Westin have availability. I'll also be encouraging by colleagues and friends to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and service again and again”
Reviews.Author: pbandmg
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour and the srevice was exemplary. We had some last minute changes which entailed us having to change room types, knowing that the hotel was at 100% capacity should have posed a problem, not this time or ever. Room was changed and our baby's cot delivered to the new room in 10 minutes. I would unreservedly recommend this hotel to any travelling to Sydney, especially those travelling with small children. The ease of transport to the city and the abundance food and shopping facilities down stairs from the hotel makes for a trouble free and relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous spot! Fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: Busdriver380
Reviews.Content: Wow what a wonderful experience was Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour! Great location. Great facilities. Awesome food & such excellent staff. Top to bottom, from GM (who takes the time to sincerely chat with guests all the time) to floor staff - they're all terrific. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: Moneypenny012
Reviews.Content: My first time to this hotel and it was excellent. The personnnel were very good, professional very efficient. Rooms were lovely and big and the views fantastic, possibly the best in Sydney to see the whole city skyline. Breakfast was fresh, flavoursome and plentiful thoughthe buffet needs some updating. A nice walk to the city over the footbridge. I will be back and have asked my company to place this hotel on top of my list of hotels to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff, great service and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: bus_leis_whatever
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for a conference and have been here many times over a period exceeding 15 years. I have to say that this big, busy hotel is being run exceptionally well and probably the best it has ever been run. Having stayed here many times over the years and as a former hotelier myself, notice it is obvious that the team are better trained and skilled than ever before. It was refreshing to see a mix of faces in the team, some more mature, some young, varied cultural backgrounds. The diversity serves them well, as a customer you do not feel like the staff are selected by any one standard, but a mix of criteria which clearly includes a friendly professional approach to service. I received a personalised welcome from the General Manager, which as a lovely touch for a return client. Rooms are spacious especially for an international class hotel. Bathroom amenities have been improved since I last stayed as well. You actually want to use the amenities, rather than push them aside and use your own! Nice to see a hotel focusing more on the customer experience than worrying about their cost per room. My company had a conference at the site for five days and we were all impressed with the range of food offered throughout the week. Nothing repetivive, plus a good range of healthy options available at all times. Staff were very professional, helpful and efficient. Internet connection was great, wireless and wired thoughout the hotel, so you can sign on from anywhere with the same account. Internet is never very cheap in Australian hotels but at least this was reliable and fast! This hotel sets the benchmark that others aspire to and I would recommend it highly. The location of the Novotel is great, a short walk to the many offerings of Darling Harbour, King St Wharf and of course the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “NOVOTEL Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All staff were very helpful especially young lady "Sam" at reception. Our room was spacious and clean. Only negative comment is television picture "stretched" wider than viewing area and therefore "lost" some information. Breakfast very good and restaurant staff attentive. We loved being at the Harbour and found the rail and ferry transport very convenient. We felt the hotel gave very good value and we would certainly stay there again and recommend to our friends. Thank you to all staff at Novotel Darling Harbour for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: suejm
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights in this hotal and found it very well placed to the ferry to get to circular quay and handily situated for the restaurents and shops at Darling Harbour. Nice sizes rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay there, loved the location - being so close to both the star city casino and darling harbour shops. Only thing I didn't like, was the shower - It seemed as though I was getting water from a straw. But besides that a fantastic stay, friendly staff, nice atmosphere, delicious food. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Rudest staff I have ever encounted with a General Manager that leads by example”
Reviews.Author: JohnTelmer
