Reviews.Content: I am sad to say that despite the great Novotels I have stayed in across Australia, the one at Darling Harbour if the worst by far. The staff are so rude and disinterested in the needs of guests which may be ok for leisure travellers but for business ifs a disgrace. Afetr a series of mistakes and lack of service I spoke to Lorraine who was the worst of them all and now understand why the staff couldn't care less. Extremely unprofessional and an attitude that the customer is lower than her. I won't ever go back to a Novotel again if this is how senior managers run these hotels. Please note the housekeeping team were very friendly and did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was great, service was great, room and view very good, corridoor noise very bad. suggest door seals. Breakfast was a little over cooked, porched eggs both morning even when requested to be soft came hard and dry. Would stay in the hotel on my next visit, not sure about breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel ... very comfortable room !”
Reviews.Author: jadeblade49
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last October for 2 nights. The great feedback was of course the location. It's right on Darling Harbor. I got the superior room facing the harbor ... what a wonderful view ... you can enjoy a great sunrise from your bedroom window too. The room is spacious. The bed is one of the best !! With those egyptian cotton bed sheets, and goose down pillows, it surely made my sleep even more comfortable. I also love those black and white photos hanging on the lobby's and room's wall. What a beautiful art you got there ! Definitely would be my first hotel option when I go back to Sydney again ! It was just GREAT !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights while attending a conference, and couldn't fault the location. It's within easy walking distance to the Convention Centre, heaps of bars & restaurants, a food court and mini supermarket. The rooms are a decent size, modern and clean, and the beds are comfy. I was a little disappointed with the service as I found it quite average - the housekeepers and one young porter with a European accent seemed to be the only ones who smiled. Having said that, I would stay here again as overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend retreat”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had trouble with our first room as the whole wall was vibrating. Rm 801. Relocated to another which had no second bed. Rm 519. Relocated to Rm 702, had the space and beds but was in an old state. Linen is looking past it's use by date. We do have a good time there but once you get above the restaurant and bar the hotel is starting to look like it needs a renovation to brighten it up.

Reviews.Title: “wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I do think that this hotel is very good but my only regret is the pool but I think is is my only complaint. We have stayed many times and we enjoyed the breakfast with eight of our friends who were staying at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “10 OUT OF 10”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Canâ€™t have a stop-over in Sydney without at least one night in Darling harbour. Great Hotel and service. Very happy to stay again (hopefully for more than one night). Looking forward to our next visit to Sydney city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my 19 year old daugher, Mother/daughter bonding trip. Loved the location of the hotel - room had a fantastic view over looking Darling Harbour. We had booked an Executive Room, fairly expensive but worth it for the view and extra room. Would definitely stay here again - only disappointing thing was the buffet breakfast at $30 per head the quality was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Compared to The Ibis next door you rate 10 and they rate 3. My only complaint was that I booked well in advance and still did not get a harbour view. Othe business people I know booked similar accomodation with you and got a lot cheaper rate and they booked a lot later than me. It appears you are penalised if you book early. Still a great Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay but credit card fiasco”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay was lovely but when I got home, I found that the hotel has charged us for the stay amount then charged my credit card (used for booking) an extra $385 AND my husband's credit card (used for paying) for $385! outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sellee
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Room was clean and well presented with excellent views of darling harbour. hotel had excellent facilities

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived everything went well. The staff were friendly and helpful. The view was spectacular, as was the location. The room was clean and very comfortable. Parking was convenient and cheap. I plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but lacking a few amenities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and our room on the 10th floor had wonderful views over Darling Harbour and the city. What was lacking for me, as a female traveller, was a decent hairdryer (the one's on the wall just aren't up to scratch) and a shower cap. Also, when are hotels finally going to click that showers over baths are a negative. The baths are never deep enough to have a proper bath and it's inconvenient to clamber in and out of them to have a shower. I had my 80 y.o. mother with me and she couldn't shower for the three days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....Elegent.”
Reviews.Author: ghoshanjan
Reviews.Content: The reception mot being at the entry level, it was bit difficult lugging up with luggage. The check in was smooth and very friendly. Got a great room with a harbor view which was fantastic. The room like most of the Novotel hotels was clean efficient and functional. The bathroom though was good, did not have the basic amenities except soap and shampoo. This is something which I expect to be more like Asia in all hotels. The breakfast choices was good but absolutely the same menu for all the four days. I believe they can become a bit more creative with this. The happy hours were nice to have.

Reviews.Title: “a weekend in Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. A bit limited with room choice to fit within budget as we were a party of three including a teen ager. Fantastic location in heart of Darling Harbour and close to CBD. Would have loved to be able to afford a larger room or an apartment to give our teen more space and us more privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice. Priced ok for Sydney. Too many add on costs”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: When I stay at a hotel I don't expect to pay $40 per night for DIY parking. Check in staff made a mistake during check and apparently it was my fault. (checked me into someone else's room). Check in staff blamed me for not correcting them. then advised they couldn't reverse the debit on my Amex for 48 hours. Room was ok, but there were long black hairs on the floor in the bathroom, I have short gray hairs.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel before and will come back. However, in this particular room, the beds were quite hard and creaked if you moved. Sounded like they were tired (like me) and needed replacement.

Reviews.Title: “On site Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good stay and close to all conveniences. Darling Harbour attractions within a 10 minute walk. Take a light rail to the Sydney Fish Market and return to Central for a walk along George Street. First stop would be Market City Mall and nearby Chinatown. Then onwards through the numerous malls along George Street and Pitt Street. Go up the Sydney Tower on Market Street for a panoramic view of the city. Head towards Circular Quay and the Rocks where you can get a classic view of the Opera House and the infamous Sydney Harbour bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Accor Advantage stuffed up but it was all good in the end”
Reviews.Author: Stewey52 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a member of the Accor Advantage + program. I had made an on-line booking through their website for my wife and I to spend the weekend in Sydney . We had tickets to see "Dr Zhivago" at the Lyrique Theatre, Star City so the Novotel Darling Harbour was the logical choice for accommodation. Much to our dismay, when my wife and I arrived at Novotel reception, there was no record of our booking having been made! There was a reservation in the name of someone with the same surname but different first name. After a lot of inconvenience waiting for checks to be made then having to use the business centre telephone (someone in India I think), we were able to get a confirmation number from the Advantage + call centre which then facilitated our booking being established. The young fellow we dealt with at reception (Kevin his name was) was very helpful and gave us free parking "Shh" he said - this would have cost us $40 x 2 = $80) as well as giving us a free upgrade to a harbour view suite at no cost. While the original reservation was made under a "no change" policy, he very kindly gave us the parking and upgrade as compensdation for the inconvenience we had been put through. Our room was huge with a beautiful comfortable bed and which overlooked the whole of Darling harbour being on the 6th floor. During our stay, all of the staff we came into contact with from cleaning staff through to reception, bar staff etc were all very courteous and helpful. In addition, for the purpose of our two night stay, the hotel was convenient to Star City and a beaut French restaurant just along from the hotel, "The Little Snail", where we dined - excellent food and service so we highly recommend it. Bookings can be made on-line there as well - just Google "The Little Snail". Access to all the Sydney CBD shops is very handy via the monorail which is at the front door of the Novotel. The monorail is a bit pricey for a single fare ($4.90) so the best bet is to buy a mutiple fare pass if you intend doing more than a couple of trips on it. At peak times it can be a case of "standing room only" so be prepared. All things considered, and based on our experiences, we would definitely go back to the Novotel Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: hcorn
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with a modern minimalist feel. Rooms are a god size and harrbour facing views are nice. It would be hard to find a more convenient hotel in terms of proximity to the Sydney Convention Centre.\\ A few small gripes ... the ventilation along the corridors and in the rooms could be improved. At times the hallways have a distinctly musty smell, covered with some form of air-freshener. This no doubt is due to Sydney's high humidity ... but detracts slightly. Concierge staff varied in their enthusiasm and desire to help guests ... one in particular was monosyllabic and minimally helpful when my wife requested assistance. As with many Australian hotels, internet charges are ludicrous ... and well behind European and US counterparts in this respect. I would stay here again, but I might also investigate other options.

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There is an extreme waste of water in the shower whilst waiting for the hot water to arrive. It can take nearly 5 minutes. Restaurant service poor - steak bought out well before vegetables and fries. Had to send steak back for re-heating.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was good.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just a few things about the room was there was long black hair in the bathroom and the room smelt of smoke. But otherwise my stay was good. The concierge staff were fantastic. Loved the buffet breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “Businiess trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rooms and sleep excellent. food did not eat here because the reseraunt not open for lunch. location great. the only problem we had was that we cou;d not empty thsink in the bath room as we were only staying one day this was not a major problem. The fast check our was vey good. The car parking seemed a little expensive at $40.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: bulldogsfight
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights, harbouside room , nice views, large comfortable room and bathroom, the only VERY small compalint was the desk staff did not seem to know too much about Sydney, they were new arrivals, eg whereris Novotael in Manly? cost of cab?Nice comfortable foyer, fast elevatoers, top position, momorail and light rail outside door

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Darling Harbour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelvitton
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at nearly every hotel in sydney and darling harbour certainly is the best to stay at. Got a cheap summer deal at Novatel and last time we stayed not to pleasant but they have certainly got better over the past couple of years. We had breakfast included and it was amazing. Everything you could possibly ask for and staff helped and cleared plates immediately. We had darling harbour view suite and it was huge. really pays to have the bigger rooms so you can lounge after all your shopping at harbourside. Only downside was they had a sign at the pool saying it was down for maintenance in the afternoon, but it was down for our whole 3 days there not just one afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Costly extras...”
Reviews.Author: 3rdimension
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to pay A$27 for 24 hours broadband limited to 100MB (after which you can either pay more or have the bandwidth throttled) and a whopping A$40 for 24 hours parking. Other than that it is functional, comfortable, convenient and the staff all seemed friendly and very helpful. For some reason my aircon seemed to switch itself off every day. It is a fun location with plenty of restaurants down on the water-front within easy walking distance, also some shops, a maritime museum and it is not far to harbour cruises etc. Breakfast is a bit average - starts the day but nothing exciting. People have to juggle lids to get at the hot food which I heard various people comment on. Like many things it really comes down to the alternatives and I would rather stay here than the Holiday Inn nearby which I tried but will not return to.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Harbour View room was Spectacular! We ate Dinner and breakfast at the hotel and both were delicious! We went to the entertainment centre for a show and coming back to the hotel was so easy. The night time view was lovely and in the morning watching the boats go out was great. Really like the 11am checkout as it gives enough time to sleep in and leisurely have breakfast . We caught the monorail into the city after which was easy to do from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted with the wait time for Dinner 1.5 hrs. Do not order entres!!!”
Reviews.Author: juzcheeky
Reviews.Content: After a long day of Business you are really tired and all you want to do is sleep in your room after dinner. We planned for an early night so we decided to eat first thinking will get that out of the way but no... We waited for our food 1.5hrs.... First 1/2hr entre arrived. 1/2 hour later no main dish....Asked the staff "where's our food" the answer we got "because you ordered Entre your food is pushed Back" :# "15 mins" waited for 1/2 hr and food arrives mind you these are quick cuisines. Due to a long wait we just joke around that they are chasing the chicken, the cow, and prawns.... hahhaa I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, rooms clean, quiet, great staff , good views

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value. Non harbour view rooms have average outlook. Dining has good range and great views.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: on wednesdays, the hotel holds an informal meet & greet in the restaurant.It was a pleasure to attend & then dine in.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Returning to the Novotel Darling Harbour after many years we enjoyed an excellent stay there. The staff were courteous, helpful, friendly and did everything possible to assist us. The restaurant has great food combined with excellent service. We truly enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. However I found the beds were too soft for me, and was a little tricky with two young kids. I was also alarmed at being charged extra for our rooms at check out, over and above our prepaid internet booking! I have sent an email with a copy of our online booking an payment receipt, but have not heard back from anyone. Disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful weekend away staying at the Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour. The location was fantastic and we loved the nearby restaurants at Harbourtown and Cockles Wharf. The staff and service we experienced at the hotel was excellent. Our room was beautifully appointed with everything we needed to make this a very special weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “How I found the room!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I feel the rooms are a little tired and certainly the cleanliness especially the dusting needs to be improved! Also the shower where mildew collects in the grout needs attention. However the location, the size, and the air conditioner was quiet made our stay great. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Novotel on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the directions on the website to the hotel confusing. Tip: Make sure you do your homework as there are two Novotels in Darling Harbour. Tip: Check your mini bar bill as we got a bill slipped under our door during our first nights sleep for a mini bar item which was not ours. The fruit at the breakfast buffet was not of good quality. Tip: There is so much food to eat. Get there early.

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY JAN”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and so this time when booking through the Accor website I requested a room with a good view of the Harbour and on checking in also pointed this out to receptionist who said yes this had been noted - unfortunately what she didn't explain was that our view was of the very end of the Harbour looking at the Imax theartre so be careful Harbour view doesn't mean full Harbour view . We stayed for 3 nights on the first night we noticed a sewerage smell in our room after our showers then again following the next morning showers we allerted reception and didn't smell it again . On day 3 we returned to the hotel at 4.30 the room was cleaned but there were no towels in the bathroom so we rang for a full set -on delivery we were only given bath towels so he had to go back and get the rest. The day before check-out we asked the Concierge to ring and book our return Airport bus he said there is no need to book just come down when you are ready to go and catch the next bus , now call me a worry wort but that night on returning to the hotel I double checked with another concierge and he said no sir you must book as some times are busy and the bus may be full -- ?? The hallway to our room was dirty for 3 days (the same dirt ) including chipped paint of walls before they cleaned it on the 4th day , this is not a Budget Hotel but it's standards seem to be slipping I have been staying here for many years but I think it's time to look for somewhere that values your business and has some pride also I feel that being a member of Accor can sometimes be a downside when staying at their hotels because they often give you the worst rooms because you are getting a discount on your room rate instead of valuing your loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Double Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: jcartSydney Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and they sent a bottle of wine to our room to celebrate which was a nice touch, only not so good comment is one of the beds was droopy and sagged a bit but on all a lovely evening and the food was nice as well in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My 2 day stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour recently was a very nice experience. Among my better Sydney stays

Reviews.Title: “the worst ever in Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1. I had to change room 4 times because of air condition. 2. we ordered a taxi service for the next day (for business meeting) and it never showed and there was no record of our booking. We were late. 3. I find the internet charges to be too high. You pay per day and very soon after you start using you need to pay extra for traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a bit more...”
Reviews.Author: beepages
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we usually have had very good experiences staying at the Accor hotels. They are usually in a good location and this one did not dissappoint. Right smack in Darling Harbour with its shopping center right in front. You can find great restaurants, attractions, activities and nightlife just outside of the hotel. It was fantastic in that sense. Unfortunately the AC in our room did not work and it was HOT since itÂ´s the Sydney summer! We were changed to a slightly smaller room in which the AC still was not working well. It was not pleasant. This NovotelÂ´s price was also a bit pricier compared to other Novotels, maybe because everything in Australia is just a bit more expensive. The breakfast buffet was ok. You find more variety and better price at the food court in the shopping center. We had dinner twice at the hotel and it was very good. Again, there are a hundred restaurant options nearby. The service was ok, some people were nicer/more helpful than others. In all, it was an OK experience. The AC thing and what little was done to better the situation was probably the sore point of the experience. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Experiance”
Reviews.Author: MLBruton
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our children at the Novotel in Darling Harbour for Australia Day - so it was VERY busy. The staff seemed to be handling the crowds well and they were great to deal with. The location is excellent with Darling Harbour literally at your doorstep. We booked harbour front rooms and the views of the fireworks were amazing. That was the good parts of our stay. On the negative side - I found the hotel to be a bit dated and needed a good clean. Our bathroom's tiles had mould and it looked like it needed to be scrubbed. The hallways and common areas looked really tiered and unkempt. There were lots of food scraps littering our hallway. Also, it was a very hot day and the A/C in our room did not seem to be able to cope with the heat. My kids were very disappointed with the size of the hotel's pool - it is smaller than most backyard pools! It was a hot day the kids wanted to go for a swim - but it was almost impossible with the number of people trying to use it and the size of the pool. I found this really unacceptable for a hotel of this size. For the money I will look else ware next year. .

Reviews.Title: “Will do it again soon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The view was just great.Breakfast is every thing you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great room facing down the harbour. Lots of room and contemporary bathroom and furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were freindly premises were nice. First room we had airconditioning was't working, and it took the staff over an hour and a half to change rooms for us, with us having to follow up to get it done ( was a very hot night and the didn't end up getting us into a room until 11am). I think that was probably due to understaffing. Then I left my phone charger at the hotel, rang them next day they had collected and offered to mail to me (though that was nice of them) until I got a slip in the mail to collect from the local post office, with COD notice ie I had to pay the postage. Would have been nice if they mentioned they were going to bill me.... Breakfast was good too

Reviews.Title: “A Very Disappointing Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were not clean e.g dirty marks on walls and light fixtures. Towels were an issue as 4 people were staying in the room and we were only given 2 of everything originally e.g 2 face washers, 2 hand towels, etc. On the first day we requested more towels and received them promptly. The next day we only given 2 towels, 1 hand towel and 2 face washers. This continued during our entire stay!!! Everyday we had to request more towels. The room was too hot - the air conditioner was not working well. We reported it and a maintenance person arrived and told us it was working!!! He suggested we keep it on during the day when out. We would arrive back to a hot room because house keeping had removed the card and power so that the air conditioning was off. Over hearing other guests and talking to some people in the bar area, it was NOT just us complaining about the heat in the rooms and bar area. It was interesting to note that one guest noted that the air con in the Games Room was working fine!! A frequent guest to the hotel said that the rooms were not normally this hot and the air con usually worked better.This lead to very restless and sleepless nights, which does not make for a comfortable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour Stay 22 Jan to 25 Jan 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Execellent location, rooms were clean and service brilliant. I would certainly stay again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Visitor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location but is showing its age. Rooms could do with an upgrade, TV's way too small. Check in a little slow but staff all friendly. Food and drinks all OK.

Reviews.Title: “bliss”
Reviews.Author: seniors107 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: every thing was excellent room very large all top amenities in there staff very helpful will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour great location would recommend the Harbour View side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “worst bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: a great place to stay great location but the bed we had in our room was terrible! we had it replaces but thge new one was not much better my wirf sleped on the couch every nite not a very good responce when we told staff about it we stayed here for a week last year also & the bed was great. but this year was very much differant

Reviews.Title: “Great family weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is functional BUT with such great staff and such a fantastic location the overall result was an excellent stay. When we arrived late with you children - we were told that the bed configuration in our room was wrong as their had been a mix up BUT we were attended to very quickly and upgraded to a suite - again not luxurious by any means but it meant separate sleeping area for my husband and I and the kids which was great. The manager personally organised the upgrade and gave us free drinks in the lobby while we waited. We did not use the restaurant here so cannot comment but the children loved the hot chocolate from the bar in the lobby. So fantastically located - we would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you for our stay. Cockle Bay so close to your hotel was fantastic with the best meals. Services of red bus through city worked really well. A very nice place to stay. Staff lovely & helpful. We will return & recommend your hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, not quite good value”
Reviews.Author: Emmar1979
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed to see a den of "poker machines" adjacent to where children were using internet terminals. The customer service was overall fair - but with a few little issues - A mini-bar charge (that was removed at my request, however without apology or justification), a queue to check-in, restaurant staff keenly removing plates that were still in use. Unfortunately, I found the room significantly noisy. Children running up and down the corridor, the noise of the shower in use from adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: greenbeachMoruya Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of its location. We were very pleased with everything from the service to the location. we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the Novetel to be first class accomodation and thought where it was situated in a great area to enable us to get to many plaves without a fuss. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novatel on Darling Harbour, with my mum and son, loved the location and surrounding establishments, great new year getaway. Very friendly staff nothing was any trouble, very clean and nice breakfast also.... mum loved it....

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My sister and I make an Annual Girls Weekend away to Sydney in January and like to stay in Darling Harbour. Imagine our surprise whilst surfing the net, we find a deal for your fabulous Hotel having 50% off rates! The location is unbelievable, only metres from an undercover walkway to Harbourside Shopping Centre one way, and the Monorail and Lightrail stations the other - Perfect!! The Check In desk and Concierge staff were friendly, knowledgeable and approachable. The room was great, very comfortable and spacious - we really appreciated the 2 double beds! Bathroom certainly big enough, the shower huge! The housekeeping were discreet and never seen - great work! The Balcony area off Reception was clean and quiet, great for an afternoon wind down after a day of retail therapy and sight seeing. Beautiful! Overall, my sister and I really enjoyed our stay with you, and would (and have) recommend you to friends and family going to Sydney, especially if you continue to have such great deals!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We also choose to stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour when in Sydney, staff are always very friendly, rooms spotless clean. We never have had to complain at any time about anything. In walking distance of the Casino. Having an Accor card also makes it cheaper for you. Food in dining room was excellent. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “I expected a better reception service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had booked to stay there using my free night to attend a Wedding at L'Aqua at Darling Harbour (Cockle Bay side). I stay at Accor hotels a lot with business and I am an Accor Advantage Member. This is one time I had requested an early check-in as my wife wanted to iron her saree (indian formal wrap dress) and I mentioned this during my room upgrade call to Accor Central reservations ( by 1.00 pm) I reached there only to finf out that there was no room ready and so we dropped our bags at Concierge and went off to China Town only to find someone else's bag in our room and our bags missing - long and short - we lost time trying to make it to the wedding on time. A bit disappointing which I mentioned to the Manager on duty as I rarely request an early check-in - surely with my regularity record they could have given this request some preferential treatment.

Reviews.Title: “poor service from reservations department”
Reviews.Author: angela_fjrman
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel over the internet. They charged aus dollars 871 when it should have been aus dollars 835. They then charged us aus dollars 278 for no reason whatsoever. Tried many phone calls and e mails but no success getting our money back. They had no authority to take the money so why they did so i do not know. Reception desk not very helpful and reservation department even worse.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in an Executive Harbour View Room with my wife and two kids (aged 5 and 7). Two double beds in one room, but also a day bed and heaps of space so wasn't cramped - not that we were in the room much. Great location - less than five minute walk to Monorail, Darling Harbour etc, and ten minute walk to be right in the CBD. Pool is small but adequate for small kids. Good buffet breakfast. My only complaint would be the daily cleaning. On two occasions we had been out all day came back late afternoon and the room hadn't been cleaned. The trick is to tell them when you're leaving and they'll clean it.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay. Nice room with great view. Staff friendly. Only disappointment was no mention of pool etc in room so didn't realise until our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist in my own city”
Reviews.Author: mrwombat Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed for 2 nights as a reward for working over Christmas and for our wedding anniversary. We used it as an excuse to see parts of our own city that normally wouldn't be possible. The room was very spacious & clean & excellent views across Darling Harbour with champagne & strawberries to welcome us. The doorman quickly arranged a taxi as the heavens opened just as we were walking to our dinner engagement. The second day we spent on the ferry to Manly - a terrific way the see the Harbour in all its glory for the price of a ferry ticket! Manly and the beach are such a relaxed area, lunch at the pub and people-watching. Two recommendations for dinner - Sugarroom and Blue Eye Dragon (Taiwanese), both Pyrmont end within walking distance (if ti's not raining!). Overall, A very enjoyable short break just a hop, skip & jump from the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location,vews and within minutes of city centre by monorail,darling harbour on the doorstep,big,clean well appointed rooms,buffee breakfast a must,and dont miss the happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great for location close to all tourist attractions.excellent service.housekeeping very shabby not much attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location wise perfect to do all things in and around the city. Breakfast buffet was ok, glad that we were Accor members so that we only paid for one adult (there was 2 adults and two children) otherwise wouldn't have been worth it for us. Ate elsewhere for other meals. Room service menu very expensive and not that exciting. Pool area could do with some maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Jambakim Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, good price. Nice restaurant. Pool was a Godsend on a hot day. comfortable, clean and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: KTJ_Alice
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible experience. We went there to enjoy the New Year's celebration and the hotel made our whole experience to be a big let down and a big waste of money. We knew we had to pay more $ because of the timeframe, but the hotel not only raped us for the money, but gave us a dated room, horrible room location and very poor service. We paid over $700 per night for 2 nights and receive a crappy room, limited bathroom supplies (cheap soap and shampoo ... nothing else) and the staff moved us and kept requesting that we go to the service desk and provide hard-copy proof of our reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Accor Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very convenient point of stay for city life style and week end get aways

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: graylor
Reviews.Content: Great location which we didn't mind paying for as the view was terrific especially as the xmas tree on darling harbour was lit up and there were great fire works but the room was tired and certainly not worth over $300 which we paid. We wanted to splurge and treat ourselves. The bathroom was a disappointment, shower over the tub and very poor hot water pressure. Not even a complimentary biscuit let alone a robe. Check in was painfully slow with customers all lined up like waiting at the airport. Have stayed in much cheaper rooms of better quality admittedly not with the view but why give such a great outlook then let us down with a basic room? Sorry we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kezziebill Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our harbour side room with its large window to capture the view was just beautiful. We were staying here for our 35th wedding anniversary and on returning to our room after checking in were delighted to find a bottle of champagne on ice waiting for us. A big thank you to the lovely Michelle on reception. The hotel is in a great location with a walkway connecting to the Darling Harbour shops, tram and monorail right at the door as well. Enjoyed a lovely dinner at the restaurant. The only thing I could pick fault with is that the pillows need upgrading. Very flat but other than that I highly recommend this Hotel and look forward to staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, wonderful room and good service.”
Reviews.Author: Duyfken
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the service provided was excellent. Our luggage was brought up to our rooms and booking in was effortless. The room was outstanding. We had the superior room that overlooked Darling Harbour. It was very spacious, and had all the conveniences from internet, desk, flat screen tv, excellent bathroom and a great bed where we both had a wonderful night's sleep. Service inside the motel was excellent. We couldn't fault it. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “New Year at Novotel Darling Harbour (Pyrmont)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay at this hotel. Ideally situated for all the entertainments/attractions around Darling Harbour and a short walk into the main shopping/ tourist areas. Was disappointed that room was not ready at check-in time (14h00) and had to wait over an hour. Reception desk and concierge seemed understaffed for size of hotel and number of guests and wait times were very long. On occasion we simply gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Free Night at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, however service is only very average

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All-round!”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyWollongong
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed in the city and decided to try the Novotel for a change. We were very satisfied with the room, the service and the views. We definately won't stay anywhere else now! The location is a convenient walk to great restaurants and also to shops in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Our first Christmas without the kids”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time as we wanted time to us now our children have grown & moved living O/S it was just right for us. very good location and very friendly staff. we could not have asked for more. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: SAILOR85_11
Reviews.Content: Room was OK. Deputy Manager was incompetent. Embarrased me by declaring my credit cards not acceptable. Caused me the expense of contacting my UK bank to check they were in order. He still said they did not work with their system and required cash. When my wife and I used the dining room I paid with my credit card with no difficulty. I then went back to the reception and asked the deputy manager why I could pay for meals using the card. It transpired he did not know how credit cards operated!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: jazzaNsw
Reviews.Content: Great location & views of Darling Harbour (Exec harbour view rooms). Basic clean rooms. Non-existent service. Poor and arrogant attitude of check-in staff. For the same money, better service, plush rooms and breakfast included at places like Shangri-La or better space at Medina Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great hotel close to transport and major attractions. Also close to Harbourside shops and attractions. Excellent hotel for children although hotel restaurant menu limited so we ended up eating from the bar menu which was good value and tasty. especially the pumpkin chips. The staff were great with children.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Lights at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel for the last few years at Christmas Time. We come into the city and stay and go around the city to look at the lights at night, plus visit Santa. This hotel is great as we can get the monorail, plus the Darling Harbour Tree is right in front of us. Staff always excellent (especially with kids) restaurant is kid friendly but most of all they love the Apple computers in the foyer! We had a great time and got a lunchtime checkout for free! We will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: maid cleaned room even though we said we were doing computer work, ice bucket took 50 minutes to arrive on check out had to pay extra for $30 upgrade was not told this when i booked room and prepaid 1st night free 2nd night $297.30 would love to know what my saving was considering I have been an advantage plus member for 9 years what happened to cheaper rooms am thinking of not renewing my membership should have booked through wotif

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean and tidy. A very pleasant stay..

Reviews.Title: “:)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot. Especially the showers. It was so nice with all the shower gel and shampoo and stuff. Although, there weren't enough towels... but anyway I loved it. However, with the beds, the pillows were a bit too thin, and the matress was very hard. maybe you could get that sleep number thing for the matresses?? I loved the view. although it was a shame that we couldn't go on the balcony. anyway, it was all good. my fam and i really liked it and if we were ever in Sydney again, we'd stay there :)

Reviews.Title: “Fairley satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the bed needs looking at with the view of replacing it or at least a new mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Bon Jovi Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyed our stay again at Novotel Darling harbour. It is central to many sights and easy to get to when driving into Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the middle of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First rate and good value. Will stay again. Room excellent and service was good and prompt. Darling Harbour is a very good spot and I had a room overlooking it. Nothing negative to report.

Reviews.Title: “Bon jovi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A stay in the hotel for a visit to Sydney for Bon jovi concert with my wife. i was happy with the hotel, the view from our room was superb and the service and the quality of the breakfast. However, on arrival I was advised of the car parking arrangements and the subsequent fee. this was an unpleasant surprise as when you pay around $350 for a room, $1.30/litre for fuel plus tolls, I would think a a courtesy car park for guests would be standard. Anyway I paid the fee but i would be reluctant to use the hotel again. Also, I was disappointed that I received no discounts on the accommodation costs for being an accor Advantage plus member. thanks for the opportunity to provide feedback, have a merry christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Better options available”
Reviews.Author: JohnLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: The staff is nice, the rooms can be filthy and rundown. I spend as little time as possible there as I find it rather depressing. It is right next to Darling Harbour but it is incredibly touristy and I wouldn't recommend it. I stay there 2-3 per month and the level of cleanliness keeps deteriorating. I honestly can't say anything good about it except for the staff, with whom I have minimal contact. There are many better places to stay in SYD so don't waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ode1online Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a Darling Harbour view room, Great view, Great location . THe MONO rail is attached to the car park. Takes you to PITT ST MALL. Or for the bargain hunter take it to Haymarket PADDYS MARKET. Nice rooms. However if there was a complaint its the room I had does not have a Walk in shower which I prefer. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “mrs mcdonald”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: all staff was very friendly and helpfull and the service from the cafe was fantastic very welcoming and friendly had a great experience there at the novotel thank you

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay, but below par considering the price for a Premium room”
Reviews.Author: R0bertstewart Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is about the 6th time I have stayed at this hotel. Why? Because it is convienient. Service is average and the rooms are starting to look tired. Considering I usually pay for a "privelege room", so I at least get a view, the roos are not good value. Plus side is that they have easy parking underneath the hotel. Very AVERAGE.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: At around 9:00am I was having a shower with the bathroom door open when I heard a knock on the door followed by someone (i assume a cleaner as I noticed a trolley outside my room on leaving) opening the door. He apologied but it concerned me that the room would be entered by a cleaner prior to check out time? ( I advised reception on checking out)

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleased as usual with the room, however the reception person who checked us in advised that breakfast finished at 10.30am. We arrived at 9.50am to have breakfast only to be told that we only had 10 minutes as breakfast finished at 10am. We had promised the kids breakfast so we ate, however was very disappointed and definitely DID not get our value for money out of the breakfast. Very unprofessional that the person at reception didn't even know what time breakfast finished.

Reviews.Title: “Works Xmas Party”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good ,as always, the only complaint was the ceiling tile had been left out of the bathroom ,probably after maintenance dept had done some work on plumbing for the room above. I rang front desk and advised them,they offered another room ,but as we were going out, i asked if someone could put the tile back , it never got done.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel on a tourist harbour. Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JimboMel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights for $289/night. At that price was expecting a fairly nice room and a decent stay. The staff were indifferent, the room smelled of fruity fruitum covering a past smoker's stay, the bed mattress was sunken, and the bathroom was mouldy. On a positive note, the little gym was nice, and certainly the view of Darling Harbour and the Sydney skyline was good. The breakfast was average with fake scrambled eggs and an extraordinary cost. The location of the hotel is convenient to the tourist traps along Darling Harbour but a bit inconvenient to downtown Sydney and the Quay. They failed to provide a receipt of my stay, spammed my mobile with repeated calls, and now as I try to obtain that receipt I keep calling to ask for an email copy to be told it's been sent, with nothing in either of the two accounts I nominated, spam folders included. I much preferred the Hilton, the Westin and even Mantra on the north end of the bay to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Staff were very attentive and helpful and the location is superb. We were a little disappointed that there were no glasses provided in the bathroom, other than that we enjoyed our stay and must say that the food in the Restaurant was first class. If you a looking for a Hotel with Class and Location, the Novatel Darling Harbour is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour Novotel (Murray St)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I liked the fact that I could quickly go into the city and back on the monorail as well as get to the Convention Centre for my conference. As there was little free time during the conference this was so handy. It was good having the Harbourside Shopping nearby for shopping for things needed unexpectedly as well as a wide variety of restaurants nearby for lunch. The views were fantastic too and the bed very comfortable. The staff were caring and helpful at all times. Having access to the newspaper at breakfast was super. I appreciated being upgraded to a small apprtment aswell at the suggestion of hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable mattress”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The position was excellent, walking distance to the heart of darling harbour. The rooms are comfortable, clean and well appointed but the bed had the most uncomfortable mattress we have ever slept in. Very Very soft and so we were falling to the middle. Otherwise everything was very good including the service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our trip was for business & leisure. We upgraded to the Darling Harbour view room - it was beautiful - very roomy - surprised us. All amenities were clean and to our expectations. All staff were friendly and helpful. Special mention to Evelyn in the Restaurant - she made us feel very welcome. She tried her best to make sure we were looked after. We were very impressed with her and hope she goes along way with Accor Hotels. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on the Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very good and it is situated in a good location at the Darling Harbour, convenient to the city, China Town and entertainment centre.

Reviews.Title: “novotel which i known best”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i've been 3 years being the accor advantage plus member and hv tried to accommodate with all of the hotels joined in the group .. to my opinion, it 's more worthy to live in novotels rather than the 'sister or brother' hotels, even just for one night .. i'll ever recommend this hotel either to my families, relatives or friends

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Convenient City Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quality service and attention by all staff members. Very convenient access to city areas via Monorail or by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darlinh Hartbour Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Received complimentary upgrade to a junior suite as a gift for past patronage of Grand Mercure Apartments at Darling Harbour and offer included complimentary bottle of champagne which we didn't receive. However reception staff offered parking voucher on check-out to compensate. Ideal location but could offer more competitive pricing to attract regular patronage

Reviews.Title: “Convenient with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kakiteano
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while teaching on a course. Pros: Comfortable room and I slept well. Breakfast in the restaurant was pleasant in the mroning sun, with the windows looking out over Darling Harbour and the city. I ate dinner in the restaurant Dish twice and food was good and staff helpful when had to have a pre-theatre dinner but was running late. Close to Darling Harbour shops and restaurants, Imax, Powerhouse, & Aquarium Cons: Swimming pool and gym small - had to wait for a cycle machine - would suggest going at off-peak times. View from my room was apartments/roads but didn't spend much time in room

Reviews.Title: “Birthday joy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked into the hotel as part of my birthday celebrations: we sang our way through Jersey Boys, then enjoyed cocktails in the bar at the Novotel before enjoying a heavenly sleep (recovery, really!) in our room! We commenced the birthday with a great buffet breakfast, before checking out and wondering the city for the day. Staff, in keeping with our past Novotel experiences were friendly and receptive to our needs. We'll be back and will encourage others to visit you! Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nicely located in Darling Harbour. Really close to the harbour, everything is just within a walking distance. Monorail, Train, Ferry, etc. Too bad we just got a room facing the back streets, but its still ok. Staff at thte reception was there to assist, bellman was helpful to assist in getting the bags etc. Maps available in the reception which was helpful going around. Staff showed a few options how we can go to our destination. Helpful. Value is a bit pricey but I got it free from Accor Membership, which is nice to be a member of. Good discounts. Room was spacey, we got 2 queen size bed and there was still space to unpack luggage. Toilet just have this odd door stopper that i tripped a few times to just be careful walking in that.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable stay in a friendly environment. The upgrade to a harbour view room on the 10th. floor was worth it for the pleasure gained from the wonderful view. All of the staff were friendly & efficient.We particularly appreciated being able to use the business centre to optain our boarding passes on Tiger Airways without an exorbitant charge. The meal in the restaurant was excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Marsbar66 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and have been happy with the location (close to convention centre & transport). We have noticed over the last few visits that the breakfast is not what it used to be and that the decor is becoming very tired. The rooms are clean. I had to ask for a shower cap both times recently. For the cost of the rooms the little extras you would expect are sadly missing. The rooms also had a stale smell to them.

Reviews.Title: “novotel darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: a great location, clean rooms and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “not happy with the room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: room not clean finger prints all over the mirror could not see yourself window looking over the harbour was just as dirty dont like the idea of having to put a card in to put the lights on and i found them very dim not bright enough the water pressure was very slow i was not very impressed at all i stay at darling harbour quite a bit and i must say that would have to be the worse hotel i have stayed at i was so disappointed as i have wanted to stay at the novatel for a long time and could not get in and when i finally did i was very let down i must admit i would not recomend it to anybody and i am not usually a winsher as long as i have got a bed and a shower i am happy but i must say i was not happy with your room

Reviews.Title: “Bad Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast wasnt hot and very expensive for a luke warm breakfast. Apart from breakfast my general stay was comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I feel the cost per night is too expensive for Accor members

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms (executive queen Darling Harbour View) at the Novotel Darling Harbour were huge and well laid out. The bars and restaurant were good and the location was perfect for access to the Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad beds!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible beds, fluffy towels, free wifi in lobby for 30 mins, half door in bath that gets floor all wet! Door man was not helpful, not sure he spoke English! $.90 for local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for first-time visitors”
Reviews.Author: Marko76
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Darling Harbour hotel has an enviable location, right on Darling Harbour and opposite Cockle Bay Wharf (with itâ€™s many excellent restaurantâ€™s and barâ€™s) and the Sydney centre. The room was functional and nicely furnished, and I think it may have recently been refurbished. Whilst my room wasnâ€™t overlooking Darling Harbour, it wasnâ€™t an issue for me since I wasnâ€™t in the hotel long enough to sit and enjoy the view. However if you choose this hotel, then ask / book a room with a view over the water. If you have breakfast included, then the buffet serves an excellent range of food and the views are fantastic, and certainly make for a pleasurable start to the day. The hotel has Apple iMac computers in the lobby with free internet, which is great if you want to check for information on Sydney. Although they are extremely popular, particularly with young children, so you may have to wait. Overall, the hotel was very good, the staff were fine (although, one reception member was rather grumpy) and I would stay again. If itâ€™s your first visit to Sydney, it would make a great base in which to explore this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectaion”
Reviews.Author: Divyamanu
Reviews.Content: Right now i am my hotel room and writing this review, Novotel is located at nice location, Room is good, not very clean carpet is showing black marks may be not cleaned since very long. Hotel has both wired internet and WIFI, wired internet cable is too short not even coming to corner of Study Table, u can connect to WIFI but cannot open a single web-page like goggle, I am facing horrible room service, hotel has swimming pool but no temperature control in that, hotel has tennis court but hotel staff never provide u tennis rackets, i have complimentary breakfast included in my room rate, breakfast is very low standard you can feel egg shell in your omelet, bread-slice they serve i guess 3-4 days old. For me its a worst nightmare to stay here but as my company has tie-up with such a low standard hotel what i can do, not worth for money, not recommend i have been to Novotel in Bangkok its was awesome even Accor properties are very good but i hope accor will review this and i recommend accor to end tie-up with such a stupid hotel, one more interesting thing if u ask for a bill they will tel come to reception and collect they will give the bill without the envelope.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: qtem
Reviews.Content: Great location as it's very close to China town, also it's right next to darling harbor which makes it easy to get around. The hotel itself is not anything special. They have two apple computers in the lobby for free internet, however half of the time the connection does not work and sometimes you have to wait a long time to use it(during my entire week stay there, only one computer worked the entire time, the other one was just sitting there with a blank screen).

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: QueenslandKazza Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights in an executive room. It was very comfortable & spacious. Nice & clean. My sister & her husband were in a standard room and apart from being a bit smaller was just as comfortable. The four of us were able to have room service dinner in our room on one night and it was very nice. We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant twice and it was quite good value with an Accor Card. We didnt have a car and found it very handy and we were able to walk to everything that we needed. Would definitely stay again. We hired a car on our last day from the Europcar desk in the lobby and that was the only really sour note of our stay. We had organised the car the day before so we could get away early only to get down there and be told by a very inefficient and unhelpful young lady that she had given our car to someone else! Not happy with the service and will never use them again. Not the hotels fault though.

Reviews.Title: “Motel experience at 4 1/2 star price”
Reviews.Author: babystep
Reviews.Content: Our 7 nights stay at Novetel Sydney on Darling Harbour had not only been mediocre, it had to be one of the worst accommodations that we have stayed in. After the first night stay, we realised why the reception staff was surprised when we checked in for 7 nights stay. We were in Sydney to celebrate our anniversary and my husband wanted a room with the view of the harbour, so we thought this hotel would be a good choice. Little did we know how poor a choice that turned out to be! We barely got any good night sleep for our stay here. Apart from extremely uncomfortable bedding, we were woken up every morning at about 5 or 6am in the morning when our neighbour showered, or when the cleaners cleaned the room next door at 7am. The walls had no sound proofing at all. We were quite lucky in that we were staying at Level 9 and were assigned a room right at the end of a wing so we had less corridor traffic. Nonetheless, we could still hear conversations and noises from the corridor or next door as clearly as they were inside our room. There was absolutely no feel of luxury that it claimed in its advertisements. Our room, which was supposedly Superior Darling Harbour View Room, provided very uncomfortable spring coil queen sized bed and extremely flimsy feather pillow. I have no expectation of high class bedding, but one that had hard metal coils poking straight up my body to undo months of chiropractic therapy is certainly not classed â€œSuperiorâ€�. There was some notice hanging from the shower head encouraging people to use the timer to save water. That would have been a great idea had the timer actually worked. The feeling I got from that and the basic furnishings was that the hotel was just being stingy rather than actually wanting to play a part in saving the environment. Apart from that, the room came with very minimal amenities of 2 cakes of soap, shampoo and bath gel. I had to personally go to the reception to get a shower cap. Come prepared with your own lotion and conditioner and anything else that you may need. On cleanliness aspect, we were not overly pleased with it. Our used tea cups were not washed and there were moulds growing on the outside of the bath tub. I suppose the cleaners were playing their part in not wasting water in proper cleaning. We pre-paid a bottle of red on arrival from Real Escapes holiday agent. That, of course never arrived. Having waited a couple of days with no signs of it ever arriving, my husband enquired it at the reception. The staff said that was not communicated to them by the agent and would send the bottle up to our room. As it was already about 10pm, my husband said to just deliver it to the room the next day. That bottle of course, never arrived the next day. But upon inquiry, the hotel reception claimed that a bottle of champagne had been delivered to our room around 4pm, when we were obviously out of the room. That bottle of champagne was no where to be found in the room and to make the matter worse, the hotel reception accused us of trying to take advantage of their complimentary wine. For a start, we had paid for a bottle of wine. My husband had mistakenly thought that it would have been romantic to have it in our room upon arrival. Another problem is the poor communication within the staff. In the booking slip that we have shown to the first reception staff, it clearly said â€œBottle of Bancroft Estate Wine on arrivalâ€�. How that had changed to a bottle of champagne is beyond me. Also, why a bottle of chilled champagne is delivered to an empty room and later disappeared still remained a mystery to me. I would have thought that it was basic common sense to ring up the room before delivering the champagne or marking it as undelivered when no one answered the door. When the room service guy finally delivered our wine, it was of course a bottle of white, not red. And of course, the room service fellow insisted the champagne was delivered earlier despite not being able to explain how there was no trace of it ever being there. Things certainly got even more interesting as the same reception staff who accused my husband of extorting complimentary wine phoned back later to tell us the wine that we have pre-paid for was meant to be delivered after we returned from our trip, and that the bottle given to us was a complimentary bottle. Well, it has been 2 months and we still have not received the elusive bottle of Bancroft Estate Wine. Had we known that that was going to happen, we would have saved our money and bought our favourite bottle from our local bottle shop at a fraction of the price with no hassles after we returned from the trip. I have honestly never heard of hotels sending wines that were meant to be presented upon arrival after the people have left. I am not sure how these people who could not even understand and carry out basic orders could run a hotel business. If you expect a first class hotel experience, go elsewhere! This hotel is definitely lacking in every single way. With poor customer service, uncomfortable bedding, questionable cleanliness and provision of very basic amenities, I would recommend getting pampered elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms, nice views”
Reviews.Author: claui
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while my partner was attending a conference. It was all paid for by work except breakfast, but when we found out it was $31 pp (!!!) we decided to go out for breakfast. Also there is no free internet. We had a seperate bedroom and lounge room which were both very spacious and comfortable. Both had a flat screen tv and individual heating/cooling although we could not really get the lounge room to warm up. Also the bathroom with bath was clean and modern. The bed was very nice and the room was quiet and dark. Not much attention or effort went in to styling this place, it does not have much atmosphere or personal feel about it, but we did have a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE & CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: marydistantharbor
Reviews.Content: My brief stay at the hotel over a busy weekend went well ~ clean room, clean bathroom, and frienldy service albeit efficient vs gracious. The environmentally friendly & healthful features in the room ,ie shower timer, limited amenities, nutriotions & local food offerings are welcomed ~ the thoughtful addition of a cup for the steam iron is unexpected and quirky. Food is pricey with many local options available outside the building within walking distance ( Cherry Beans - coffee w/view of harbor ). Signage to Convention Center can be confusing. Easy walk to the Monorail and Darlign Harbor atttractions.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: LarW3
Reviews.Content: The location is good and charge you with internet . The mate didn't clean good enough specially the bath room .You only get shampoo and conditioner ,2 bars of soap ,no shower caps , no lotion or Q-tip . We paid $ 300 a night . Not recommend at all .

Reviews.Title: “nice view but pretty dirty”
Reviews.Author: lemonbabie
Reviews.Content: nice view on Darling habour, close to the city. Unfortunetly the breakfast area was always dirty, the pool was actually very small and dirty, too. The room was ok and spacy, but not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: cappie09
Reviews.Content: One thing I think big chain hotels should adopt is greeting everyone in a friendly manner and by their name, it's staring at them in front of a computer screen. If they can't do that then they should look for employment in a different industry. So the guy wasn't that friendly, I know, get over it and I did. However, I think the Novotel is trying to aim their business at families (and this was the school holidays) but then the whole hotel was booked out by conference/ business people. Our room was nice, big and clean and had a constricted view of city. Not worth paying for but we had to as nothing else available. Went to Dish restaurant and service and food were excellent but when I went to use my Advantage Plus card, I'd ordered one adult main and 2 kids meals my only discount was one kids meal, a huge $9. I do kind of think that the Accor restaurants are now inflating their prices because the majority of people use these cards. Breakfast was good, but my husband loves a freshly cooked omelette and the poor chef looked like he was the only one there cooking and the wait wasn't worth it. Hot food wasn't being replenished quick enough, either. Look, the Novotel is certainly not a bad hotel and I would recommend it if you really had to stay at Darling Harbour but by the time you add on your breakfast, carparking ($35) and possibly upgrades because standard rooms are booked out with convention execs, I think there are a lot nicer boutique hotels to choose where you're not just another annoying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JackieAus
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived at night with my husband and 2 children after a 4 hour flight, before we went to the room the receptionist wanted me to fill a form to join the Accor club right there.... when all I wanted was a nice shower and relax.... When I got there..... I was given a smoking room and not with a view that I had paid for. The towel rack was unscrewed and loose, the room had a horrible smoking smell, I asked for another room and explained I had booked directly with the hotel to avoid any misunderstandings, as I have children and this was a dream holiday.... we were later given another room but had to wait 2 hours for them to clean, bath robes were asked but never given until one day the housekeeping lady said the hotel was too full and that's why I never got bath robes, even towels I had to remind to be replaced, many little things that when added up against the 300 per day rate (room only) it was simply not worth. Carpet at the breakfast restaurant is beyond the joke, dirty, very very old.... I think they got all they could out of that carpet. It really needs to be replaced, there are literally HOLES on it, why should a customer have to remind the hotel about such things? The hotel had this night feel about it, so you could see men entering the elevator while drinking beer which I don't find appropriate to mix with children. They also have this " gaming room" which attracts gamblers of course. I like casinos, but this is not what I was looking for..... I was looking for a Family stay. In other words, it may be good but not for someone who wants a family holiday with children to enjoy the Aquarium , Zoo, wildlife World etc.. The girls at breakfast were friendly and helpful, but for 31 dollars we could be eating a 5 star breakfast. The bedroom felt like there was not enough oxygen, not enough air circulating, the smell of a place where the window can never open to let fresh air in.... not for me Perhaps if I had booked through a website (hotels.com or wotif.com or another one of that type) I may have got a much better rate, and the room I actually wanted which was a harbour view, facing the Aquarium etc. Concierge insisted we'd book the airport taxi with him to avoid paying extra... (I know they get their commission which is fine if they provide the service right) I emphasised that I wanted a NON SMOKING taxi... bingo! We got this van that had again a horrible smell of tobacco , even worse, the driver tried to cover up with lots of some perfume spray I must say, though, there was a young man named RORY (he might be a porter or room service worker) who was always, always smiling and happy to help bringing bags, getting the luggage, opening the door, always polite. Again, the hotel is ok, staff is friendly especially the girls at the restaurant.... but the place is way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: tammyb613
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but some of the services were lacking. The concierge scheduled our airport shuttle for 5pm when I asked for 5am and said several times in the conversation that I needed to leave "in the morning." We ended up having to pay extra (we had prepaid for the shuttle) for a cab because the shuttle didn't show up. We also had the staff in the bar totally forget about us. We ordered 2 beers and they said they had to change out the kegs then they would bring it out to us. Well...20 minutes later we asked about it and she said "oh yeah" but still didn't come back with beer or an explanation as to why it was taking so long. Shortly after that we left, but ended up coming passing through the bar and the staff saw us and gave us two beers for free, which was appreciated, but it was 40 minutes after we initially ordered and they weren't busy either. Lastly, a few minutes after we arrived to our room a staff member knocked on the door and seconds later, before we were able to get to the door. let himself in. A little concerning that we had someone just walk right into our room. Besides that, the hotel was nice, with clean bathrooms, and when I requested extra blankets and pillows I was accomodated without question.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but expect to pay high dollar”
Reviews.Author: DanR73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and was adjacent to the Sydney Convention Center. It is also a short walk to to the Harbourside Shopping Area. Rooms and property were very clean and well kept. When we first got in the room we could not turn on any lights but realized we had to put the room key in the light switch. Rooms are spacious and nice sized closets. Charge for internet but they had four computers in the lobby that guests could use for free. We never ate in the restaurant as they are plenty of other restaurants in the area and the Novotel seemed high on their meals. The rooms were also rather expensive and this is probably the most I have ever paid for a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: roys5
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for the HSU conference with over 400 delegates attending. The hotel managed this very well. One issue to raise was the buffet breakfast perhaps a better way to serve such large numbers instead of a single line make the hot food available in several areas as in other hotels.To be fair this would only happen when hotel had many bookings.Overall a good hotel for large groups and excellent location on darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of the normal good novotel...”
Reviews.Author: Drallewellyn2
Reviews.Content: Lots of the normal good novotel inclusions but it's right in a tourist trap heartland and the broadband is a complete rip off $27.50 for 100mb! Water regulation also an issue

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, Modern & Simple rooms”
Reviews.Author: Samoa_Wedding
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay in an Executive Darling Harbour View Room, to take our kids to the aquarium and other Darling Harbour attractions. The location of the hotel is great. The room was spacious and simple, with a nice view over the Darling Harbour precinct. The room was OK - nothing flashy, but clean and more modern than I had expected. The restaurant was nice, with great views over Darling Harbour and a little kids play area that our kids enjoyed (it would have been fantastic if it had directly interconnected with the restaurant). The reception area was always busy and we had to queue for check-in, check-out and any queries we had.... a bit annoying, but I suppose they must have been busier than normal...
