It is not as luxurious as some of the other hotel options in the CBD, but it is a great location to enjoy events, conferences or attractions around Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: CedarCreekQld
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend staying at the Novotel. We stayed in an executive room with harbourview. The hotel's location is good - we walked to the aquarium, Chinese gardens and took the monorail to the city and Powerhouse museum. Positives - location (amazing view of Sydney and we were lucky enough to have a hotel view of fireworks) Restaurant buffet breakfast good variety and quality and children ate free with parents Room was quiet Negatives - We were initially put in a smoking room and had to be moved (family of four with young children so a bit inappropriate) Restaurant dinner was very expensive and food and service not very good Rooms very basic and lacking in character. Bed was truly awful - very hard and squeaky, pillows flat and uncomfortable and my poor husband's feet poked out of end of the bed! (He is 182cm)

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: hunbun81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sydney for 4 nights on our Honeymoon, the Novotel on Darling Harbour was perfect for location. The hotel didn't recognise the honeymoon offer we had selected with our travel provider so no surprises for room type, or in the room, only real downside after that was we backed on to the lift shaft so had the constant drown of the lifts, but i was too jet lagged to care! The hotel i'd describe as a business hotel, the rooms were average and the communal areas appeared rather dark and dated with their brown walls! However this was just a base for us so we didn't worry too much. Breakfast at the hotel was pretty much the same as most hotels, only fault in this area was the breakfast layout meant everyone was gathered in one area for their cold breakfasts (seperate hot servery) and annoying toasters that gave you nothing but warm bread! Visit Paddy's Market for a fun experiance, take in a meal at Steersons for the best steak ever, and if you can afford it then a meal at Centrepoint is a must! Particularly at sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with possibility of great views but a let down in some areas”
Reviews.Author: TashAdelaide
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this Hotel several times the last time being the 22nd April 2010 just the one night. We had booked a Luxury Harbour View Room. The young lady that checked us in at reception was far from welcoming and certainly was not friendly. I noted whilst waiting that she just did not smile at anyone. Perhaps she was just having a bad day however it is my opinion that these front desk reception employees play a very important part as they are your first impression of a hotel and can affect how you judge it. They are usually the first point of contact. Checked in we went off to our room on the fifth floor, the room contained a smaller than expected window which provided a somewhat restricted view of the end of Darling Harbour, the bed looked not much larger than a double bed size and did not look at all inviting, and later proved to be quited uncomfortable. Not what one would expect from a luxury room. The bathroom accessories were limited to conditioning shampoo and soap which I thought was rather poor provision for a luxury room. I was told when checking out that if you require anything extra that you have to ask for it. One would think then that this be the case that there would be a notice in the bathroom to advise you of these facts. The bathroom could have been cleaner as could have the room which had dirty marks on the carpet and dirty finger marks over the entrance doors and other doors. As I am particular about cleanliness I cleaned the areas not up to my expected standard with my hand wipes. There was also a glass that had what looked like the remains of lipstick on the rim. My overall impression was that the room and bathroom had only had a very quick clean. We had lunch, dinner and breakfast at the hotel and have no complaints about the staff or the food service in this area.. We have supported this chain of hotels throughout our travels overseas and in Australia and have a Platinum A-club an indication of our support. Yesterday through the post we received an invoice with an added charge stating it was for undeclared mini bar usage for beer and mixed spirits neither of which my husband or I drink. This had obviously been charged to our visa card. You can imagine how annoyed we were when we at no time accessed the mini bar. One would think that a telephone call just to check whether you perhaps did use the mini bar and forgot would have made for good public relations. I have telephoned the hotel and I must admit the person that took my call was extremely nice and most apologetic however he advised me to put my complaints in writing and address them to the Hotel Management. This I have done and I am now awaiting their reply. I see by reading Trip Advisor that I am not the only one to be billed for mini bar that they did not use. I wish I had research this hotel on Trip Advisor prior to our visit and I would have been better prepared or booked somewhere else. This hotel charges in the higher price range, a price range that one would make one expect a much better quality than it presents., generally for us this hotel was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Penny wise, Pound foolish”
Reviews.Author: Kretek1
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney for a short honeymoon getaway and for work training in April. The hotel is in a superb location, located in a quieter section of Sydney overlooking Darling Harbour and next to a shopping mall. We got harbour views on 7th floor and the views through windows were amazing. Check-in was very quick and staff from the concierge to reception, were friendly. The hotel exudes a modern and upmarket feel. But don't be fooled. For the price you pay, you are only paying for the view and location, and that's it. For the money you pay, I get the feeling that hotel management is rather stingy in providing the little extras. They do not provide complimentary toothpaste, toothbrush, comb, shaving cream, shower cap, sanitary bag for the ladies, not even complimentary bottled water. The hotel sells toothpaste at a pricey $4. With liquid and gel restrictions when travelling by air and carrying handbag only, the hotel by not providing complimentary toothpaste, toothbrush and shaving cream was rather annoying. The only complimentary things were liquid shampoo, mini soap bars and shower gel that were stocked in the bathroom. Some things are complimentary on request, like disposable slippers, but we only found out after reading the small print in the hotel guest booklet. I think management is hoping that guests won't read this in the name of saving costs. Don't expect these little extras like you find in similar priced hotels, especially in Asia. It seems like the wallet in this place is full of moths. I seem to agree with other reviewers here: the bed was rather uncomfortable. The mattress was well past its use by date as there was hardly any cushioning support left. You were literally sleeping on spring coils. The mattress was uneven and on my side, was sloping downwards. We booked a harbour view room which was great but beware the windows are rather dirty. It seems the hotel is on a very tight budget and only clean windows once in a blue moon. The newspapers were not delivered to our room, but other rooms had them. Perhaps they differentiate guests depending on the rate they pay. This hotel mainly targets corporate travellers. It offers convenient express check-out by encouraging guests to place rooms keys in an envelope and dropping it inside a box at reception area. If you like a corporate type hotel with less personalised service, this is the place to be. The hotel does not cater for honeymooners as it is reluctant to even place a couple of chocolates in the room upon arrival. Don't get me wrong, There is a positive point with this hotel: the staff are professional and friendly. The concierge on the base floor does acknowledge and greet you. When we requested a pair of slippers late at night, Paul, a reception staff, delivered them within 5 minutes and with a smile. In summary: Plus points - location, quiet, Darling Harbour views, efficient and friendly staff, express check-out. Negative points - feels like a low frills hotel, just above Ibis Hotel. They only provide soap, liquid shower gel and shampoo in the bathroom. There are no cups provided in the bathroom to place a toothbrush and toothpaste in. Not even bottled water is provided. The mattress has run out of lives and seriously needs replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedPuffin
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in April in an upgraded room, I think it was a deluxe. We had a room on the 3rd floor the first night - it was big, comfortable bed and a good bathroom. The view was ok, but not spectacular and that's what we wanted. We asked and were moved for the next 2 nights, to the 9th floor, with a great view, really wonderful. A big room, very nice in all ways. Our room was next to the elevator, but we did not hear it. Internet was not free, but ok for the price - $10 for 2 hours. The hotel is being renovated, it's not that the hotel is in bad shape, but it is a bit tired, and the furnishings look out of date. Breakfast was good, big range, it was school holidays and there was lots of families and lots of kids, but there was lots of tables as well. We got a seat straight away each morning. We had one dinner in the hotel - nice but pricey. The pool is not heated. It was too cold for me early in the morning, this was April, but I was told it was ok later in the day. There's lots to do around the hotel, and there's a good shopping mall next to it. To get to the hotel, we took the train from the airport, then the tram to Darling Harbour - total $36 each. We took the shuttle bus back, slightly cheaper, and it took about the same time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, had a great getaway”
Reviews.Author: lizsrs
Reviews.Content: okay the hotels location is its selling point.... of course it looks like they are starting to do a revamp in the reception area. so maybe the apperance of the hotel will get a face lift.... yes the hotel is clean, tidy comfortable, was treated well by staff. it ticked all my boxes. l enjoyed the location and the room was good didnt have a problem with the bed we did have a romantic weekend. had great views of the harbour, at night it looked great.... bathroom was big enough for the two of us. clean.... enjoyed my time there.. yes it is a little overprice for the standard room but would only stay in that location in darling harbour.... if you dont want to spend as much for a room then stay at the hotel ibis in darling harbour they are in the same location with same views but cheaper... however l will keep coming back to the novotel..... ENJOYED THE HOTEL AND LOVED THE LOCATION..... CLOSE TO EVERTHINGGGGGG.......

Reviews.Title: “Don't put yourself through it”
Reviews.Author: Shaen
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome - right in the Harbour. Unfortunately that is where the positives ended for us. The room was average - not bad, just not at all what we expected of a four star hotel and definately not what we expected of the Novotel. For the $ I think we could have done better. The service was what really made the whole experience unpleasant and downright painful. The dirty dishes left in the halls for days and the housekeeper busting into our room unannounced were annoying and dissapointing but the real issues started after we left. We were charged three times for the total of our stay leaving us to deal with the embarrasment of declined transactions when attempting to make other purchases on the Easter long weekend interstate. Then we were charged for the minibar purchases of the people that stayed in the room the following night! After making numerous phone calls to the hotel to explain the situation and attempt to rectify it we were met with unhelpful and downright rude employees who did not even try to sound interested. After a week and many empty promises of a call back we finally got on to a staff member who despite being told by a superior to pass our enquiry on understood our frustration and sorted the matter out. It really shouldn't have been that hard. We will NEVER stay at this hotel nor any Novotel again I am afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views but in need of some love”
Reviews.Author: johnjan6410
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel was that it's overpriced for what you get, Yes you are right in Darling Harbour but the hotel is looking a little tired and is due for a facelift, the hallways have scuffed walls and in general look drab. Our Harbour view room was roomy and the view fantastic (see pic) but you pay a good price for the view. The bathroom though nice and roomy had more than just a little bit of mould around the tiles but otherwise was fine. The mattress on the bed was way too soft, like we are not big people and I still sunk way down in it...so the chance of some hanky panky was limited because I couldn't get out of my dent fast enough by the time I realised there was a green light! Staff were polite and helpful at all times. In all not so bad but we have stayed at some three star hotels which equal this easily I would stay again at the Novotel Darling Harbour but mainly only for it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Average & Expensive”
Reviews.Author: suzytony
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night only on our last night in Sydney before flying home. The hotel has a good location overlooking Darling Harbour and as a base it is well positioned. Everything else about this hotel is average, except the price you pay to stay here. It has no personality and the reception staff treat you as a number. When we checked in we were not even told about breakfast times etc so we headed down to the harbourside and had a full breakfast (freshly cooked) for $12.50. Had we been more organised with our travel itinery we would have booked to stay in one of the B&B's in Sydney that have a great reputation for service and accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overrated, overpriced, and tired”
Reviews.Author: tgsh2007
Reviews.Content: I was booked into what was described as an Executive Darling Harbour View Room. The Accor website describes these rooms as having all the features and facilities of the Superior Darling Harbour View Room but with "added products and services". The "Executive Room" provided no added products and facilities of any description. When senior management were challenged about this the assistant general manager could not describe what the "added products and facilities" should be. This was because he'd "only been on the job for 2 days". The duty manager could not describe what they should be either! Overall the hotel passed off a superior room as being "Executive" and gave absolutely nothing by way of enhancements; not even a complimentary bottle of water. The Accor website is misleading and the fact this hotel passes off 'normal' rooms as being 'executive' (and charging a significant premium) is, in my view, highly dubious and downright dishonest. Turning to the room quality itself; the rooms are described as 'modern'. Again, this hotel has a strange idea of what is modern. These rooms have not been refurbished since the early to mid 1990's in my view. The rooms have very dated decor, poor facilities, poor ventilation and air conditioning and give an instant 'tired' look upon entering. The first room I was allocated had a bath tub with so many cracks that they had to be filled in with grey plasticine! The 2nd room was barely much better. The bathrooms are a complete disgrace and have not been properly maintained. Despite paying over AUD$ 2500 for my stay in an 'Executive' room I was still expected to then pay $35 per day parking, $31 per day breakfast (assuming one wanted it) and a disgraceful $27.50 a day for "high speed" internet, which was CAPPED at 100mb! The internet was anything but "high speed" and barely had dial up speeds at times. All these points were raised with the assistant GM; he could offer no adequate explanation. He offered to "make me happy"; this appears to have been by way of 2 'comped' breakfasts (I was there for 9 nights). So, no "extra products and services" as I was entitled to in that room class, just AUD$62 by way of 2 comped breakfasts. Ultimately this hotel was overpriced, tired, and offered very poor value for money. Management were offered a fair opportunity to rectify issues and explain why the Executive Rooms were not being provided in accordance with Accor's standards. Unfortunately management failed to respond in any sensible fashion. I suspect the 'plan' is to rely on the heavy tourist traffic and 'fleece' the guest for as much by way of incidentals as possible. The internet charges are disgraceful; the internet service is too slow and does not justify the outrageous cost. This hotel has a 4.5 stars rating. In my view 3 stars would be generous. Yes this hotel is well located, the rooms are on the larger side, but for the price I would recommend looking elsewhere, and obtaining far better value for money. I really do think that this hotel misleads guests as to the quality of rooms and services expected in each room type. Further, the management do not take guests concerns seriously and simply dismiss them with corporate "waffle". A complete and utter disgrace! Shame on you Novotel!

Reviews.Title: “novotel a little weather beatenI”
Reviews.Author: crumpetsinoz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for four nights at the novotel and have good and bad reviews to give....It is in a great location in Darling Harbour, the bus/rail/monorail at front door nearly....shopping restaurants and sightseeing all walking distance But its looking old in spots with marked carpets marked walls ETC and certainly not worth big dollars to stay here,trays in front of doors left all day etc and i found the staff less than friendly...I was on accor vaction stay and arrived at the meeting point for their sales pitch to find it non existant and 4 phone calls later told enjoy your stay its been closed there for a while...poor poor poor. since then heard nothing from them obviously not wanting my business or money.....probably would not stay there again but love the area

Reviews.Title: “Just average and nothing special”
Reviews.Author: FlipperGirl
Reviews.Content: A bunch of colleagues and I recently stayed at the Novotel on a business trip, which coincided with Australia Day. Perhaps that added to the cost of the nightly stays due to timing. Overall, it's just a basic, average & "no frills" hotel that provides most of the comfort a business traveller would need (especially if working at the Convention center) albeit at a hefty price for the quality -- in my opinion -- making it not worth the price our company was paying. So, while not too many issues arose during my week stay there, I wouldn't say it was anything special. The rooms are plenty spacious -- I had a comfy bed, wet bar area, refridgerator, hairdryer, safe, large desk area, nice bathroom that was spacious. A++ for the largest and most comfortable bath towels! I could occassionally hear my neighbor's television, but, the Australia Day celebrations were not very loud despite the crowds, speakers, etc. going on in the harbor just outside my window. The location is awesome -- very convenient to working the Convention Center, right next to wharf shopping and INCREDIBLE Syndney dining options, close to grocery (small one in shopping center next door -- larger chain store -- Coles is about two blocks away). Because of that, I never ate in the hotel. Darling Harbor has an IMAX theater, the Aquarium, access to ferries that can take you to the Circular Quay, was close to lots of other attractions and not too far to walk to city center, etc. I walked everywhere (The Rocks, the Botanical Gardens, etc.) and enjoyed that aspect of the hotel's location. It was about $40 taxi to/fro Airport (but there is a cheaper shuttle service available). NEGATIVES: Decor and everything gave a tired and "worn" around the edges feel, such as: stains in tub and shower walls, slighty smudged walls and molding, carpet not so bad (some colleagues thought their carpets very dirty), out-dated furniture styling (i.e. mid-80's feel). Television left a lot to be desired -- about 8 different FOX channels and a few local channels, CNN, that was about it. Oh, and I judge hotels by the type and # of hangers they provide in the closet. Since these were the type where the ring part is unremovable and stays on the bar (i.e. afraid that guests will steal their hangers) this place gets another ding. Only low-end chains do this anymore. Secondly, there really was no "dresser" or drawers to put things in -- the closet did provide extra shelves, though. On walking to my room the first time, the hallways were disgusting -- bits of trash and food and junk all over the place. The carpet in the hallways was old and outdated as well. Staff: I would say they could use some work on training the Clerks on check-in. First, there were two lines that formed instead of one queue so as some of us stood in the "slow" line, the queue next to us rotated through guests. Those working behind the counter clearly noticed what was going on. What modern hotel services guests this way at the front desk? It's not a grocery chain! Finally, the clerk that checked me in initially was pretty rude and unpleasant, i.e. the "slow" clerk. I forget her name -- she "checked" me in and then at the last minute said that my room wasn't ready yet, which is fine, it was around Noon and too early for checkin but at larger business hotels I stay in it generally isn't a problem. I know clerks deal with rude guests, too. I used to be a clerk as well, so I greeted her with a smile and hello and was very pleasant. She really only had about 15 words in total for me. She couldn't call me either to let me know when my room was ready having an international line, whatever, you won't see better worldwide business chains doing this. So, I was stuck dragging my suitcase back downstairs to storage and then sitting in the lobby. However, my colleague in line next to me, got his room right after I was rejected. And when he asked "Trainee" -- the VERY sweet girl working his line, she went and got my room ALSO -- 10 minutes after rude girl said I couldn't have my room and she saw me STILL SITTING IN THE LOBBY that whole time. Trainee unknowingly recharged my credit card the "Hold" charge (twice) -- so on top of Rude Clerk Girl doing it already and her two attempts, my Visa card was put on fraud hold and was ultimately denied (but then, they didn't ask or tell me that they are getting a "call credit company" code which is in my experience, 100% what the little credit machine feeds back to them in these cases). ANYWAY.... Finally, they provide 4 "free" "computers" to use the "internet" in the lobby. You log in with your name and you get 20 minutes. What a joke! I attempted to use these machines at least 7 times and each time: only one really worked for another guest, the internet would never connect, the machines would often error out (I went to front deskt a few times to get them to reboot the system and they even admitted that the network is bad and the machines always have problems)! This is so they want you to pay the OUTRAGEOUS $27.95 a DAY and that's for ONLY the FIRST 100 MB. So, if you use up your 100 mb in the first 24 hours, you have two options: super slow network w/in that same 24 hours for free or you can pay another crazy fee by hour thereafter for high speed -- that's right, you already paid $27.95 -- so it can very easily be much more than $27.95 per 24 hour period. I saw the management response to another post -- that's BS. For the price we paid per day Internet should be included especially if they expect business travellers. 100 mb is nothing anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location. Avoid expensive net access"”
Reviews.Author: canuck213
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodation and location - no complaints whatsoever. Their internet access is a joke at $27.50/day. Does anyone actually pay this? Go to Rob's Cafe just around the corner for free wi-fi and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “"Wow" location location”
Reviews.Author: petalac
Reviews.Content: If your visiting Sydney there is no better hotel to stay at than this gem, our family from outback Queensland with two boys aged 8 and 10 stayed here for 5 nights.The Staff were great, they were very friendly and helpful, especially the cleaning staff, they always talked to the boys and asked if we needed anything for our room. Our room, it was spacious, had comfy beds and heaps of room for the kids to chill out, and room service had a great menu{Yummy burgers),the view across Darling harbour to the city was fantastic. It has a large restaraunt(Great buffet breakfast) and bar downstairs with some of the best views in Sydney. And the location well where do I start, Monorail at hotel doorstep,destinations Chinatown(best food in Sydney),Paddys market, cheap as chips (copy cat watches and Jimmy Choo handbags),Pitt street, Shop till you drop. Darling Harbour is just outside your front door, it has everything,Underwater World,Imax (100 ft screen we saw Avatar in 3D),Ferry too Taronga Park Zoo via the Harbour Bridge Luna Park and the Opera House and hundreds of restaraunts cafes and shops and the Star Casino is just around the corner. If you are visiting Sydney, Novotel is a must and the prices are very reasonable for the family budget. We will definatley be returning soon. Have a great stay the Rutherford Family

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow-Mum
Reviews.Content: I had booked online into another hotel closely but it was tacky and awful, so I went and had lunch at Harbourside, and saw the Novotel so I walked over and told them my problem. They arranged for me to transfer over to their hotel, and had my luggage moved over without any extra expenses. The service was top class and I decided to stay extra nights because I really liked the room (harbourside view) and the people (the barman was very friendly). I also liked the convenience of the computers in the lobby - very slick and enabled me to stay in touch with the office. Apart from this, the porters on the lower ground floor were excellent and very helpful. and then the location is great too. Its a little expensive, but worth the money - the hotel was so good and really added to the occasion which was my sons 30th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, no complaints but no compliments either”
Reviews.Author: tarnsdubya
Reviews.Content: This place was fine to use did not have an awful stay, but it does not stand out as one of the better places I've stayed in either. Decor was pleasant, location next to the mall was handy. Was really too small to accommodate my sister and her husband in one double bed, and me in another about half a meter away (studio room). Still, over all no major issues, and fine as a hotel as we weren't staying long.

Reviews.Title: “greast service, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: seeyalatersyd
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay excellent service fantastic location! close to everything Sydney has to offer we enjoyed our stay and will defiently choose Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous end to our stay in Australia”
Reviews.Author: treksterhongkong
Reviews.Content: This was a great end to our return trip to OZ. Hotel has a great location and tremendous view of the city skyline. The staff were great , though I thought the porters were a bit casual. We have a thing for good breakfast and just loved the breakfast choices. We didn't have dinner but we did have drinks at the bar and bar snacks and the guys at the bar were chirpy and had a good laugh with you (something that is very rare these days). Food was great - we had the mezze plate a couple of cocktails while we admired the view. Loved the MAC computers in the Lobby - very schmick. The rooms were fantastic, modern and spacious. We were there for the last week on December and checked out NY day. Had a ball and felt right at home - nothing was a bother. The price for New Years was a bit pricey but compared to Honkers not that bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and untrained staffs at reception”
Reviews.Author: angelklc
Reviews.Content: If you are staying at Novotel Sydney Darling Harbour, take my advice. You will probably want to stay there for a short period of time with the Harbour view room just to ensure that you get a good view of the harbour. Otherwise the other facing can be very pathetic. During my stay, I was not properly checked into the hotel, so the next day they wanted to boot me out of the hotel because i don't have a record in their reservations; this is despite the confirmation slips confirming i have fully paid for my 6 day stay! The staff at reception then asked me to call the reservations team to confirm. The staff refused to call the reservations team and it would not be unfair to remark "what kind of 4 star hotel does that?"! They continued to fail to check me into the hotel when the reservations team confirmed i was to stay for 6 days. So on the 3rd day of my stay, they wanted to boot me out of the room and say i can't stay because i dont have a record! All this causing me to miss a day tour i already paid! If not for some well trained staff at the bell desk and concierge, i would have been lost! they managed to reschedule the tour for me and i still got to do what i needed to do. This is no 4 star hotel, trust me. when i got back and checked my credit card charge, i was charged for wine at minibar which i didn't consume! The same charge was imposed on my credit card at Novotel Rockford for consumption of wine at minibar which i did not consume. i am very particular with my wines and theirs is of poor quality, not drinkable at all. This means that the hotel has a pattern of overcharging. Its atrocious! Traveller who go to any of the Novotel hotels, please make sure you check your credit card statement and look out for overcharging. It has happened to many of those i know and trust me, I ain't recommending Accor nor renewing the membership anymore. It is a bad deal!

Reviews.Title: “A nice end to my last night in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pbandmg
Reviews.Content: Lovely spacious room, great views, my wife and i checked-in for a one night stay - our last night in Sydney - as we were here for a family celebration. The Novotel was recommended to us as we are from inter-state and we were looking for a centrally-based hotel. Taxi service to the airport the next morning was easy, breakfast buffet was nice - especially the chef cooking omelettes made to order. i would recommend this hotel and we're looking forward to staying here again in the new year when we return for another family celebration.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: versaillesPerth
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Novotel with my partner and we just loved it! I first picked this hotel for the location but quickly realised that it wasn't the only good thing about it. A very profesional receptionist welcomed us and made us feel confortable explaining us all the facilities and giving us touristic recomendations. I think the staff is the most important thing to really apreciate a stay and this one didn't let us down as they were more that helpfull. We were amazed by the room we had been given as it was spacious and immaculate. We got the chance to experience breakfast and dinner and could't imagine such a quality in a Novotel as we are used to eat in 5 star hotel. We thought that the cuisine was a very good value. I am really looking forward to going back to Sydney and staying at the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, loved staying there”
Reviews.Author: elle7777
Reviews.Content: looking forward to staying there again! the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pelican713
Reviews.Content: Our stay more than met expectations. Great room. Comfortable beds and the block out blinds are magic, Great views. Very good value for money. Stayed during December and the Christmas decorations looked great. Also so central to everything and hotel staff extremely helpful regarding transport around the city.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: lisbakke
Reviews.Content: The day I arrived here, their power was out. They told me to go out for the day and come back later to check in -- they would either have a room with power for me or book me at another hotel. I said, "How about I go look for another hotel and just get a refund here?". They said "Sure, but you won't find one, they are all booked in the area". Sure enough, that was a gigantic lie. Every hotel I called had plenty of room, and Novotel was trying to protect themselves. So, I booked another hotel and told Novotel I was cancelling. Now, a month later, after 6 phone calls to Novotel, talking to multiple managers, and all of them agreeing to give me my refund, I STILL HAVEN'T RECEIVED IT. Their customer service is absolutely terrible. I now have to dispute charges with my credit card company and go through a huge hassle, because Novotel has lied to me 7 times about my refund for a $1300 charge for a room I never stayed in. Thanks, Novotel, great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Returned because 1st stay was great”
Reviews.Author: DDAASouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this property about 3 years ago I returned because the location, service & room were fantastic. However, this was not so this time. The room allocated was disappointing. I thought I had requested a Harbour View room but was allocated one on level 2 looking over the back street. The room appeared clean however the carpet had numerous stains and looked a bit "tacky". One day we were left with no towels in the room and after 3 hours & 4 phone calls some were delivered. On check-out we were advised that there was to be a surcharge for paying with my credit card. No mention had been made on check-in that this was the case. Some of the reception staff had attitudes that left a lot to be desired. The only plus was the free access to the internet available. There were 4 screens but only 2 were connected and most of the time only 1 worked.

Reviews.Title: “over the top”
Reviews.Author: broke1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here recently, she paid with her hard earned money as a special treat for her mum. We were very disappointed with our whole stay, the Pyrmont room had such a tiny view it isn't even worth mentioning. We had to park our car in a distant car park, got very lost, and I had a long walk with injured knees. Our room was very cramped, breakfast mediocre and definetly not worth the huge charge. Would have expected a lot more in a big city, only thing going for it is location, location, location

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievabley Bad”
Reviews.Author: kass7
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a Junior Suite which I felt happy about ( No 733) however the block out blind had a large rip down the middle, large dirty stain on the carpet, the beds were as hard as sleeping on a rock, switching on the airconditioner was so tricky that someone had to come to the room so coach us through it. The bathroom has been upgraded recently except for the bath which is black and corroded by the drain. the glass shelf in the shower is fixed so that it is virtually impossible to wash top of body without continually banging your arm or elbow. The water used in flushing the toilet was so minimal that my husband had to empty the rubbish bin and pour water into the toilet to clean it and as there wasnt a toilet brush I stopped him from going into detail how he had to clean the sides. The last morning a cockroach greeted us in the handbasin, which was surprising as the room is on the 7th floor. Check in and out was so slow I felt like reaching over the counter and doing it myself, I am in the industry so I know that it should have been quick and easy as everthing was prepaid, only my card had to be processed for any extras. We were charge $25 mini bar when we did not use anything, while it was deducted off our a/c without question, the front office person said that it is not recorded what was supposed to have been used when we asked. Beakfast was very mediocre, one toaster didnt work and the other two were so slow I was beginning to believe that they didnt work either. The cappuccino machine filled the cup one morning and gave half measures the next. I filled in the comments form stating the above and received no feedback from Accor which isnt surprising as the management have to aware state of the rooms. Any three star motel would have room in better condition and be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A few problems to be sorted ...”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaChris09
Reviews.Content: Business conference booked here, but they have some electrical issues which has shut the hotel down completely on 2 occasions in the last 2 weeks. having to relocate hotels and not being allowed to recontinue staying, even after the problem got fixed was very irritating. I wouldn't recommend the room service Great location though - fabulous if you can get a harbour view. The other side isn't too exciting

Reviews.Title: “Why I will never stay Accor again”
Reviews.Author: asil2
Reviews.Content: In May we went on a weekender to Sydney, and booked the Novotel Darling Harbour, for two nights, and since we were travelling with family, two rooms. We have stayed here before and didn't have any problems. The trip and the stay itself were not the problem. The problem lies with the on-selling of the Accor Vacation Club and their extremely bad delivery (or lack of) service afterward. On a trip down to the bar we were approached by an Accor Salesman, who was offering a return trip to a number of selected hotels, for two nights for a family for $99.00. This had to be signed up, paid, and a hotel chosen on the night. In return the Novotel had our income details, marrital status, and all our contact details. We signed up to return to the Novotel Darling Harbour, since we frequently visit Sydney, paid our $99.00, received a contract, and were given 6 months to use it. Given that the 6 month period is almost up, I tried to book this accommodation. This is where the problem starts. The 1800 number on the form had an answer machine stating "this office is currently closed". After leaving it over the weekend and trying again this morning at .00am and finding the same message, I decided to contact the hotel directly, and was given the run around for 3 hours with different numbers to phone (some disconnected), some asking me to hold for approx 13 mins. Eventually I reached the number I had initially tried and was told "we are in Queensland, so our business hours are different". First problem - being a national booking office why does their answer machine not stipulate opening hours, and that they are in Queensland?? Problem 2 is that they "no longer offer this package in Sydney, as they are rennovating" (the sales office where we had to attend to receive this special "deal"). But, I was told I could go up to Queensland to take it, or take the refund. My point being; they didn't just rennovate the sales office at the drop of a hat. They had to have known in advance about this rennovation, and these packages were being sold to be taken "anytime within the 6 month timeframe". Accor was obviously quite happy to take $99 knowing full well these wouldn't be on offer in the future. Problem 3; they have all our income details, marrital status, contact details in return for something that seems to have been a bit of a hoax. Problem 4; On trying to contact Accor about this problem I was told they weren't infact rennovating, they were re-structuring. I'm sorry Accor, but what's it to be, rennovating, or re-structuring??? In any which way, you had our contact details, surely you could have contacted us to tell us that you would no longer honour the contract? And please don't bother to write your automated response of "if you would contat the hotel directly we will be happy to discuss the matter further........." as I have this morning for three hours, nobody from the hotel wishes to take responsibility or give me someone I can talk to, as Accor is a seperate entity to the Novotel Darling Harbour - If that is the case, why then were you allowing Accor to hawk their product in your bar/foyer on your premises??? I'm sure the ice-cream man would not have been allowed to sell his product without being removed - Not to mention how your employee tried to flog us off a Audi Car while we were in your bar. Come on Accor - get it together!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't ever stay in a Novotel again”
Reviews.Author: ExJen
Reviews.Content: Like one of the other reviewers, we found that the harbour view room we had booked 3 weeks earlier (a special occasion for our family visiting the city) had been given to others, and we got a small street view room. We noticed several others had the same problem at the time we checked in. Once in the room, the in-house movies did not work and service staff took 3 hours to respond to our request for help, by which time the children were asleep so there was no point. Only one lift was working so there were major queues on every floor. When leaving, we did not get the right instructions for how to exit the car park with our hotel ticket and that meant walking back to reception again. To top it all off, when I wrote an email to management to give this feedback it was never replied to. Who cares about the location when you have a terrible time there?

Reviews.Title: “Well located to Darling Harbour and wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bigandblack
Reviews.Content: Travelled here on business, rooms were wonderful, clean and the place was well located to Darling Harbour. Great restaurant, a full on great place to stay for business. Rooms were just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LucyFM
Reviews.Content: As with most people that have written reviews on this hotel I was staying here because it was part of a conference package with the conference being located at the convention centre. On this basis it was a good location (in fact generally a good location). However, it wasn't great value for money. I am sure the conference rates are not the best value and that is possible to find better rates than the one that we paid. The room we had was large with two double beds a sofa and a desk. This appeared not to be a standard room as my colleagues had much smaller rooms. The hotel were very happy to allow early check in and to provide non feather pillows and duvets when asked. The room was clean and well stocked with towels, toiletries etc. The bathroom was ok but we never managed to get the hot/cold taps sorted out for the shower. Bathroom and public areas (particuarly landings) could have seen better days. As expected internet and minibar were a rip off. The gym was small but functional and pool a little tired. Generally the staff were really nice and helpful. However, there is no business centre for normal punters. The business centre is only for airline cabin crew (which as well as conference delegates seemed to be the mainstay of the business). If you want to print you need to email down to reception which is a little odd. Breakfast was standard hotel fayre. Not sure if it was good value as was part of the package

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Handy for Conferences”
Reviews.Author: danthegirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel Darling Harbour for four days while I attended a conference at the Convention Centre. Incredibly convenient (good when you're on your own with no car) and very easy to get around. I had a Harbourside Room on the Third Floor with a lovely view of Darling Harbour and to the south of the CBD. Highly recommend Chinta Ria Restaurant on the otherside of the Harbour for a meal - very fresh and cheap and enough buzz not to make you feel self conscious when you're eating alone. The room rate was really good (around $200 including buffet breakfast) but I was disappointed with the breakfast. It is the only criticism I have of my stay and it was probably just timing, but the choices seemed to be lacking and everything seemed to run out just when I wanted it. Also the coffee left a lot to be desired - it took me a couple of mornings to work out how to use the automatic machine and the effort wasn't worth it for me, but I am a coffee snob. Pretty good value otherwise. I did get some noise from next door as my room had an interconnecting door, so best to request a room that doesn't interconnect. The bed was fabulous (I slept in twice!) and the cable channels kept me occupied in the evenings. Easy access to the internet etc. Really good facilities for travelling alone on business. I also felt very safe while staying here. Great shower and bath facilities. Stock standard prices on the mini bar. Friendly staff and a lovely bar to sit and have a nightcap while taking in the view of the Harbour before bed. I'd stay here again if I was needing the convenience of being close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour - great views”
Reviews.Author: gregnazvanov
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2006 whilst on a work conference held at the convention centre. The views are great, although the rooms are small. Had an argument with my girlfriend before, yet she dropped by and we made up as the Darling Harbour views worked magic. Novotel Sydney On Darling Harbour is located adjacent to the Sydney Convention and Exhibition Centre with a convenient direct connection to the Central Business District via Monorail. It is perfectly situated just minutes away from Sydney's most popular attractions including Sydney Aquarium, Powerhouse Museum and Star City. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Why I will be burning our Accor Card after this stay.”
Reviews.Author: kittycatAP
Reviews.Content: As we arrived in Darling Harbour early on Saturday morning at 8.30, we decided to park our rental car at the Novotel Darling Harbour, where later in the day we would be staying. We understood that check in was 2pm, so we dropped off our lugguge and decided to start our experience in Darling Harbour..e.g the Aquarium & Wildlife park and a look aroung the immediate area. On our return to the hotel at 2.45pm we were told there was a delay in getting our room (executive queen and single habour view, no rollaway bed ..their description of the room, not mine) and to please enjoy a drink at the bar on the house..Wow that's nice we thought.......2 hours later we were still waiting...we then recieved our much anticapated room key and rushed to the elevator knowing a hot shower would only be minutes away. That is when my nightmare started.. I walked into the room, which if booked for just my partner and me would normally be average, but to clearly book a room for my family that states...A unique experience combining relation and focus. The executive room treats you like a VIP: more spacious, with a day bed sofa, all facilities of a superior room as well as Darling Harbour views. Up to 2 adults and child. No rollaway. Oh my God...that was my response when I walked into the room that only had a Queen bed. Where is the other room? That was the next thing that came out of my mouth. Back down stairs we go...Consider our day so far, 4am start 6.30 flight, full day in the city, quite tired and the response I get from the guy behind the counter..and this is exactly what he said word perfect.."I didn't book your room" AAArrrrrhhhhh. No, we did and I'm sure that I didn't ask at the time of booking for a 2 hour wait and a side of your attitude. The next thing from this amazing Novotel Representive was the tried and true, "take a seat and we'll get the manager". Now, here is when we had to justify our booking and the problems to the manager. We were dumb founded that at some point during the discussion the following comments were made to us, by the manager,"the day bed is used as a single bed normally". No, it 's a day bed . Not a bed that I want my daughter to sleep in, that is not what I booked. Secondly, " we will get you a roll away"......(See the room discription...NO rollaway). and my favorite comment from the management, "we only have 2 rooms with seperate bedrooms", and the closer, from the manager, "in my time in the industry I've never worked for a hotel that offers this service are you sure your not talking about serviced apartments....."? Really, we travel at least once a month both locally in Melbourne, around Australia and Internationally, and have never had an issue like this. Now in some defence of the manager, here.... I must say the complimentary drink at the bar was nice, the knock at the door and the complementary champagne was a nice way of getting me drunk so I would sleep throught the stuck elevatar and it's alarm and the returning Bledisloe Cup rugby fans, so thanks for that. My reponse to all this is, wake up Novotel, gifts and sincere apologise, are all nice and expected, but are just a way to smooth over the fact that you screwed up. Get your service looked at, if you are excepting a big weekend, staff up. If you can't turn around your rooms in time why is it my fault? If you can't write a correct description of your rooms take some truthful photos, (oh you have, note the photo on your website of the family all in one bed....Is that your expectation?.... How funny) Novotel's website has all this advertising for families and how family friendly they are..

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, view and location”
Reviews.Author: calekids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to a cruise and shared a room with our two boys 8 & 4. What a fantastic room. Huge!!! Upgraded to the Deluxe Harbour view room and worth it. Room was clean and ready when we arrived. Had breakfast at the hotel last morning and couldn't put it on our room account due to express checkout so was charged a surcharge for using american express card which wasn't happy about. Breakfast was nice, with normal choices you would expect of this star rating hotel. Best to get harbour view room, as it was a thrill for my son to watch the monorail go past, buses, boats etc. Plus so pretty at night. Only issue we had was fire alarm went off, and we had to evacuate. Got youngest son out of bath and rushed out of room to downstairs, but nobody seemed to be assisting. Alot of confusion and front desk was still checking in people and ignored the alarms. So we all stood around outside until fire brigade said we could go back in. Was false alarm, but would hate to think what would happen in a real emergency. No one knew what was going on and no staff were evacuating. Needless to say our son had nightmares that night as was scared there was a fire! So thats the only downfall. But location is excellent, easy access to Darling Harbour, food courts, restaurants, transport. Room service was good with choices for children which is great. Spaghetti Bolognase was great - according to our boys. Would we stay there again - absolutely. Room was wonderful and location sensational. Just so long as the fire alams don't go off. total confusion. staff not helpful at all. One wet 4 year old dragged out of the bath - scared and cold. Pool not heated so didn't use it, fitness centre looked good. Great place with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views and nice base to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: skyeplus
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel the views of the harbour are amazing ask for harbour view, very handy to restaurants and shopping mall short walk into downtown Sydney, staff were very helpful and concierge organised taxis and advised on buses. You can use the monorail which actually goes through the bottom of the hotel. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: bradio
Reviews.Content: We booked this weekend away a few months ago. We had booked a non smoking king room. Upon check in/arrival at 8.30pm on Friday night after spending 2 hours driving from work with my wife we entered our room to find it was a smoking, twin bed room. The room was poorly lit, smelt like someone was smoking in it when we entered and was not what we booked. With a quick walk back to reception we were told that requests for rooms are just that and didnt not guarentee the exact room you would receive.(never experienced this in all of my travels). We were then told the hotel was fully booked and there were no other rooms available. Upon the threat of us leaving the manager gave permission for our reception clerk to give us another room.(negates the "fully booked" statement given earlier). The room was non smoking but was so close to reception/lobby(3rd floor) that we were up all night with the noise of people coming and going. Not game to inconvenience the staff and request something more suitable we sucked it up and vowed never to return to an accor based hotel. Also be careful of the overnight parking at $35.00 per night. We expect far more from our travel experiences on all levels especially from this type of establishment. We will not return. BUYER BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but be careful of your things”
Reviews.Author: WuAnSzu
Reviews.Content: We stay there for a total of 7 days , service was excellent but one thing dissapointed we loss stuffs a Headphone and Ipod nano , we told the front desk and they told me they will get back to me or call me but never heard from them , I wish big hotel like that can at least response. My thought is their housekeeping staff don't do great job sometimes they forget to clean the glass or mugs and forget to place bathroom things like one day it is face towel the next day floor mat the following day is facial tissue but if you ask for it they will give it to you

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from the Glass Window”
Reviews.Author: krutin
Reviews.Content: Sydney was the first destination of my honeymoon, and we had booked Novotel on darling harbour, on arrival we were upgraded with bottle of sparkling wine by the hotel as we were on the honymoon. We stayed on the 12th floor were we had a amazing view of the harbour, the room were good and service was also good. There was a small bridge connecting the hotel & darling harbour. Amazing... The one thing i didnt like about the hotel was the person in the information desk was not good, he was rude and thought he owns the place, but rest it was a very very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast, nice view”
Reviews.Author: bubamaras
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a conference and the hotel was quite nice... as you'd expect for $300 a night. We had an amazing view of Darling Harbour, the breakfasts were of an excellent standard and catered for all tastes...from a chef on stand by to cook your eggs to your liking to a juice machine to make your own freshly squeezed orange, carrot, celery or apple juice and the barista on duty in the mornings made one of the best coffees we've ever had in Australia. Having said that, the "free internet" didn't work half of the time and making the staff aware of this lead to some action (e.g rebooting the computers), but the problem persisted and was not addressed again. Their "business centre" had old computers running old version of internet explorer and similarly had a very poor connection....So.. perhaps bring your own computer + internet connection if you are on business.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: travelling81271
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the heart of Darling Harbour and just a 20min walk to Pitt Street and downtown Sydney. Rooms were clean and modern and relatively quiet. Would stay here again if spending the wekend in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Location to die for, rooms not so great”
Reviews.Author: teresha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Pitt for 4 nights (with 7 people) and then here for 2 nights (with 3 people). We had a Deluxe Harbour View room on the 9th floor and the view was lovely over Darling Harbour, especially at night. The room however was basicly a box. If you've been to a standard hotel in London you'll know what I mean. It needed a new paint job and was really just a "room", nothing more. We had booked the Easter Holiday package which gave us breakfast and Easter Eggs (my son said the eggs were good). The location is divine in that you have a direct walking ramp access into Harbourside and then out to Darling Harbour or to the Monorail. And it's quiet at night since you aren't downtown (unlike the Meriton which was a far superior hotel but the location meant it was noisy all night). So I finally got a good night's sleep but did feel cheated on the room. I'd recommend it for the location and quiet but nothing else. The price isn't fantastic at all so unless you get a special deal it might be better to look around at the other Darling harbour hotels (the ones that surround the Harbour - such as the Mercure, Ibis, Crown Plaza) as they'll all have the same views and be just as quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sept13th
Reviews.Content: Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour was the perfect location for my first visit to Sydney. My Husband and I were only there for 2 and half days so the quick walk to the Darling Harbour and Harbourside was excellent. The easy and close access to the Monorail and Ferries made it very easy to do a lot of sight seeing in such a short amount of time. We stayed in a Superior Darling Harbour View room which had an excellent view of the Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: paulus101
Reviews.Content: The location is hard to beat as it is right on the harbour & about 15 mins from Circular Quay/Opera House/Bridge. The hotel itself is OK, thye room we had on the 6th floor had a harbour view & was clean & kept clean during our 5 nights over NYE. The wait at reception could be long as they have a lot of aircrew staying. We didn't use the restaurant, why would you when there are so many just a few minutes walk away. We did use the bar which was quite expensive but the free internet workstations are usefule as is the complimentary coffee & juice. We did use the pool but it is quite small & busy u nless you go first thing in the morning. We did not notice any undue noise& the blackout blinds are great but beware you might sleep in later than you mean to!

Reviews.Title: “High use hotel needs the equivalent attention ...”
Reviews.Author: MrHobbs
Reviews.Content: I suppose of all the hotels I have stayed in central Sydney this would have to be one of the busiest. I need to say I think Sydney is a massively overrated city (that statement alone will attract a substantial retaliation but at least I am being candid). I stayed in the hotel frequently in 2003-4 and less most recently, but the other night I thought I would log my experience. I stayed a single night and used the global booking number, ironically the internet rate was no better than my corporate rate, not sure what that says.. maybe I should have simply walked in off the street and taken a chance .. My hunch is that I could have done just that and still fared better. I love the whole ACCOR â€œpreferredâ€� thing, proof the marketing guff I get bombarded with weekly is just that ....Guff. I booked a room non smoking with a single queens size bed via the phone service.. Did I get that?...Nope. I was pushed into a smoking room with two queenâ€™s size bed right next to the elevator. Good to see things do not change. Now to give you my views of the room and the stay; I had a room facing the back side (non water side) of the hotel this time. Concierge cleared me from the cab in 2 minutes. I came in at 9pm, the front desk process took 12 minutes, I just wanted a shower, a scrap of food in my room and sleep. The room was sound, housekeeping did a good job, but the room needed a paint job..as of Yesterday! Scuffs and smears made the white look grey. Noise from other rooms ..(â€œHow exciting to be in Sydney! !!â€�Tourists???) Made it hard to sleep although the wall thickness was not the cause, they are solid. Room service took 21 minutes, they quoted 25.. the food was of a good standard The bed was relaxing and felt firm. Check out was fast. This is a good hotel given the girth of cliental it obviously caters for but ...given a choice it not the quietest for business types if you can take or leave the Sydney factor, but it would be a goer for Tourists....enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: PJVoyageur
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights with our 2 kids in one room altogether and are very happy with this new choice.More expensive than the Mercure where we stayed last time but efficient service as well and very well located in Darling harbour closer to many attractions. and next to Ferry stops.If you choose a room with Harbour view(330Aus$ best deal)you will definitely enjoy the illuminated line of buildings in the evening(they dont seem to turn the off the lights off in those empty offices..) . Breakfast is free for children .Continental features several sorts of cereals and muesli,organic yogourt,fresh fruits;fresh squeezed fruit juice(orange,carrot,pineapple) Down the hotel,the Harbourside shopping center has a food court with delicious Indian restaurant,if you want an upscale one,Zaffran on 2nd floor is great also.A lot of restaurant with terrace overlooking the wharves are rips-off as often on touristic places especially the Italian one(dont remember the name)

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel experience ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Ozwitch
Reviews.Content: We wanted a spectacular location in Sydney, and the Novotel on Darling Harbour suited our wishes. Right above the waterfront and with lovely views of the city skyline at night. We chose a 1 bedroom suite and paid through the nose for it. It had 2 levels with main bed on upper floor like a loft. There is also a small landing outside the bedroom where you can watch tv or use your laptop if you are not sleepy, and it doesn't disturb your partner. Furnishings and decor very modern and clean, bed good. The downstairs has a lounge with bar and separate toilet. Plenty of room for 2 couples or a family if they want to sleep on the sofa. So far so good. What disappointed us was the following: Even though we had a high floor (second from top) and the view was wonderful, it was spoiled by the railed balcony which skirts all the rooms and extends some 10 feet or so out. You can't access it either. We were hoping to get some great night pictures and brought all our camera gear. We thought we'd be able to access the balcony and set up our gear. You can't. You're stuck inside the room with the balcony intruding into all your pics. So we just went down to the wharf and took pics there. The service was standard Novotel, that is, wanting. Had to wait almost an hour for our room even though we arrived during standard check-in time. Staff seemed confused, running around everywhere but not really getting anyplace. Didn't seem to be worried about us and a couple of other guests waiting and waiting for their rooms. Some of the staff simply ignored us. Parking was okay, the usual arm and a leg to stay anywhere in Sydney. You definitely need a map or satnav to find the entrance, it's tricky so be forewarned. You can walk quickly from the hotel through the walkway straight to the Darling Harbour shopping area without getting too wet if it comes down to pour, which it did. Look, the room was comfy, spacious, well laid out and relatively quiet. We had no real complaints about it. But the price they charged was not in sync with the experience we had. We were hoping for something special that we would remember. But then we remembered it was Novotel. Don't expect an experience. Expect a nice room in a chain hotel with staff who don't go out of their way to make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant is terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Springstreet77
Reviews.Content: The restaurant here, imaginatively titled, "Dish. A restaurant", has appalling service. The food was average (steak ordered MR came out well done) but the service was terrible. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Ok Hotel, Job Done”
Reviews.Author: Amunce
Reviews.Content: The Good: Great location, near to everything - 5 min taxi to harbour bridge/opera house or city center/ sydney tower. Clean Helpfull staff nice restaurant Spacious Rooms The Not so Good (not neccisarily bad though!): Facilities lacking (although comparing to UK hotels more then other Syndey hotels so please compare carefully)... I.e swimming pool, small gym, thats about it no spa, no steam room/sauna none of that.. Internet costs another $30 per day (although for 3 min walk to "harbourside" shops there is a cafe for $3 for an hour!) and breakfast wasn't included in my package- another $30 each. summary: good location and can be got for a good price of lastminute (is a secret hotel!) has everything you need, but if you want the little extras you have to pay. clean and friendly staff so overall not a bad experiance!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location, pool was free***zin'. Used the food court for dining - mu”
Reviews.Author: jjjler
Reviews.Content: Friends in Aus booked this for us. We were not disappointed!! But you have to have the harbour view!!!! Would love to revisit, and would do it the same way again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; nice view”
Reviews.Author: JodieTravel01
Reviews.Content: We chose the Novotel because my husband is an Accor Adv member and the price was cheaper than a lot of other Sydney options. We may have got an even better rate on one of the last minute accommodation sites? It was a fairly easy 20 min drive from the domestic airport - a few wrong turns along the way and one way streets but we got there in the end. If you want to five star service when you arrive this IS NOT the place for you. Our experience was self service - which was fine by us. Park your car (we should have dropped our luggage off first), walk back to the entrance etc. Check in was efficient - a brief wait but nothing major. We paid to have a harbour and city view - highly recommended. Room was OK, this IS NOT a new hotel. There was a stain on the carpet, a bit of wear and tear around the bath/shower (combined). The room was small but clean and quiet, beds were comfortable, pillow menu was a nice touch. No robes and very basic toiletries. Small TV. Loved the easy access to the monorail, a few steps from the ground floor level. Runs every few minutes gave us quick and easy access to the CBD and Chinatown (highly recommended for dinner) etc. Pool was small but nice. Fitness centre looked good. In summary Darling Harbour is a nice area with good restaurants. We would probably stay here again for the location and the views.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller86
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through lastminute.com , and upgraded the suite from a standard room to a harbor view.I personally requested a high room with a good view, and was pleasantly surprised when they gave us the 9th floor (there are 10 altogether) with a FANTASTIC view. I had reservations about the standards based on reviews from this site, but I was quite impressed with the service. They catered to our requests, we're very friendly and helpful. However the room service was quite tragic. Upon ordering breakfast, we ordered 2 breakfasts and were served by someone who appears to be slightly retarded (im not joking) , and who only bought us 1 breakfast, not the two we ordered, although the bill said we were charged for two. After chasing him down, we got the 2nd, only to find that the hot breakfast was hardly cooked, i mean AT ALL. It was cold and undercooked and would've made me quite ill if i ate it. On request however they removed the breakfast from our bill, which was nice, although its a given. If you do stay and have comments or problems, I suggest seeing Jason, who we spoke with and cleared up our bill. I would stay here again, however I dont plan on ordering breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fab location!”
Reviews.Author: mischabarton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year's with my boyfriend. Great location overlooking Darling Harbour, although we had to change rooms as we had paid for a Harbour View room which at first we were not given. Very big rooms, and nice. 2 minute stroll over the bridge to the centre, and perfect location for the water taxis going round to Sydney Harbour. Perfect location. No problems whatsoever. We did not eat in the hotel, but in Darling Harbour there are loads of restaurants and bars. The Aquarium and Zoo is 2 mins away over the bridge, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Worst Service”
Reviews.Author: Y2L
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel reception I've encountered. Was given a wrong/faulty set of keys, and made to travel up and down three times between the room and the reception as they kept insisting that the keys were working fine - spent more than half an hour being locked out of our room. What makes the one-night stay worse is the most terrible reception, even when I tried to be friendly with one of the lady staff - she yawned while listening/speaking to my sister and I. So much for great hospitality. It's either a discrimination case against Asians or people who uses card memberships to earn a free night stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “like a bad dream”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled10
Reviews.Content: booked two interconecting rooms over xmas and new year ,confirmed a day before was told the exact room numbers all secure arrived and waited 1 hour at check in finally saw the consultant was told rooms ready at 3 pm it was now 1 pm returned with our 2 children at 3.30 only one room ready !!!!!at 6 pm was told we can be shifted to another hotel as the 2nd rooms occupants cant be located .after much discussion we were offered other rooms so i slept with one son and my wife with the other in seperate rooms we got nmoved the next day to one larger room with a roll away .poor service and attitude never to even walk past a bad xmas experience !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetSouthEast
Reviews.Content: We booked this a bit late (the morning we arrived at Sydney airport!) and stayed in a darling harbour view room. The view was fantastic especially at night, the beds (2 doubles and a couch) were really comfortable and the room itself was spacious and very nice. Did not eat here so cannot comment on that, the reception staff were slightly snotty towards us probably because having just flown across the world we were slightly brain dead and could not find our voucher, however they could have been a bit more welcoming! We found time to use the pool but not until it was dark! Pool was nice enough but for a 4 star pretty small but then why sit around the hotel when you are in Sydney! The location is brilliant and the view definitely worth paying for but if you are not bothered about fab views you may aswell stay in a travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MegaPearls
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on lastminute.com.au. They offer "secret hotels" at good prices, you don't find out which hotel you've got until you book it. Anyway we decided to be adventurous and used this option. The location was good. Unfortunately we did not get a room with a view, we had a noisy street beside our window instead. My advice: if you are booking this hotel for the splendid views, make sure you get a harbourside room BEFORE you get to the hotel. We asked if there were rooms available on the other side, were told yes, but were also informed that it would cost 60 extra Aussie dollars per night. We decided not to pay any more for the room as we had the views during a previous visit to another hotel on the other side of the harbour (Four Points by Sheraton - definitely recommended :-)). The staff were not over friendly, which is unusual for Australian hotels. The internet is definitely over-priced. We didn't eat in the hotel at all, we decided to eat in the Harbourside mall across the bridge. You can get all kinds of food in the foodhall in the basement. It's well priced and a 5 minute walk from the hotel room. Access to the harbour is great from this hotel. I would recommend eating at JORDAN'S seafood restaurant if you want to enjoy some good food. Definitely book in advance, it's always busy. The food there is not cheap, but it's worth it. You can also have breakfast in and around the harbour. There is a Morrocan/ Australia retaurant which I would also recommend for dinner in the evenings close to the hotel, it's called SUMAC. The staff are really lovely and the food is great (try the chocolate cupcakes for desert, if you love food like me you will love these). Get one to share though if you have had a main course! Back to the hotel... I would stay here again if I got good rates, but I would not pay big money for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour View Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ICANGOCALIFORNIA
Reviews.Content: First of all, I read all the reviews and they were pretty much right on. I can't say enough about the harbor view, WOW! The pictures are accurate for decor, but watch out for room size. Harbor view rooms come with two double beds or 1 queen with a chair. Ours did not have a couch (as shown in pictures on site) and only the upgraded rooms come with increased size, day couch with two double beds. There is a big difference is size of rooms. I must say thought that the bed was one of the softest I have ever slept on with the exception of Sheraton's. We could actually get a good night's sleep! This hotel has a fantastic location with the monorail just outside, Harborside Mall right in front and close proximity to all major attractions such as Maritime Museum, Aqarium and Wildlife World, Imax, Convention Center, Chinese Gardens, etc, etc, within walking distance. Walk across bridge to access the Ferries which take you to Circular Quay main ferry bldg. , Sydney Opera House, and departures to all other sites such as Manley and Bondi beach, and Taronga Zoo. Back to the hotel, the concierge was not helpful at all. There were two older gentlement who did not seem to want to be bothered and were not very knowledgable at all. There were two younger gentlemen later in the week at the desk who were wonderful. Coupons are available but you need to ask. Free pictures with Koala's at Taronga Zoo ($20 value each), and numerous others. Pick up the guide and coupon book from the Airport just as you get off. There are lots of coupons in there which you will use. The housekeeping staff consisted of some of the friendliest people I have ever met! Ask for A/C converter at front desk. Check ALL electric/electronic devices for 110-240 current capabilities or your devices will burn up! They also seem to have a hard time putting guests into rooms early so let them know in advance. Housekeeping seems to only clean in the afternoons; many had to wait hours for their rooms on early arrivals. The view at night, dusk, morning, rain or shine never ceased to capture our awe. We found ourselves just sitting and staring at the view. Darling Harbor is beautiful and at night? Inspiring! We spend two weeks there visiting everything available, reviews of Sydney to follow....

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: dagobert
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed 3 nights in this hotel in march 2008. We choose it because of the ratings we read in tripadvisor. Overall i must say, that it is was a good choice. The hotel is located in darling harbour, so you are just in a few minutes in the center of sydney. The furniture in the hotel is o.k.. Breakfast in the hotel is a litlle overpriced, so we eat outside in the restaurants in the nearby mall. i want to thank the both concierges, who helped us very intensiv to get back our baggage, which was lost.

Reviews.Title: “High standards for a Novotel”
Reviews.Author: bearpackers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night over easter weekend. Hotel was pretty busy, but staff were very attentive. Room was massive and renovated with huge daybed. Bed itself wasnt that comfortable with felt like a double and not queen like they said. It was a bit odd the hotel had a pokie room next to reception with no bar, just pokies.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: cornish007
Reviews.Content: A poor hotel. Rude staff. No facilities to speak of. I left a package to be delivered to a colleague's room and it was never seen again. Rock hard bed, lurid coloured room. Great location though. So forget about the hotel and wander down the quay for a beer or two.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Beds!”
Reviews.Author: moodaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a convenient location but it ends there. Concierge were not too helpful getting us a taxi...which was took ages to arrive even if you book in advance. The room was nice but the beds were too soft it was so uncomfortable. You will not get a good night's sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kevinl31
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Novotel around 4pm and were promptly checked in. The decor in the lobby gave a good indication as to what we could expect in the rest of the hotel. This place in need of a major overhaul as it is somewhat tired looking and very dark. The room was adequate and the view was spectacular, which more than made up for the lack of decorum. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and full of information about the area. The 4 days we stayed were enjoyable and we would return if the major renovation is done as they indicated it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Excellant Facilities, Quiet Rooms,”
Reviews.Author: RoyPartington
Reviews.Content: I can be contacted regarding any of my hotel - location reviews. If your visiting the east coast of Australia click on my profile to see other hotels we visited. We stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour Sydney last of all while touring the East Coast of Australia and it was great to find somewhere where you could get a great sleep with no one next door or above or below you keeping you awake with their noise. The blackout blind is the business, roll it down during the day time and you cant see your hand infront of you, so great for getting a lie in. DEFINATELY 100% ask for a room with a Harbour side view as the view is better than looking on some boring road which you get in the other rooms. Everything about the room was bang on the money, Clean, tidy, cleaned everyday, beds were really comfy could of stayed snuggled up in them all day, furniture bang upto date, modern decoration, all the mod cons, Mini bar which had the prices clearly marked, modern TFT TV not that we used it, wired internet access or wireless internet so you have a few options for internet usage with other providers. all in all nothing what so ever to complain about in the room, bang on the money for us.
