Rest of hotel Reception The staff were extremely helpful well presented and professional, not the usual stuffy type that look down there noses at you or dont have a laugh with you in these large nice hotels. The wife hurt her leg in one of the revolving doors, for some reason, best known to her she decided to try and get through the door while the gap was no more than 6 inches as it was closing, (dont ask) the automatic motion detectors never detected her foot in the door and continued closing and trapped her foot. She ended up with a nasty cut in her foot, the hotel first aiders and senior management were there in a flash and could not of done anymore to be more attentive if they had tried. They were extremely professional having a full blown first aid kit which would not of looked out of place in an ambulance. The revolving door was immediately turned off and stayed off all day while engineers checked it over. I cant comment on the food or sports/leisure facilites as we never used them, we dont go on holiday to sit in a hotel or use its leisure facilities or restaurants, we go to experiance what the local destination has to offer so we always go out to local attractions etc, you can go to any Accor Hotel anywhere in the world but theres only one sydney so we prefer to use a nice comfy hotel as a base to explore and this hotel certainly met our expectations. We noticed the week we visited was cheaper than when we 1st arrived in sydney 3 weeks earlier, so it may be worth you checking differant dates prices out. LOCAL ATTRACTIONS Monorail. Is right outside the hotel so its easy to hop on and off, For the woment check out the monorail stop of Paddies Market obviously a big market, it also goes to china town and right into the CBD Central Business District and simply does a large loop, Pubs/Bars Families We found families are catered for well in many parts of sydney with regard to eating and drinking, however on the night time unless you are having a meal its pretty hard to simply walk in with the kids for a drink so simply walk in and ask for chips or something small and grab yourself a drink, APART FROM the Darling Harbour area which of course is where the Novotel is located, they have differant rules in darling harbour for kids as its the main tourist area but you still had to be out by 10pm at the latest with Kids, APART FROM the Pyrmont Bridge Hotel, pyrmontbridgehotel.com which we found to be the closest to an english pub in the central CBD area. To find the Pyrmont Bridge Hotel Bar, simply use the Novotels main back door entrance which goes onto the road out the back, turn right so your going down the slight hill and the Pyrmont comes up on your left, take the kids up stairs and you get a great view from their conservatory with pool tables and quizs and food etc and the owner is a really funny character on the microphone cracking jokes with everyone and walking round taking the mickey out of everyone, if your english like us he loves it if you call yourself a pommy and he can take having the mickey taken out of him by you calling him a convict (sorry its an enland v australia thing), its also extremely popular downstairs for singles and couples as its on a busy walkway. Ferries If you want to get a ferry you need to go round to Circular Quay, There are yellow water taxis outside the Novotel right in darling harbour, however as they charge by the person it works out cheaper to simply ask the hotel concierge to grab you a hotel and nip round to circular quay, costs next to nothing. Circular Quay and the Bridge area are where all the ferries are and the Opera House, Check out the Manly ferry and Manly beach its better than Bondi beach after getting off the manly ferry just walk straight across the road down the pedestrianized zone and you will come to the actual beach, most people think the beach either side of the ferry at manly is the correct manly beach its not, walk through the shopping area opposite the ferry terminal. Manly is where they have the aquarium where you can dive with sharks which is what I did. Google SYDNEY SHARKDIVE Opera House and Bridge Photograph For that Spectacular Family Photo with the Opera House behind you and the Sydney Harbour Bridge behind the Opera house all in the same shot, you need to go to Mrs Macquaries Chair, as you look at the opera house in front of you its the green park over to your right and you can easily walk round to it, There are professional photographers there up the top section who for $10AUD will print you out a professional photo taken by them so you know you are getting that once in a lifetime moment captured professionally, get them to copy it to CD or onto your own cameras memory card so you can then print it yourself and email it later, makes more sense as you only get one printed copy otherwise from them, this way you get the photo they have just taken of you on your memory card to print out as many times as you want etc, I asked them and they gladly put my cameras memory card into there laptop and copied the photo they had just taken of us to my cameras memory card which was great as I can now get it printed out at differant sizes etc and framed. Also use Google earth to see just how close Hotels etc are to the centre of towns/cities you are visiting, we found it to be invaluable in making sure we were not stuck in the middle of no where. If your visiting the east coast of Australia click on my profile to see other hotels we visited. I hope this has given you food for thought and possibly some GOOD tips and ideas. Have a fantastic holiday as its an absolutely fantastic country australia and the people are extremely friendly and honest, its also the only place we have visited where the wife never ever felt intimidated in any of the places we visited so they must be doing something right. Dont miss Steve Irwins Australia zoo if you go to Brisbane its unmissable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TubbyDuck
Reviews.Content: If location and convenience were the sole criteria for choosing a Sydney hotel, then the Novotel would do well given Darling Harbour's proximity to the CBD, shops, Circular Quay and other main attractions (the monorail passes in front of the hotel and the ferry service is a short walk away). Otherwise, without anything being truly awful, the public areas seem a little tired, the staff less than enthusiastic (messages left at reception were not passed on) and the leisure facilities (especially the swimming pool) inadequate for the size of hotel. The high cost of internet access from rooms is a disappointment. Rooms and bathrooms are kept satisfyingly clean though and are adequately comfortable. Harbour view rooms are the better option. Easy access to quayside bars, restaurants and cafÃ©s makes the need to rely upon the same facilities at the hotel redundant. A special deal might make booking the hotel worthwhile (especially for families).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Merseydiver
Reviews.Content: We wanted a lightening quick stopover in Sydney for just two nights to take a quick look at the city. Crammed in a couple of ferry rides, a trip round QVB and a journey to the top of the tower. All in all a beautiful view of the harbour from our room overlooking the harbour, room only. Restaurants in front of the hotel were excellent, sampling Japanese and what must be the best fish and chip shop I've ever been in - Jordans Seafood Restaurant - well worth a visit. Sky train stops just outside the hotel so you can jump on and get off a the Queen Victoria Building which is worth a visit then jump a bus to Circular quay for a ferry. Take the local ferry and then jump on the Manley ferry for a more relaxed sail. Sydney is a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect anything special, standard Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Weneedatan
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price for location. Rooms nice (views at back of hotel poor) Bed good. Clean. Pool area a waste of time Good location on doorstep of Darling Harbour. Food places around Harbour not great food and expensive (world city). Nothing special but no problems. Trip to Manly on ferry lovely. Manly beach nice. Opera House a good trek from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A little Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: kazkap
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from an overnight stay at The Novotel Darling Harbour. We stayed with our 2 young children in a deluxe harbour view room. Rooms have been refurbished and are very light and comfortable. The room was clean and well appointed with fantastic views. You are truly paying for the excellent location and outlook. The room was a semi 'L' shape so a sitting/workspace area was into the corner. There were 2 LCD TV's (one adjacent to the beds and the other in the lounge area) which turned out to be handy as we were able to put the boys to bed undisturbed and enjoy staying up, catching the views and watching some TV, relaxing! Staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was nice, a great start for a busy day. A definite plus was the block out shutter, no noise and total darkness. This little beauty helped us keep our young children asleep till gone 8.30am. A sleep in, What a bonus! Overall we really enjoyed our stay, but it was expensive. However, it is nice to treat and pamper yourself every now and then!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming staff, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: David_Susie
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on a regular basis. It is well appointed, large rooms, clean and very comfortable and has its own parking area. It is located in Darling Harbour with direct undercover access to a range of restaurants and bars. If you have booked the cheaper Pyrmont view room you might want to ask for an upgrade to a harbour view room (they might just oblige) it is much nicer. Don't bother with the restaurant in the hotel. You will find much better value with one of the restaurants lining the harbour (although they do not stay open very late during the middle of the week - if that's the case go for the room service).

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but good location”
Reviews.Author: janwilson
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel, dont expect any special treament as there are so many quest's. The rooms are adequite and clean, I recommend you push the boat out and have a harbour view room, the view at night is awsome. Don't waste your money on the breakfast, the restaurants on Darling Harbour will provide anything you want at half the price and great atmosphere. Same again for diner, if you want a change from DH then China Town is only a short walk accross the harbour where you can sit outside and soak in the atmosphere. Directly behind the Novotel there is a 24 hour mini market with cheap internet access. A short walk down the road from there is the casino and Lyric Theatre (we saw Miss Saigon), where there is more shops and reastuarants. After staying in Sydney for 6 days and exploring all areas I doubt this hotel can't be beaten for location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ka7i3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe harbour view room. It was very modern and had a beautiful room of darling harbour and the city. Great location for people who have a short amount of time to see a lot of sydney. It is conveniently located in Darling Harbour and a short walk from the Casino. It is also located on the monorail which makes getting into town even easier than walking. If your wanting to keep the price down this might not be the place for you, but thats the same with most upmarket accommodation in Sydney. Concerge and reception were great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: firebucket
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour for work reasons in October 2007. I wanted to stay somewhere close to Wentworth Park in Glebe and this fitted the bill excellently as it was a less than 10 minute walk. This hotel is large and conveniently located in Darling Harbour directly behind the large shopping Centre on the western side. A short walk will take you to a small supermarket, food court, specialty shops and Star City Casino. I stayed in a Harbour View Room which was modern, well lit and had a lovely view to the east looking at city lights. The bathroom was OK, nothing special, with toiletries provided. No balcony. Flat Screen TV, internet connection and good black out curtains completed the package. Recreational Facilities were pretty basic. Small unheated outside pool (cold), tennis court and small gym facility. Breakfast Buffet was the usual fare with nothing to write home about. I think it was about $30 pp and overpriced as usual. In hindsight I would walk the 100 metres down to the food court and get something better for less. All in all a good hotel, doing most things right. Not worth over $200 a night though, but good if you can get it for less. Very Similar in standard to the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour and that is generally cheaper and in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PhTravelling_Guy
Reviews.Content: Incredibly good location right by Darling Harbour and easy access to the monorail. Rooms were very nice. Spectacularly clean and well furnished. The room decor was pretty nice. I remember having taken a picture of one of the black and white photographs hanging on the wall. The photo just stuck me and it was different from your average hotel painting or print. I didn't notice any real restaurant on the premises. Just a small cafe. (My room did not come with breakfast, so I didn't really look very hard.) In any case, one doesn't really need a hotel restaurant when you're right in Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; average hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEKBS
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is FABULOUS, with amazing views of Darling Harbor, and the hotel is convenient to many restaurants and museums. The front desk staff is wonderful. However, the actual hotel itself is average, at best. I had to have my bed sheets changed when I checked in, as I found hair in the sheets that was not mine! (Suggesting the bedding had not been changed.) Also, my bathroom regularly had conditioner, but no shampoo. The walls in the bathroom were stained, as well. On the plus side, when I complained, the sheets were immediately changed, and I got shampoo, but the fact that I HAD to complain is troublesome. The concierge staff....needs some classes in customer service. Other reviewers have noted that the concierge did not seem to want to bother to help them; that was my experience, as well. Overall, I might give them one more chance if I had to, but on the other hand, there are so many other wonderful hotels in the area that I would probably skip this one and stay at another.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamsiam
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Novotel when I went to Sydney for a conference. I spent most of my time at the conference for four days so I can't really comment much on the facilities. The hotel and room were in good condition and location was convenient if you had to go to the exhibition and convention centre. Monorail is in walking distance. The hotel is close to many restaurants, arcades, iMAX, and aquarium. Not sure about the price and its value as it was paid by my employer. Breakfast was good with lots to choose from. You can get free newspaper delivered to your room as in other 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: misstaryn08
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location-probably the best. My room overlooked the Darling Hrbour and the city view at night from my huge hotel window caused me to sit and stare. The room was very modern, comfortable, clean, and trendy. I wanted to take the furniture home with me! My bed was a very trendy style with solid colored decorative pillows. The sheets were amazing and the comforter was white and comfortable. The bathroom was very modern with a wonderful lighting, comfy shower, and amazing showerhead. The flat screen TV was an excellent touch-but there were very few channels. Broadband connection was not free but was affordable. I loved this room and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Dish Restaurant? Don't wast your money......”
Reviews.Author: Coolangatta_Kid
Reviews.Content: Booked our five nights at the Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour through wotif. Only chose this option as Saturday night seemed to have no rooms available when booking direct with Novotel. Found the "Fall in love again in Sydney" package to be the best value as it included both dinner for two and breakfast. Well it turned out not to be the best choice. The dinner for two only offered a choice of either a entre & main or main & desert from the set menu.. which only had three choices... steak, fish & chicken being the mains. Had the steak the first night which was full of gristle and as tough as a slice of rubber. My partner had the chicken fillet which came with a bone and was rare. Mentioned the lack of choices to the waiter who suggest I will have to eat something twice, when I declined the wine menu we were then ignored all night. Very poor service indeed. Tried the fish the next night which was ok, my partner had the steak which was the other half of the piece of rubber I had the night before.... the next three nights we dinned elswhere. Darling Harbour has many great restaurants which are all superior and less expensive than the Dish. Whilst we had a great room with a nice view of the harbour, room servicing was a joke. Having been out all day we were very surprised to come back to an unserviced room. Had to leave the room until around 4.30pm before it was serviced. So much for a relaxing nap before dinner. Whilst some of the staff were more than hospitable, the hotel needs a lesson from the Gold Coast with regards to looking after their guests.. Will never go back to the Novotel.. This is not a 4 star hotel by my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkly Views!”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for business. The location is great - easy to walk around Darling Harbour and right at the light rail and monorail stations. The room was well appointed, good quality, everything worked properly. Decent sized. Fantastic views over Darling Harbour - looks great at night. Ordered room service and it came quickly and was really good quality food. The bed was comfy, the towels were average. All the things in the room you need - iron and board, mini bar, tea/coffee, internet, TV, very basic toiletries - in fact I didn't bother with them. the staff and the service were very good. My main complaint is the price - VERY expensive - you are paying for the view but go to the city side of the harbour and you can knock heaps off the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: Good location very close to Darling Harbour shops and restaurants. Bedrooms very well appointed; beds comfortable but fairly small. Restaurant and lounge areas were cold and unappealing and service of tea/coffee at breakfast almost non-existant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: May-Tong
Reviews.Content: The single beds look more like doubles to me. So comfortable! As mentioned by most reviews, the location is superb and the hotel is great. Most lamented the price but I got the room for a steal! With the Accord card for S$ 240, not only did I get 50% off at the restaurants but also 2 Complimentary nights for free. Even if I don't use the other privileges, per night work out to be only about A$100. Try not to drive if you're just staying in the town cos' the parking isn't free, not even if you're guest at the hotel. In the city, I don't think any of the hotel provide free parking. We regretted renting the car and had to search around for the best price parking. In the end, we found free overnight parking in one of the neighbourhood estate and park in the hotel early in morning when the special rate starts (Can't remember the timing cos' its been 7 months). But have to catch the timing for the special car park rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: po
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to the Novotel at Darling Harbour for the weekend in January for my birthday. The hotel itself is really nice and modern but we found the service to be very ordinary. My husband had called them prior to the weekend to organise for a cake, chocolates and champagne to be made available for my birthday night as a suprise and it was ruined when it was set up the minute we arrived which was not my b'day. We also had an issue with a fire door that wasnt closing properly at the end of our hallway that was making a really loud whistling noise. We had to call four times for someone to come and fix it. We also were dissapointed with the room service. When we returned from our day out, we noticed a strong cigarette smoke smell. We thought it may be coming from the air conditioning and thought, oh well. However, when we went to throw something in the bin we noticed all this cigarette ash on the floor. We had requested a non smoking room but obviously that means only the guests dont smoke but the cleaners can. Check out took forever as they only had one staff memeber on the desk and lots of people waiting to check in/out. The restaurant is way way over priced, your better off walking to the harbour and eating by the water. Overall, i have to say it is in a great great location close to the casino and monorail, etc. but the service needs to be improved in a big way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Facilities, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pihau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour in a Deluxe Harbour View room on a recent weekend away. The location is fantastic - the Darling Harbour waterfront has lots to see and do, and the monorail stops just outside so travel to the city is easy. The facilities were excellent. The rooms are modern and tidy with great views, LCD TV, fridge, etc. There is a small but well equipped gym, small swimming pool, tennis court, etc. The breakfasts are excellent. My only negative comment is that the hotel and services are a bit overpriced, eg: the room was AU$289 p/n, continental breakfast was AU$45 for 2 people (more to have the cooked selection). Overall a nice hotel, but I think there is better value for money to be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Dutto
Reviews.Content: We booked a Harbour View Deluxe room, located on the 4th floor after reading many reviews on Trip Advisor site. We knew that the price was high, but the location is superb. Monorail and light rail literally at the door, 3 convenience stores within 1-2 minutes walk Star City 5 minutes down the road major shopping precinct just over the foot bridge from the ground level car park. The deluxe room was very clean and modern. The only problem I had with paying the high price is that the standard of service drops considerably when they get busy (also noted on another review). Some examples: My wife was stuck in the shower Friday night until our towels were delivered to the room (not replaced by room service). When they arrived, the staff were also delivering to the other 4th floor rooms at 6pm. The towels where warm (fresh from the laundry room I presume). On the same busy Friday night, the concierge tried to book a cab which that didnâ€™t turn up. Finally waved my own cab down after 20 minutes and was told by the cabby that bookings donâ€™t exist on Friday evenings as services are stretched. On returning to our room early hours of Saturday morning, both room keys were inoperative â€“ locking us out. Reception blamed us for passing by a magnetic field or something similar. I was too tired at argue. We must have passed by the concierges on the ground floor some 20 times during our 5 day stay, not one gave us eye contact or said hello. This I must admit is the first time that I have stayed in a hotel where the concierge seemed reluctant to be seen as approachable - pity. Overall, I rated the stay fair , but if they werenâ€™t located so strategically I would be avoiding them next time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother paying for Deluxe!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonAlex
Reviews.Content: I've visited Sydney a number of times on business and chose this hotel because of its location and outlook over the city and Darling Harbour. A Deluxe Harbour View room was booked to ensure we got the best possible room/location. On check in we were allocated a room with a small window, a wall where the harbour view should have been and a view over a conference centre and motorway flyover. When we complained we were allocated a 'standard' harbour view room. The first room allocated was certainly not 'Deluxe', only a little larger than the standard room we changed to due to the way the hotel was built. A receptionist said she would get the room manager or front office manager to get in touch with us before we left. This did not happen. I'm not sure if the hotel think that as we were 'leisure' customers we would accept the situation but I can assure you the room they tried to allocate us as 'Deluxe Harbour View' and the service provided was not up to scratch. I believe the hotel acts dishonestly in the way they sell this type of upgraded room. The fact that the staff did not even bother to get a manager to talk to us says volumes about the attitude of staff and the type of establishment this hotel really is. I would not recommend it to anyone. Additionally I also have some concerns about the hygiene in the restaurant. The blue/beige carpet has obviously been designed to be as practical as possible for a large hotel. Unfortunately as a result, from a distance it looks acceptable but as soon as you sit at a table and look down you realise how many stains there are. Not very appetising.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Cariesp
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Syd for our anniversary and we stayed at this hotel and had a fabulous time. The hotel is clean and pretty quiet. Very close to the monorail and light rail(tram). Out the back of the hotel across the road is a 24 hour convenience store (which I loved having). Easy walk to Star City (the casino) and a lovely walk into the city (15-20mins). We also caught a ferry from Darling Harbour around to Circular Quay (where all the ferries leave from) and from there we caught a Ferry to Manly. What a lovely day trip. The hotel room was large enough but very well maintained. Plenty of room in the bathrooms and on the last day (which was a Tuesday) we asked for a late check out 1pm and they happily obliged which was fantastic. That way we could pop into the city and shop and then come back to hotel and pack and check out for our late afternoon flight. Perfect!! Hotel has a small pool (but it has a great view), a tennis court (yes I hit a few over the walls!) some pokies (didn't pay out for us) and a lovely buffett breakfast (make sure if you want your eggs done specifically then ask for them.) I didn't know that until after I had eaten and I would have loved poached eggs. Overall the hotel and their service was wonderful. We also had booked for a Pyrmont (city) view room and we asked for a Harbour View room and they happily changed that for us at no extra cost. Probably because the hotel wasn't at full capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamLady
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, there is lots happening on Darling Harbour, lots of bars and restaurants etc. The monorail is right outside which takes you around Sydney and you can also get around on foot from here aswell. The queue for breakfast was quite long but the food was good. Rooms were basic but modern and clean. There is also a nice bar area which has a view over the harbour. Definately reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Not All It Should Be”
Reviews.Author: zanetti
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in between Christmas and New Year. Rooms were lovely, had a great view over Darling Harbour, and the location was great. However, there was always a queue at reception any time I had to speak to someone there and the bar closed early in the evening. On one occasion, we returned from dinner around 10:40 and asked for a drink to be told the bar was closing as it had been very quiet all evening. I pointed out there were nearly 30 people in the bar. The bar manager said most had only recently arrived. When I said that surely that was all the more reason the bar should remain open for a while he blanked me and closed the bar anyway. So, great hotel to stay in from the point of view of location, cleanliness and price but do your eating and drinking somewhere your custom will be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: AinemcIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New years eve and few nights in January. Location is fantastic and the rooms were well equipped and comfortable. We didnt have a view but the rooms were nice and quiet. Would definately recommend this for anyone visiting Sydney for short staay. Will be back.

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour
HotelInfo.Address: 100 Murray Street | Darling Harbour, Pyrmont, Sydney, New South Wales 2009, Australia
